aN32OVlwxSf8kA1IyCByzA.text: Had to try it out based off reviews amd we were not disappointed! Food was amazing!! Fresh coffee!!! Outdoor seating for dogs and non smoking!!!

D44C3Tmd6YF-VREWzaPEkw.text: It's always a good time at scramble and great food. The only thing I would change is open earlier. I would imagine you could probably do a good business if you opened it 2 o'clock in the morning just kidding. Good maybe 5 o'clock and be nice but I'm kind of an early riser but anyway I always love going up there for breakfast keep up the good work

s8zGRNHgtI73w52QAF0PMQ.text: Scramble is my new go to for PHX breakfast. I seem to obsess over my breakfast places and my new one is Scramble. Being a Irish white guy with latin tastebuds Scramble was the perfect place for me. If you crave breakfast burritos and you're not in San Diego I would recommend Scramble.   Multiple options for bb's ranging from chorizo with jalapeno sour cream to your basic gringo bacon and egg bb. I also love how they will happily adjust your order to your liking. If you want egg whites or crispy potatoes they will accommodate all of your requests.   Seating doesn't seem to be a problem even on a Sunday morning. 12:00pm is still morning for me on Sunday btw.

AUuJB03YB8Ov9emO_TJHlw.text: The worst place for breakfast on Sunday. You could see over half the tables inside were unoccupied and two dozen customers were standing in line waiting to be seated. Being one of the last people to arrive we were standing outside in the heat. Did not wait.

voQESOHcYjFLWCV0i2pOcw.text: Loved the first visit with the The Toluca Brizza (breakfast pizza); not impressed with the burrito next visit. Cool little place worth the visit. I'd take my friends here.

FUDrtgy3ne_7bkUWXtGk6w.text: Hey Yall...I would consider this place ok...take notice of the lowercase lettering and short cut of ok....The best thing about this place was the decor and friendly guy outside giving away free tea and coffee while you wait. Now don't get me wrong the line was pretty quick and the Martinelli Apple Juice rocked. I got the 3 Cheese Omelet with cheddar, jack and herb cheese it was ok, can't go wrong with cheeses right. I also had hashbrowns that were pretty tasty they could have been better if they were completely done. Instead of the tell I was able to opt out for 3 silver dollar pancakes they're on the same level as IHOP thick and lacking flavor the syrup nothing special at all I've had better at McDonalds. Oh yeah I almost forgot to mention my turkey bacon Oh maybe because they forgot to send it out with my order and when I did remind them and it finally arrived it was time for me to go.

_D1AzX40Q_uyVKecTJR_DQ.text: Amazing breakfast spot and perfectly located in north central Phoenix.  Not only is Scramble dog friendly but they are near North Mountain which I routinely hike.  We always go grab a bite to eat and enjoy the lovely AZ weather on the patio.  Lets not forget the yummy menu either.  Yum yum!!

O0-2pSq3BYbvEETMadGMag.text: Great breakfast.  Service was fast and food was hot and tasty.  They are busy so go early.  French toast is unique and yummy.

K8fwwW8RDPVUSL16aSHgAw.text: I love Scramble. Tucked away just north of Dunlap on 7th Street, Scramble is the perfect weekend brunch spot. With a casual and vibrant atmosphere, you will feel comfortable & welcomed. They have a great menu at very reasonable prices and the staff is always super friendly (and helpful when you need food suggestions!) Check it out!

K8V2dN-viNZptuKBxZ1Hew.text: I got the Mushroom & Bacon omelette. The bf got the Costa Burrito. Both were delish! First time here and the cashier was glad to show us how it works. Would definitely come back.

Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mushroom &amp; Bacon omelette.

2nTlZqwCIbitxjpo_DzmKQ.text: I tried Scramble because they were one of the sponsors for the St Mary's canned food drive. It looked as if they had turned over the whole place for the drive, even offered a 2 for 1meal  ticket for people who made canned goods donations. I always feel rushed when you have to order at the cashier station but the gal who took the orders was patient and very nice.  I order the mushroom, bacon and jack cheese omelette, it was presented nicely with rosemary potatoes and toast. Toast was burned but replaced quickly. My mister ordered a BLT with Applewood bacon on a fresh baquette. Standard fare, but  well done.  American coffee was excellent. How great that I could get breakfast at noon.  Looking at the printed menu, I see I am coming back for the french toast and will try the vegan breakfast. I also like that they use local markets and farmers.   It was very clean and the patio looked inviting.

8V8TjNE_1kwZ53gqw3BjOA.text: After a good hike this is one of the best places for a good vegan breakfast. The food is always good  and the young man outside had A+ service. I wish I got his name to give him a cuddos. He was a younger African American gentelman. He deserves a raise or maybe even run the place some day.

YCPJvfCeFDztOFOydoIV6g.text: The food is good and the atmosphere is (mostly) quite nice but the wait is horrible.   I was there on Saturday around 9:00am and there were close to 30 people in line but only a single cash register open. Most of the seats were still available inside but the management only had a single person taking orders and a bunch of staff waiting around. Either they don't know their business or they have trouble running a business since they happens repeatedly.  My other beef with them are the hugely uncomfortable metal chairs that are inside. My god, these are the most uncomfortable chairs that I have ever sat in! While they look nice, they were clearly bought by a short person with an ample sized rear end. For everyone else, the chairs are agony to sit in. I suspect that these chairs were bought to make sure that people didn't linger but they are hugely uncomfortable.

LWdcgMS13kFM02zhedWAPA.text: Awesome food it was made fresh tasted really good, great service very good customer service people were very nice. ORANGE juice is the bomb would definitely make a trip to go again.

S3tx7t2VgANRrPc2ZkR3lg.text: I adored this place.  What brought us to it in the first place was the vegan subset of the menu. I really love it when a place can accommodate both vegans and their omni friends.  It means they're sensitive to everyone's needs.    I had the vegan french toast.  It was very good. They even had vegan margarine.  My companion had a scramble hew was also happy with.  They had great coffee and reasonable prices.    Can't complain and look forward to going back!

EkwAqjM07-DZ7If9qVauhg.text: If you're vegan this place is horrible!! I'm so disappointed. This is the first place I've seen that has vegan specific breakfast and it's awful. I had the soyrizo burrito, side of wheat pancakes and coffee, my mom had the mushroom spinach tofu scramble and tea. The burrito was so spicy that it literally hurt my mouth and throat. The pancakes were very undercooked. The coffee was watery. The scramble tasted like someone dumped an entire pepper shaker on it. The toast was dry. The sweet potato hash was tasteless and mushy. The tea was boring. Food was way too expensive. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND DON'T GO HERE!!! The only good part of the whole meal was that the manager refunded half our bill and gave us a coupon for two free entrees.

y8Bc1vPxpmEauIsYtRujbw.text: Used google maps + yelp to find a nearby breakfast spot to Point Hilton Squaw Peak. We were the second people in on a Saturday morning at 6:30am (early risers due to diff time zone), and were very pleasantly surprised by very friendly staff and endless fun & healthy options.  We had a breakfast sandwich, "brizza", and multigrain apple pancakes. Everything was well prepared and flavorful. Will definitely return!

N_2D0wdaLTv75JREArb7BA.text: So one of  those many days when I am just waking up but craving breakfast and saw that this place was open until 2 on Sunday.  So walked in and didn't expect a fast food type of ordering system....... Look at menu, walk to counter, order and pay, find a place to sit  So it was a lil awkward at first because I'm trying to skim through the menu quickly to order and not stand there like I'm looking at Xmas lights  So went for the two eggs ur way with toast hashbrowns, bacon, dollar sized multi grain pancakes, and French toast.  All but hashbrowns were good. I wish they had country potatoes as an option. Hashbrowns had an oily aftertaste to them.  All in all would comeback ...loved d French toast but next time would educate myself w the menu so I can order right away  Dress code: casual

2V-ES-_whmMc2RhP9B65NA.text: Awesome food!  We're from MN and were craving a good breakfast. This is it, and then some.  My wife said the berrie pancakes were good but "too fancy". Ha!!! We agreed to disagree on that.

b6ARs4vpsq4d4PGOIdhSMQ.text: The food is pretty good, definitely above the average and has some different choices. I've had the eggs benedict and costa breakfast burrito (chorizo) and both hit the spot. Very fresh and tasty and the coffee is quite good.   But what really sets this place apart is the dining experience. I really enjoy the fast casual set up--order, take a number, get your coffee, juice, etc., and wait for your food. There are plenty of tables and the system runs smoothly and efficiently. This process makes me want to go here more than other breakfast places, even ones that may have slightly better food. At the end of the day I don't want to wait an hour no matter how good your frittata is.

xLfUTN49MHpaRNIkFYo6gg.text: I love this place! I got the vegan veggie scramble as well as a veggie scramble with egg whites on separate occasions. Lunchtime gets quite busy. Otherwise, Scramble is amazing! Delicious, fresh food in a modern atmosphere. Somewhat self serve but everything comes out hot.

WE-iOSZCmyzQFOc6ff3-RA.text: I used to love Scramble, but they have taken their rosemary potatoes off their menu which was a primary item I personally loved and made them different from other breakfast places. It's now IHOP type food. Their eggs are very bland as well, Scramble has definitely changed.

OkY1fD_L31aQxOlPLCP24w.text: Scramble's is one of our favorite breakfast joints. My favorite is the SW burrito.  The place is very contemporary.

rzIQYXfclO_VhfQzEWGt_Q.text: So friends and I had been meaning to try this place out for a while and we had finally gotten a chance to go.  It's setup very familiar to a Pei Wei almost where you have your menu off to the side of the queue and approach the counter to order before taking a number and your seat.  The establishment was very clean and well lit as well as having a pretty nice quiet atmosphere.  I think it was like a Wednesday morning if my memory serves me right.  I ordered the French Toast and a Martinelli's Applejuice from the quite attractive young lady that was working the register.  I took my number to a table that was half seats half bench and my friends shortly followed suit.  A random conversation about iPads later and out food had arrived.  The French Toast was actually Baguettes that had been Frenchtoastified and they were delicious.  I also got some rosemary potatoes which were a little too rosemary for my taste, and s couple pieces of cherrywood smoked bacon.    Now if you've read any of my previous reviews you might have gathered that I'm rather picky about bacon.  This stuff however was amazing.  Thickly cut and perfectly crisp without being hard or chewy.  I'd definitely say that I'd take Cherrywood smoked bacon over Applewood any day of the week.  Prices were good, I think it came out to like 15 after tip.  Overall if I am able to drag myself outta bed early enough again I'd definitely take another visit.

7tKQ_HZDVJPZH6BwZ0Tgxw.text: Had to wait 40 minutes in a line to order...while meanwhile the restaurant had many, many empty tables.  Food was good....but certainly not worth the wait.  They need a new and more efficient system.

36-ukHc_E3dYEY9REHtBrQ.text: Compared to others in the area, Scramble beats all competitors.  The menu is varied enough to please everyone.  Brizza (breakfast pizza) is unique. You order like you do at Paradise or Wildflower and the food comes to the table, which you have chosen.  Patio is nice weather permitting.  Coffee refills--self service.  Ambience is excellent for the area--close to where we like to hike.  Lots to like about this place.

FTCb-4IFvoceNQtHel8IIA.text: I really liked this place a lot.  Very casual...tv's with news crankin', lots of seating, and just a nice place to getaway.  Kinda reminds me a little of Pei Wei...take your order at the front, pay and grab your number...go sit down.  Nice area for coffee and whatever else you need...easy access to everything you need.  Utensils, napkins, jellies, all the goodies. I had just a plain breakfast which, surprisingly enough, most people seem to screw up pretty bad.  2 eggs over medium, rosemary potatoes, bacon, and white toast.  Loved it...loved it...loved it.

BAte79wqEmEp76R9weU1PQ.text: This place is amazing for breakfast. I would recommend going early as it gets busy as the morning progresses. They have a great selection of food. The staff is friend and sitting outside is a must on nice days.

5-kJGAqrZvP-1oiDNpOtTw.text: I had high hopes for this place. I love breakfast so a place with the meal in the name surely would be good at it, right? My experience was mostly good. Service was slow, as noted in the other reviews. They don't seem to know how to do two eggs over medium as mine had runny white. This was especially annoying to me since they have a poster by the cash register plainly describing what each egg style meant, and "over medium" doesn't mean runny whites. Once they fixed that on my order, the food was decent. I love that they're dog friendly - they even offered a water bowl for ours. If you're new to this place, be prepared to feel like a noob as you try to figure out the coffee area. I suppose after a few visits, we too can look down on the newbies who don't know how the island area works. Overall, I like this place and will be giving it another try, even though the prices are a little higher than diners.

RvqY21kgweVvxNe09pfO8g.text: Good oj. Good pizza sample. The cafeteria style is kinda cool but usually it can be so busy that its frustrating! The bacon is very thick which is a great change compared to all the greasy spoon breakfast joints. The oatmeal is good and hugely proportioned. The french toast is yummy as are the simple breakfast meals. The red potatoes are great!! It has a vegan menu as well. I usually get the iced teas they have on the counter which I think are great! The service is always great and I haven't really had any disappointing visits, can't wait to come back!

G5iMpJR7ztWJ7-ZdeH0dMg.text: If Scramble was closer to the down town area, I'd frequent this place more often. Free Wifi & flat screens make time go by quickly when waiting for your food to arrive.

JfjZdUlLaHyRV-w4H7V83A.text: I will make this short and sweet since everything there is to say about Scramble has already been said. One word - Sweet Potato Hash. Sweet baby Jesus that is some good eats. What I loved even more was the fact that I was able to substitute it for my regular potatoes for no extra charge. Sweet. Sadly this will become a regular spot for me after my hike up North Mountain on any given Saturday. Tsk, tsk, tsk!

RIFKOv3l1hmhz8gbieasRw.text: Good neighborhood breakfast joint. Great value, nice outdoor patio, friendly staff.

AYUXKS11jzLQLj5_ucL2Sw.text: Scramble is a business catered towards the breakfast experience (reminds me of Snooze in Denver/SD) and it sure delivers. Great good , great ambiance and pleasant service. They even have Brizza- short for breakfast pizza !

nDc6Vs7QMMIxb87N-VQtDQ.text: Great personality takeoff our order. line was long but move fairly quickly.  French toast is very good.  Bagels and lox had great portion. I had the phx omelette that tasted very fresh.

QlLLyME6EFnUaiYQu6L5xQ.text: My husband and I have a home in Montana and Arizona. We consider the Sunnyslope  Scramble our local breakfast place. We meet or bring family and friends with us. Providing welcoming staff, coffee and water at the door on the weekends makes standing in line pleasant. A must have is the French toast with fruit, but what ever you order will be tasty.

be2mWtsVaOmQhTheb3zT7A.text: Didn't really like the place so I'll make this quick. The husband and I got steak and eggs and my little one got the dollar pancakes. The steak was dry and pretty tasteless and the eggs were just eggs nothing special. I had to put a lot of Cholula sauce in order for my meal to taste ok. The pancakes my little one had were a little rubbery and not that good. The only thing she ate were the contents of her fruit cup but come on! you cant really mess that up. We left feeling unsatisfied and cheated out of a good meal.Dont know what the fuss is about but I know we wont be back.

-yCbTEDT3si_trumuFo6xA.text: I live walking distance from Scramble and let me tell you, that is a scary thought. I eat there way too often. I love their breakfast burritos because their hearty and flavorful unlike the run of the mill kind at other places. I've also gotten the breakfast pizza and a turkey club. Both were good, but the Costa breakfast burrito is still my favorite. The ambience is so relaxing and the staff is always friendly. Only problem that took a whole star off is the price. Being a broke college kid, I wish they had some items that were a bit more affordable. But nonetheless, I still love this place. Definitely a great place to stop after hiking North Mountain.

sMMKZMQNzHtdFR6aJjOE0g.text: This was my favorite breakfast place in Phoenix.  Often when I have breakfast out I end up feeling over sated and a little greasy: from the eggs and potatoes or the extra rich pancakes.  I didn't feel that way at all after eating at Scramble.  I had an excellent veggie scramble  with good sourdough toast.  The coffee was a strong, dark roast that I enjoyed, though a little too strong for me to love it.  There's free WiFi and a cheerful atmosphere.  It's casual dining (order at the counter, food brought to your table).  I wish there was a Scramble close to my home in California.  If there were, I'd go there often.

ra2H9RQ-X4-PKwBIQl-6Kw.text: It's a walk in, order, then sit down style. I got a breakfast burrito and a black coffee which came to slightly over $11. The burrito was virtually flavorless, but the coffee was good. Crowded seating in my opinion. However, the staff were super friendly and helpful :)

vr-wxKS-v0MSfpQO30kC2Q.text: We were looking for something light, quick and good before hitting up the Phoenix Zoo and my sister had the perfect suggestion: Scramble.  She said there wouldn't be a wait--unlike most breakfast places on a Saturday morning. I was a bit puzzled when we pulled up and the line was out the door--my sis explained that it wasn't a line to be seated, but a line to order. Scramble is different than any other breakfast place/diner I'd every been to in that you place your order; pay; grab a seat; and then they bring your food out to you. After about 10-minutes we got up to the cashier and placed our order.  Santa Fe Eggs Benedict- The two perfectly poached eggs come with Ham, Chipotle Hollandaise sauce and Jalapeno Cornbread instead of the typical English Muffin. I can't describe how good and innovative this dish is--exactly the kind of thing I was looking for in my trip; the perfect breakfast. 5*  Toluca Brizza- If I thought my Santa Fe Benedict was innovative, then my wife's Toluca Brizza pushed the limits. The Brizza is a Breakfast Pizza, and I can't believe I've never seen this before. The Toluca comes with Chorizo, Eggs, Monterey Jack, Bell Peppers and  topped with a Jalapeno Cream Cheese. It's delicious, packed with toppings and big enough to share. My only complaint was the dough was a bit too dry for my liking but that's just a minor gripe. 4.75*  Service & Ambiance- Upon first arriving we were greeted by a manager at the back of the line, and again when we left; he was super-friendly and asked intelligent questions about our experience. The service inside was good, quick and efficient. Scramble is very clean and modern looking. They have lots of TVs broadcasting different channels; I'd advise that you pick a spot to sit where there's something on you want to watch. 4*  Value- Scramble is a great value with an average of $10/person with a beverage (e.g., coffee, OJ, etc); otherwise each plate is around $8.  Scramble is very avant-garde in that they don't do breakfast in the typical way with the same old ingredients. I'm always looking for something different and progressive in a restaurant and Scramble is definitely that. I wish them luck and I sincerely hope that the Phoenicians who visit really appreciate what they have. As for me I can only hope that something like this pops up close to home, but in the meantime I'll be sure to visit whenever I'm in town. I give Scramble a huge thumbs up!

nHYMdfGht5GTWMd9-PlQrA.text: After all the fawning reviews, had to try it. $18 for a two egg puny omelette, standard fried hashbrowns, and coffee. Twice the price for half the food at any good diner. Eggs were perfect, if that's worth anything.

Fi6kpHia4ecpEo1Y_Brbdg.text: You do not have Schreiners Sausage as advertised on the Board as you enter.  The current sausage is awful!!!  Stop advertising Schreiners!!

3bgMTuNoET9h-2aqKWoZnw.text: The first time I came to this place, which was about a year ago, I was not as impressed. It was ok but it didn't give me that feel that I HAVE TO GO BACK there.  This time around, we were driving around in the area and decided we wanted to have breakfast. The first place we picked was way too busy so we ended up at Scramble again.  This time around the staff were great! Very polite! This place is clean and there's multiple items on the menu for different tastes and preferences... For the health conscious eaters as well.   We had the steak and eggs with wheat toast. We also ordered the silver dollar pancakes and an order of the junior French toast. This was a good option since we didn't want a whole order.   The steak and eggs were good! But the most amazing was the French toast!  Next time we'll steer away from the pancakes... Not sure if this is their best item... But everything else was good!   On weekends go EARLY or Later! Long lines! But they have a greeter at the door that makes sure not everyone is jammed in the entry way... Converse well with customers and made the wait go by very fast!  The line moves pretty quickly though!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View of patio and mountains

I46DAADmV2L1PYw9en5--g.text: We were visiting Phoenix and found this cute place on online that had great reviews, I must say, it was amazing!   The people working were so nice and friendly, i would come back just for the service!   The food was great! Had so much to choose from! Not only a lot of food to choose from, but many hot sauces!!! If you have a boyfriend like mine that LOVES hot sauces, and he said it had great choices, it is the place to try!   When i visit Phoenix again, i will def return!

WlIc83Ddg6PwM9hCAJrDnQ.text: Had the vegan breakfast burrito but subbed regular chorizo for the soyrizo (hence deveganizing). The burrito was just okay. But the sweet potato hash was very flavorful and it had mushrooms mixed in.  I like how it is fast casual and the prices are fair. I would definitely be down to come back. It isn't better than Snooze, but definitely has made my list of breakfast options.

0kT9Az8aspUiW_8RctHYkw.text: Good breakfast joint! Lots of options for decent price, along with pet friendly patio seating.

Vy4GuRVsj5Qz__Z_GdSglw.text: We signed up for the Points Program and we kept asking.. "Did we get anything yet?" LOL  So, about 2 weeks ago, we got a text message that said you earned this for your next visit (I don't remember what it was) When we went in today I asked what do we get.  The cashier said for some reason you have over 350 points I dont know why it won't tell me what you get.  She called Julie (The Manager) and she said where's the text.. I told her i dont keep my texts. She said well I can't help you then.  Don't you think the machine should keep track of the gifts you get too? She was very short about it.  Then I watched her go to the back and tell a server about it.   After we got our food,  the staff went up to everyone except us to ask how their meals were. Not one person came up to ask us. We have decided not to go back.

BglNaMy_Uwe_Z13u1sgQng.text: All the food here tastes like Denny's and I hope. I wonder if it's the same owner. Just a very fake butter taste. I wouldn't waste time again here.

A super professional environment, our server Cedric was amazing, he listed off so many recommendations, what he really liked and asked me if i wanted to sub things out for the items i didn't want included in my meal! At first i was a little confused on how the whole process works, Cedric went through every step for me! Even went and received hot sauce and silverware for me! Highly recommend this place and if you need any help ask for Cedric, he's super kind and ready to help you with whatever you need!

I got a free coffee thanks to the Yelp coupon and they have fresh squeezed orange juice.  They also have a patio so you can bring pets.  I would come back.

DTpfll5sp2IHatlKf1FU9Q.text: Definitely one my favorite breakfast/brunch places! Very quick and casual but the food is so good!

imhDCHAYO0X_zdZABsdlZg.text: I went here for breakfast a bit skeptical because I'm a vegetarian but needless to say I was very impressed! Great vegetarian options, great food and decent prices. I went to the 7th st and Peoria location so it's also convenient after a hike!

cn9MVzRnn1hKFAe2QBtAzQ.text: Line is too long. Staff standing around and only one person taking orders with an empty restaurant but a huge line. Just doesn't make sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The restaurant is empty. The line is out the door. Don&#39;t waste your time in line. Just phone your order in.

zGi_wo_I4vetos-FhCXLXg.text: This place has a lot of potential,  I was disappointed in the Santa Fe Benedict though. This is one of my favorite breakfast items and they botched it. The corn muffin was dry and boring, and I hated the sweet potato hash. I wish I liked it because I love sweet potatoes. This is the only thing I've tried on the menu so I'm giving them 3 stars for potential and I'll update once I eat here again.

WaRKaqhNEXUUr8ZUDsuvBQ.text: Really delicious and fun breakfast spot. Dog friendly too! I'm not fond of the ordering system. I like to relax when I'm brunching and not wait in a 10 minute line to order food but luckily the food is worth it.  The staff is great and will go out of their way to make sure you have a good experience.  The menu is fantastic and has something for everyone, whether you are vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, or you want something completely decadent.   I have had the breakfast pizza which was delicious. Last time I had an omelet which was fluffy and perfectly cooked. The breakfast potatoes were great and seasoned well.  My only other wish? Serve brunch booze!! Bloody Marys and mimosas would elevate my rating to a 5 star. Yes, I'm a lush.

EPBzTf7XFhBGtcb_K1ZjTg.text: I went here on a Saturday Morning and the line was out the door, and I had to wait about 12-15min in order to get to the front counter and another 12-15min until my food came out! I ordered a vegetable omelet and my sister ordered a Cuban Sandwich! The vegetable omelet was good and my sisters Cuban sandwich was fire, def one of the best Cubans I've had since leaving FL. The only reason I'm giving this place 4 instead of 5, is that the eggs could've been cooked a little harder, but honestly if you want a quality breakfast at a sit down restaurant in the moon valley area this is the #1 place I recommend visiting!

Mav7IOOBSNMIrR6Z5wQS4A.text: We went here this morning while a stopover on a cross country drive. The food was bland and jist tasty. On top if it, I got an order of the kids scrambled eggs for my kids and the portion was way too small. This place is not worth the $.

7cue7EwfUfEeLJ9BCqrrfQ.text: We've eaten breakfast here several times in the 5 years we've lived nearby.  The coffee is good, and I like eating on the patio when the weather is nice.  It is worth the trip for the Brizza (breakfast pizza) but otherwise the food is routine.    I've never had a bad meal, but I've also never had anything all that special.  The Phoenix Omelet I ordered on our most recent trip was supposed to have green chili; I didn't see or taste any.  There did seem to be very mildly spiced chorizo in the omelet, as advertized, but the "pico de gallo" on top was nothing but chopped tomatoes.    My biggest complaint is the price.  $5.69 for oatmeal?  Come on!  We spent $35 for two people earlier this week.  For that, we got oatmeal, 1 coffee, 2 ojs, an omelet, and 2 eggs with bacon.  Given that one has to stand in line to place your order, get your own silverware, and pour your own coffee, that seems ridiculous to me.  I will go back periodically for the ambience, which for some reason I like, and because it's one of the closest breakfast joints to where I live, but I will grumble each time I pay the bill.

BJc413p8yefptuo4pHF1tw.text: I think that this is the best breakfast place in all of the Phoenix area.  I had the steak and eggs cooked to perfection.  The wife had the bacon and mushroom omelette. And she had the sweet potato hash both were excellent.  Great coffee too.

uMtBz9b9IKqaXOknc0yVkg.text: This place has a fun, funky vibe. The decor is so awesome with lots of really great sayings on the walls that involve chickens or eggs. I love the TVs and music. The menu is very diverse and offers vegan options so everyone can get just what they want. The staff was very friendly and all of them had HUGE smiles. My husband and I both got the gringo burrito. He twisted his up with turkey sausage. I have to say mine was good.  I asked for extra cheese, but my husband did not. He could find no cheese but that is standard on the gringo. He felt it was kind of bland, but I had to remind him that he did get the gringo. The side of fruit was very good as were the crispy hash browns.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oxYhrTHe4LmYnxu-TkZntw.text: Ordered a wrap, the girl at the front was very helpful and friendly, and my food was really good.. prices I thought were a bit high, especially since its not a sit down and order place, but overall was a good experience and will go back, maybe once in a while.

RMM3NpLzJhBMD4_kA4MP7w.text: With so many choices for a good breakfast, it can be kind of hard to stand apart. Bright, urban, funky and cool Scramble is a breath of fresh air to the breakfast scene.  The concept is great -- order and pay at the counter, then you're issued a number, take a seat in the dining space, then relax and wait for the food to arrive. Or choose to sit outdoors on the patio that is also dog-friendly.  Judging by several quotations of egg humor painted along the walls of the restaurant, Scramble doesn't take itself too seriously. But one slogan on the menu hits close to home: "We're local and so are our ingredients." Locally sourced ingredients hits high marks when local businesses need our support.  There are so many tastily described items on the menu that being decisive first thing in the morning is difficult. A case filled with Cinnamon Rolls ($3) may help in the decision-making process. I've met many a cinnamon roll, but I've never encountered one like Scramble's. The addition of lemon juice to the frosting distinguishes what would have already been a deliciously tender and gooey roll. It took everything in my power not to order a six-pack to go ($16).  When I scan a menu I try to find the most unique item. At Scramble, one of those standouts is the Brizza ($8). The unlikely combination of two words -- breakfast and pizza -- make for a creative selection. Smoked Gouda and Cherrywood Bacon atop a tender thin crust are well paired, and there wasn't a bite left on the plate. If the spicy kick of the chorizo with peppers and jalapeno cream cheese version doesn't wake you up, then be sure to add a cup of Bold Bottomless Coffee ($2.25).  French French Toast ($6.50) takes thick slices of French baguette, dipped into vanilla custard then cooked on a griddle. The slabs of baguette were tender and had a certain creaminess that made dunking into the maple syrup a real winner. If you like it savory and sweet, add a side of their Cherrywood Smoked Bacon ($3) to the French French Toast for some fun with your food. Bacon dunked into maple syrup is such a childhood pastime.  Scramble also offers lunch after 11 a.m. with a menu of sandwiches, wraps, soups and salads, but breakfast is served all day. This is great because I could eat one of those cinnamon rolls anytime!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon Roll
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French French Toast
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Brizza

NFDv8B5DargzNZDh2qBstw.text: Such a good breakfast & the staff was great....but the wait was long in the sun.

PrEdHtU1K80w1j40Keyzgg.text: This review is long overdue. My hubby and I took a road trip for our 29th anniversary, We left Simi Valley headed across Nevada to Arizona and home. One of the highlights of the trip was meeting up with family and friends in Phoenix.  I found Scramble on Yelp and asked my niece and nephew to meet me there. FIRST let me commend the staff! Over the top A+ customer service. The best cup of java I've had in a very long time.  Nice portion sizes excellent food!!!!  The staff surprised us with a delightful cinnamon pastry that puts cinnabon to shame.

HxcR4BLhzW40g2hCGpJo9A.text: After scoping out Scramble's menu several times online we took the chance and gave it a whirl.  Their separate Vegan Breakfast section currently lists 4 options. The biggest draw for me?  Vegan French Toast! With their menu clearly marked with vegan, spicy, healthy choice, and even travel well options, they really lay it all out.  We were warmly greeted at the door by an employee and entered their restaurant to the typical hustle and bustle of a breakfast eatery. Scramble has a hip modern feel that is still warm and welcoming, and they pride themselves on using local farmers and vendors when possible.  With their counter service style it's speedier than a typical restaurant but there's still no feel of rush.  For those looking to stay in the know, several televisions host the news and free wifi is available.  After ordering at the counter our food was quickly delivered to our table of choice and we dug in.  While it was a little weird to have baguette style bread instead of the typical Texas toast, it was still delicious.  Oh French Toast, I love you.  I heard absolutely no complaints from my husband and I think he finished his entree before me.

iSQzfjMUPB3SnS8hBLKY5g.text: First time trying Scramble. I was a little hesitant because of the prices, for me a little high for a breakfast. Since they are just down the street I decided to spurge a little.  I had the vegan burrito with sweet potato mash. Over it wasn't too bad, the burrito tasted pretty good but the hash should be called mash. It looked like they smashed in the pan.  I might come back again and try a different vegan breakfast.

M-_k9KYlsJHpji2LV0WH7g.text: Great breakfast place. The eggs benedict was fantastic. The bacon somewhat flavorless. The service and atmosphere was easy and nice.

bZAqGZXM03TCSHqY8Mb4GQ.text: Staff was great and I really liked the modern feel of the place. My two kids had the pancakes and they loved that nickelodeon was playing on the TV. My wife had one of the burritos and seemed to really enjoy it.  Now, if you're vegan, defiantly don't go out of your way to visit this place. If you're in the area, not a bad choice for breakfast. I had the scrambled tofu chorizo burrito and it was okay. Fairly bland quite honestly and with some simple changes in the recipe it could make it a lot better. The tofu seemed to be just plain tofu. Simply scrambling it with a little tumeric, salt and garlic would of made the burrito a lot better. The sweet potato hash was reeeally good though. All in all I'd like to see more vegan options and improvements on their vegan recipes.

4yvBSK-qa3OpZMLQ4EpP9w.text: Wow, the food here is AMAZING! I had the southwest burrito which includes chorizo,avocado, cheddar, egg & jalapeno cream cheese.  My server was Cassandra and she was just amazing. Always checking to make sure everything tasted good and everything was okay with the food. With this being my first time there it was a great experience and will definitely be back. The time it took to get the food after being ordered was impeccable, for it being busy I got my food in less than 15 mins

4pcLJeQP9ePad0CqQv4TMw.text: This is one of those places perfect for both brunch with a large party, or a quick brunch for two.   Walk-up ordering, with food runners that bring your meal out to you, and serve yourself beverages. It gets pretty packed here, but service is always friendly, pretty smooth, and very fast.   Really varied menu, with everything from pizzas/wraps and other light lunch fare to traditional breakfast items, and an entire vegan brunch section!   The vegan french toast is my go-to dish, but the soyrizo burrito is not bad, either (although it could do with more spice). The sweet potato hash that comes as a side is totally addicting-a perfect little combo of sweet potato and different types of squash. Vegan items come out on bright orange plates and they even carry vegan butter, etc. for your toast/bagel/whatever. Pretty neat.   They offer coffee/espresso drinks, most of which are really way too syrupy sweet for my taste, but the house drip is actually really quite good, as are their iced teas.   The patio here is amazing, even in the middle of the summer and winter-an unobtrusive misting system and sun shades keep it pretty nice (yes, thats relative) in the summer, and heat lamps warm it up in the winter. Dog-friendly, so there's always at least one cute pooch to play with while you're waiting for your meal.   If only it weren't such a trek from downtown!

lO2iM0oQzVLL_PUaVVZE1Q.text: A great place for breakfast or lunch. The corn beef hash is great!

8EViQFP_OvwmjRQ6UmpNHA.text: I just moved to Sunnyslope and if I had known this place was  here I would have moved sooner! I love going to breakfast and this is my new favorite place! Staff and food are both superb

7ZWHK0Yl77GRrEUqevHkJw.text: I got here with the line out of the door and into the parking lot. We were strapped for time but my girlfriend and I looked at each other and ran the risk of being late for an appointment.  It was not a long wait at all. About 5-7 minutes and I was sitting down just waiting on our food and drink. I got the Sante Fe Eggs Benedict w/ side Scramble Browns, Scramble Latte to drink.   It was really suprising with how busy it appeared how quickly the process was, our food arrived roughly another 5-10 min after sitting down.  The Sante Fe Eggs are fantastic and although I believe they served me with more hollandaise sauce than usual I was not disappointed or somehow the chef knew what I wanted. The jalapeno cornbread has those little pieces of corn and jalapeno in it so you know they weren't messing around. The whole thing together tastes so good the jalapeno adds a sweetness beneath the usual flavors of the ham and egg. The chipotle hollandaise was crazy good, I had to get as much as that as I could on pretty much everything. The scramble browns were great on their own but hey a little hollandaise doesn't hurt.   One thing. The menu states its spicy but I didn't so much as get a tingle of heat in my mouth. I suspect its a precautionary measure for those of the weaker fortitude but I recommend this to all. Don't be afraid of the spice, its nothing.  Overall, I cannot wait to come back and try their lunch paninis!  Also the staff were really friendly and nice. When we went they had someone offering small complimentary cups of coffee or OJ while waiting in line (they even had creamer!).

bVkurX9i9iHghbTzR8SAHQ.text: Always a good brunch location. Wish they'd open one in the east valley closer to where I live. Chocolate pancakes and eggs Benedict are my favorites here.

qxfBx2jva7OQUxUw_ZlMAQ.text: The first complaint I have, is that it had to many good choices. I lean towards the healthier breakfast options, but not tasteless options. Lucky I was not by myself, so I was able to try more than I could handle. The food was very good.  I had the Cinnamon Apple Energy Pancakes, made with whole oats, perfectly scrambled eggs, and I was able to taste a very good veggie omelet. The set was quick and easy. You order, you pay, you pick a open table, they bring your food to you.  First meal in Arizonia and it was good.

0EmZIk4U09v0LNDG4FlatQ.text: Scramble gets 5 stars in my book for having a vegan menu! Usually vegan breakfasts are limited to oatmeal and fruit cups, so I was pleasantly surprised to actually stumble across several options to choose from! The soyrizo tofu scramble burrito was pretty tasty, nothing crazy special. I was so happy that they had nutritional yeast, I added that for a cheesy kick. Cute place, wish there was one in the east valley!

wr9DhDYXFfvT4Aw8OYnuvg.text: Absolutely wonderful. Very modern decor and friendly service. I have had the eggs benedict, biscuits and gravy and both of the breakfast burritos. You order at the counted, take your number and they bring you your food. Everything I have eaten here was delicious! Well flavored and a huge portions. The staff is also very nice! I also love their naturally flavored teas.

N1B7oGkIcjmAfzG7HUdlxg.text: Went to Scramble on the recommendation of our realtor.  Great location on 7th. Modern decor. Great omelettes--we split the Western.   Multi grain pancakes were super.  Will go again!!

SAByyQjY8XNhGH3v6aOU6A.text: The place was clean and cute and the staff was friendly and attentive. The food however was pretty terrible. We've been on a search for a decent Sunday brunch for awhile now and this place is definitely not it. I didn't try the Brizza which is supposed to be fabulous, but everything else was terrible.  If you are thinking about stopping in, go with low expectations. I know that my opinion differs from the majority on here... but I assure you..... Good Egg is better.

eCDqXhsdxTGnN7fXllzRng.text: I expected soooo much more! I am almost heart broken...Kind of.  The meat lovers scramble was to die for...So why only 2 stars? The amount of food given i could have gotten double at my favorite breakfast spot for the price paid. they scramble maybe like 1 or 2 eggs and throw in some meat but it just did not seem like a reasonable price for how little was on my plate and i paid extra for a slice of french toast. if i would have known that the french toast wasn't as amazing as some people make it to be they do not know mouth watering french toast like i do. If you are craving french toast go to Crackers and Co. Not scramble!  If i go to scramble again i would stick with the toast and potatoes with the scramble but i might try something else next time.  Then update my review. But for now i am sticking with the two stars for the taste of the meat lovers scramble.  I love how many hot sauces they had so it will give me more to experiment with next time.  Their rosemary potatoes are so much better than wildflower bread company whose are way too salty for my taste.    Service was decent even though its not a real sit down place where people constantly check to see how you are doing. So service in general too me wasn't anything out of this world over the top status.  The place itself was clean and comfortable. But not for a long period of time. :) Until then i wasn't so disappointed that i will never go again i am just not fond of how little food you get or think you will get for how much you spend. for $8 you get mostly bread and potatoes. Awesome right?  :|   :\

YTlyHg2S_ifCaYwNScOE3A.text: Was in Phoenix for the weekend helping my sister move in. The yelpers suggested this place for brunch.   Pretty good. You walk in, order, sit down, the food arrives quick. The Caramel Banana Pancakes were very good. The veggie scramble was good, but not amazing. Side of Jalapeno Corn Bread was good, almost very good.  Coffee however was mediocre, both the breakfast blend and Italian roast. Worse, there are no real cups. Plastic cups for water, to-go coffee cups for coffee. Kinda lame. Good vibe, lots of seating, nice outdoor patio.  Solid B. Missed a B+ due to lack of coffee mugs.

W4t7o4xWEzXpEXqZshKnzw.text: Food is alright. I feel like you have to go on a good day to get service and good food. I have been there on different occasions where the food has been to die for and than other times id rather die than eat it. Owners are quite nice as well. Idk its a love hate relationship... I feel like this place is dennys quality with a designer name too it!

bTkcyYroIJqV_eCqmvSPuw.text: How can you not love a place that has 3 different kinds of Cholula and 2 kinds of Tabasco?!  AWESOME.  That alone is worth 5 stars.  I thought I should go with the house specialty and went with a "Brizza" - I ordered the Chicago, which has rosemary potatoes, sausage and cheese, but I substituted the regular sausage for turkey sausage.  Yummy.  The only disappointment was the crust - it was kind of doughy and just didn't have much flavor, thought they could have done more with it honestly (it was very plain).  I ended up eating mostly the toppings and left much of the pizza dough on the plate.  Extra points for having Coke products, and I will definitely have to return to try the french toast or cinnamon rolls.  I also liked the fact that your ordered & paid at the counter and then they brought your food out to you.  Very efficient and quick.  Overall, 2 thumbs up, and I will be back if I'm in the area for breakfast.

IFLU5I_Kzs75hdGyJR1L4w.text: This is not just any old breakfast joint, its a bright and shiny one!  The decor is fab, very clean and modern.  I love the little writting phrases on the walls.  As far as good things about this joint, thats about it... I did not like the order from the counter, fast food kinda deal here.  I like more of a welcoming relax vibe you usually get at independently own businesses, especially breakfast joints.  As for the food, just ah...nothing special or overly exciting to choose from, just your usual suspects..and the price...ah..not to high but not budget friendly either...  Will I come back?  Maybe if  I am in a rush or just want to enjoy having some juice out in their patio,...

XxMF1U0rT1pEkZpVx8J5mQ.text: Great spot.   Finally a breakfast spot you can actually get in to (so far).  Had a spicy breakfast burrito that was great. And the spicy eggs benedict thing that I really liked, although the sauce was spicy. Also had a Hash Browns thing that was awesome. And some turkey sausage that was tasty, but the look and texture was funny.    Fast service, tons of food and a great location.

BaalDMJP9NighEs-cmvb-w.text: My wife and kids have been coming here since they opened. It's a perfect place for a quick good breakfast. Walk up and order, no waitress to wait on. It's really the exact same experience as PeiWei. It is a little more difficult to maneuver on busy  days.   Overall it's clean, good and fast. When you have little kids these are the only things you care about!

vcJgiXDvTV5YGutWGKdwug.text: My girlfriend and I went to scramble for breakfast as we typically do, we both ordered the biscuits and gravy, which are terrific! But after 5-10min waiting the manager Sherri came over and explained to us very professionally that their gravy was not up to standard and that we could order what we wanted and that it would be on the house and our original order would be refunded my girlfriend and I were dumbfounded so we decided to step out of comfort zone and order something new, as we wait for our second order Sherri comes back with our biscuits and gravy and two boxes for our second order which we would probably be taking home, I was quite impressed by Sherri and her responsibility and ability to handle this situation so well we offered to pay for both but she refused as she stated it was the restaurants fault, we will be back to scramble for our breakfast needs and great customer service!!!

QYUnFyyI4VVm-1VAerdbug.text: I wish Scramble was closer to where we live. We only eat here for their vegan breakfast options. I seriously crave their french toast at least once a week! Phoenix is a big city and you would think there would be more vegan options than there are. Thank you to Scramble for giving us another place to eat out!

60u5sfPCmPi3Xow3XzUzNQ.text: After going hot air ballooning we were looking for a place to grab breakfast....  The scrambles here were nice and light, and the sweet potato hash was quite tasty.  Prices were reasonable.

VdFuNCrhGmDf0FzrnXr00g.text: We are in town dropping our daughter off at GCU and found Scrambles on Yelp. We loved it so much yesterday we came back again today! The food is amazing and fresh and the staff is warm and friendly.  We will definitely be back every time we visit. Thank you Scrambles for filling our bellies and GO LOPES!!!!

fSW9V0juYF_Fd-JPPRzAcA.text: Scramble is (mostly) a breakfast joint, hence the name, where you order at the counter, pay and take a seat while you wait for someone to deliver the food.    On my first visit I had the southwestern benedict with poached eggs, cornbread and chipotle hollandaise.  A little rich for my blood, but tasty nonetheless. The second time I visited I tried the veggie scramble, which was a much better choice.  Fresh veggies and eggs, with a little bit of cheese, alongside some great homestyle potatoes.    Definitely a fan of Scramble, as the food is freshly prepared, inexpensive and they have excellently strong coffee.

VVl10AOvKOxJ0uwgXQM1LQ.text: Scramble has it together. They have a wonderful engaged staff and food that is prepared well (not greasy) and is quite tasteful. Two of us had breakfast and we shared pancakes and the Garden Scramble with turkey sausage.  We both thought it was great.  The place is clean and modern.  Keep up the good work!

9Tyv562jUihHajIVwaIlOg.text: Really good food and service. I wish they were open early enough for me to swing by and pick up breakfast on my way to work!

TN-yfKcU4NV-4yA3faug7Q.text: Kind of an industrial jetson's theme (check out the entry to the restrooms, very cool).  Staff was friendly, food was very good.  Get the gouda and applewood bacon brizza!  its large enough for two or for heating up in the oven the next day.  Drinks and sides are a bit pricey.  But I'll be back soon for another brizza, its one of the best things I've had for breakfast in a long time.  Delicious!

HYx_vAr4qN-M5bxCs31DTQ.text: Excellent food, good staff with cafeteria like atmosphere. The prices are a bit high for such an environment and breakfast food, but still an enjoyable experience.

ZuOvCjqQDA8Mvr2C2bgSTA.text: Love coming here for breakfast! It's easy-in-easy-out. Coffee is great. I highly recommend the breakfast pizza!

AQHTR92CrolADtWRSeWXfg.text: My girl and I came here a couple weeks ago on a Sunday and couldn't have had a better experience.  We waited in line for 5-10 minutes but once we arrived to the counter, the cashier was both friendly and helpful in taking our orders.    I have been eating paleo the past several months and so I needed to make several substitutions to my scramble.  When asking for no cheese, the cashier readily asked "would you like to substitute avocado instead?" This, along with a couple others that were made with mine and my girlfriends were given at no extra charge.    Eating paleo, I've become quite accustom to paying an extra 3-5 bucks for making the meal sustainable when eating out.  This place blew me away in quality of food and the ease of ordering.  All of the staff were incredibly friendly and the place was very clean.   Her and I both agreed that we would be back soon and may have just found a new favorite breakfast joint.  HIGHLY recommended.

v7W2s4rmvR5ghgK-A6CAQQ.text: Came for brunch/breakfast with some friends at Scramble for the first time. First of all, the menu is large, expansive, but the options are unique. I got the southwestern breakfast burrito. It was good. My friends got breakfast pizza and did I have regret...Wow. They look so yummy. My only confusion was that they have hot coffee...but not really iced coffee the cashier was trying to get me to try an iced latte, but I just requested a regular coffee, and I could then make it iced.

I4gzN25-r_4Plv2T34xqmQ.text: Great place for breakfast as the line out the door would dictate. Food was good and enjoyed what I had but could have been hotter. Like my food very hot and it appeared my plate had set a few minutes before arriving at the table.

_qEBqeZYhzHfHaprCH3P6A.text: One of the best breakfasts I've had.  This place is good.  The food is fresh.  I ordered the 'steak and eggs' and french toast. The steak was cooked perfectly and the meat was very fresh tasting.  This looks like to be a low sodium joint so I had to add in a few sprinkles of salt and pepper.  After that, the taste was perfect!  The eggs were very delicious.  I usually only eat eggs directly from the farm when at home.  The eggs here are on that level.  So tasty.  The steak and eggs tasted very wholesome.  The French Toast was the bomb.  Never seen french toast done like that .. but I like it.  One of the few reasons to live in Phoenix, would be to eat breakfast here. :)  Update 09/30/2016: Tried the huevos rancheros.  Nice fun healthy eating.    Also tried the Prime Rib Paninni.  It was good.  Update 10/15/2016: The breakfast biscuit and sausage grave was to die for.  Healthiest and tastiest I've had in ages.  It tasted like pure goodness. This is one of my favorite dishes so to get this right is hard.  The Sunrise Sandwich was delicious.  It's a cured bacon, egg and cheese sandwich over buttered grilled sourdough bread.  Really good breakfast.  The hashbrowns were burnt and only ate 1 bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunrise Sandwich
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime Rib Paninni with clam chowder

J7Me9fU7CGSU39TU0eezvg.text: Best breakfast in Phoenix with the best staff imaginable!   Brittiny greeted us warmly and went out of her way to offer friendly explanations and menu suggestions for us (we're from out of town). When she found out she had great input on things to do and where to get free tickets, etc. Great job, whoever hired her!   And Miranda, the manager I spoke with, went out of her way to make us comfortable and cared for, going out of her way to bring us anything we needed and had forgotten to take to our outdoor table.   I will make it a point to visit this location again when I'm back in town on business.   PS TRY THE TOLUCA BRIZZA! Just do it!

usHPq6qmDFxbUBbYnFTkJw.text: This place was pretty good just not something I loved personally. The customer service is excellent which is awesome and the food seemed fresh. I walked in & placed a to go order and waited about 10min. I ordered the biscuits and gravy which were too much on the sausage side for me. I also ordered a kids French Toast which wasn't bad. Again, just not too much of my liking. It was on a baguette looking slice of bread. I will probably be back to try something else because I liked the experience.

OoX88T08gOn9zvOGCMW6nw.text: Breakfast for Lunch  This was the first time I visited "Scramble a Breakfast Joint" based on the reviews of fellow "Yelpers". From the moment you walk in the door, you are greeted by a friendly staff member and you can't help but notice the cleanliness of the restaurant.   The menu is printed on the wall, so you place your order at the register, take a seat, and wait for your delicious meal to be delivered. There is a bottomless coffee and beverage station in the middle of the restaurant and TVs throughout the entire restaurant.  On this visit I had the buttermilk pancakes and bacon All I have to say is, these pancakes were not only delicious but made perfectly, soft and fluffy on the insdide and golden brown on the outside, perfect! and the bacon was thick, but not too thick; crispy but not too crispy; once again, perfect,  tasty and delicious.  I look forward to revisiting "Scramble a Breakfast Joint" again and try other delicious items offered on their menu.

OYy_HXAVal7Jj6V6qlFeOA.text: Used to really like this place. Went over the weekend and was unfortunately unimpressed. My egg were sloppy and grey, mushrooms looked like they were out of a can, bacon limp.  Don't plan on returning any time soon.

7xP5fURG4rucGu1SKaINTQ.text: You order at the counter here and they bring it to your table. It's expensive for what you get and you have to get your own coffee refills. Not impressed.

G_5a7AcKb2dvaYY1jEDeYQ.text: This place is super cute! Friendly staff, decent menu variety and I really enjoyed their lox platter, I recommend the iced dirty chai! Something I wish I'd known prior: you order and then sit yourself, so if you bring a pup, have a friend that can wait outside with it while you order! I was hassled about it and thankfully was still able to order since I'd been waiting in line forever, but I understand why dogs aren't allowed in. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1m73vDA-gZuXttNEQtk8Iw.text: We have been enjoying the Scramble breakfast restaurant after our early morning hikes on North Mountain since moving to Arizona in March 2016.   We eat here almost every Saturday with our hiking "squad" which is called #Relentless4Results on Facebook.  The service and quality is excellent and the employees all hustle.  I highly recommend Scramble.

Va3E5Pe5mYk0CQ_y7YCXUA.text: Who doesn't love breakfast all day? The menu boasts locally-sourced ingredients and some appealing vegan options. I'm not vegan, but I wouldn't be embarrassed bringing a vegan friend here.  What could be improved: a faster-moving order counter, getting the toast selection right (brought wheat inside of sourdough), and leaving out the black pepper on the hash browns as that is a very personal choice.  If you go, consider trying a side of sweet potato hash.

k1GGFiD8GveLVMiWq1NqMw.text: Another instance where I wish I could give half stars. If I could, I'd rate this place 3 1/2 stars. All things considered, they deserve a rounded up score.   The food is tasty and the portions are generous - not gigantic. My Southwest burrito was tasty and I believe enjoyed the avocado with the chorizo. The salsa was very flavorful and paired perfectly with my meal. The hash browns are crispy and buttery - perhaps a tad too salty, but that wasn't a big deal to me. The coffee is tasty and not bitter. My iced caramel latte was sweet without being super sweet.   The service here is well above average with the bussers/wait staff managing to give a lot of attention to tables despite the fact that this is a busy restaurant. Staff are all friendly and seem to genuinely want to serve.  All my qualms are with the design of the place. When you arrive you wait in line and place your order at a register - not quite what I was expecting and it's not the most welcome first impression. The seating is alright. Not stellar but not horrible. I was fairly comfortable in one of the half booths holding my 4 month old the whole time.  The dining room is kept clean and the wait staff bus the tables very quickly.  In all I'd say it's a good choice for casual but quick breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest burrito. Avocados make this an excellent burrito and the salsa is a perfect accompaniment.
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced caramel latte. Flavorful without being super sweet.

88RkN8l76yPxPrvFL_C4AA.text: I've visited this location several times over the last few years and have always found the breakfast food to be good by the standards of most trendy breakfast places in the area. But the best? Not quite. Personally, it kind of hovers between the 3 and 4 star range for me.  Scrambled opts for the "do it yourself" approach to dining. You order your food at the counter and they'll bring it out to you. You're pretty much responsible for everything else, including silverware, sauces, napkins, and filling up your drink. Not that there's anything wrong with that approach. I'm just not exactly sure what it is that you're wanting me to provide a tip for?   Anyway . . .   Whatever you order, if it comes with hash browns, upgrade them to their "scramble browns," which are probably one of the best creations they have. It's traditional hash browns with cheese and bacon mixed in. We order it every time - without fail!  I usually get the two eggs (scrambled w/cheese), that comes with bacon, bread, and upgraded scramble browns. My girlfriend prefers their strawberry French toast, which I've never really been all too impressed with - as it's basically just the addition of some strawberry cream cheese.  We usually don't go to breakfast during busy hours, but prefer visiting in the early afternoon to avoid the crowds. With most places, this is rarely a problem, but something was definitely off in the kitchen when we arrived 30 minutes before close. I received my order immediately, while my girlfriend never did. Apparently, they had forgotten about her. When she finally said something, I was practically finished with my plate. To top it off, the order they gave her was incorrect. Mistakes happen and they took care of us in the end, but the mishap did seem odd considering the place only had a handful of diners.  Be warned that servings here are pretty small. With what you pay in comparison to some of the other places, don't expect to take anything home.  The breakfast, although slightly overpriced and undersized, is still above average in comparison to many places in Phoenix. Maybe if I were a vegan, vegetarian, or anti-gluten, I'd rate it more highly. The dog-friendly patio is a nice addition.  It's worth a visit if nothing else.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Toast &amp; Scrambled Browns!
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two Eggs Any Way!
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5WwLbSlnxIEFdxqS4ZJ2bA.text: Cool lil breakfast spot. Fast service good traditional breakfast. The French toast is pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brizza.... breakfast pizza.

h7rJkxTmiJl4VZZ8H2n50A.text: We'd been wanting to give this place a try. Saw they were open on Christmas and went for it.  The good: White chocolate mocha with almond milk. The food is aesthetically pleasing.  Open on Christmas, thank you.  The bad: I see why you pay 1st here. We wanted to get a refund and leave but we stayed rather than deal with the hassle of starting over and going to another place on a holiday.  French toast was advertised as baguette dipped in vanilla custard. I got a cold breadstick with light grill marks on one side dipped in nothing.  The sausage was cold flavorless pig grease.  Hashbrowns are greasy by nature. These were finished with an oil drizzle over the top. Maybe truffle oil? Kinda weird. Not good.   Pancakes were rubbery. Had to saw on them to get a bite.  Pre packaged cold butter pads and cold generic syrup.  The service: When asked how everything was, I responded "barely okay". Server said great and cheerily started clearing our table mid bite. It was the friendliest get the eff out ever. Done with all the empathy of a serial killer.  As I write this I'm eating 2 day old nuked pizza. 1. Because I'll be allowed to finish. 2. Because it's better.  A member of my party described the place as the prettiest left overs she's ever eaten.

D8ww3kq1_4CdVMQ0QCHSgw.text: All the ingredients are local and fresh which attracted me to this place. Came here on a Sunday morning and total wait was 25 mins, including placing the order. The order is placed before we are seated. Husband ordered the sante fe eggs Benedict and I ordered the traditional eggs Benedict with a side of pancakes. There is an outdoor patio available but we sat inside. Room is spacious and clean. Overall a great joint!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll.
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional Eggs Benedict. The meal on top: sante fe eggs benedict with a side of scrambled Browns.

rvlLvIOw8tC9VLeN3Sw6Pg.text: Going to scramble makes me happy! My friends and I like to brunch here and maybe it's their company combined with good food that's doing the trick but something about going here brings me joy.   There's usually a line out the door but it moves fast. They have a menu in the hallway so you can decide on your order while you wait in line. They bring the food to your table but everything else is self serve like getting your cutlery, napkins, etc.   The food is delicious, I have never been disappointed nor have ever heard my friends complain about their food. I have gotten the strawberry filled fresh toast which was delicious and recently got the regular french toast which is honestly just as good, so just depends on what I am in the mood for. The savory items on their menu look delicious but, only if I can keep my sweet tooth under control, I would order them. I usually just end up stealing some from my friend's plate, oh! yum hash browns!   The OJ and other drinks come in a to-go cup which is convenient if you don't end up finishing it, which is not the case with me. The place is clean including the bathrooms. They have a pretty spacious patio, I always leave telling myself I will eat there next. So, maybe next time I will!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast with a side of fruit!

C1Li_StI4OU_CB438bsROQ.text: An amazing staff starts with an amazing manager (Amanda).  My husband and I have been going to this Scramble most Fridays for a few years now.  The staff is ALWAYS so accommodating with our veganized order.  Not once have they ever rolled their eyes or moaned under their breath while punching in our order.  Although there is a Vegan Menu, there are many other items on the menu that can easily be veganized.  An employee told us that she likes to veganize the Huevos Rancheros and since then my husband has been ordering it that way.  Hopefully the owners will put a vegan version of the HR on the regular menu.    Our meals always turn our delicious!  And, we appreciate the almond milk for our Lattes.  A special thank you goes out to the wonderful cooks that take great care in preparing our modified menu meals.    Bravo to all of the wonderful staff at this 7th St. location.  They always make us feel welcome and appreciated.  A & L - Peoria

BXMOpdm3-SQFayAIxrLKzg.text: I love the concept of this place - We're local and so are our ingredients.  That is cool!  Quick, fast, and good.  The selection is mostly breakfast foods and a small lunch menu.  I got there and there was a line out the door.  WHOA!  The ordering line moved pretty quick.  It is nice to have menus posted where you wait in line, so read up, decide, and order when it is your turn.    I was craving the french toast.  Their version is french baquette, hand cut & dipped in vanilla custard.  And served with a side of applewood bacon.  I also ordered a side of the rosemary potatoes.  I am sucker for potatoes, I just LOVE them.  After ordering, you get your cup and go to the island of drinks (coffees, teas, & sodas).  You get your own utesiles, napkins, etc.  And then pick a seat.    M picked a 2 seater table.  Sweet!  The employee check on us and see how we are doing.  The sweetest people that work there!!  Our food came and it was pretty good.  One of three my pieces of french toast was on the hard side.  The poatoes were pretty good, nothing too special.    There was a group sitting next to us (they were split up because of the amount of people they had).  They kept looking at us to move but we did not.  We are enoying our breakfast, we did not even finish our food YET.  Then just just kept looking at us.  Really?  Finally they moved another table so they can all sit together.  I got refills and came back, we chatted for a little bit then another family member was standing over our table.  He asked us to move so he can sit his group.  We just left the place.    Food is pretty good but the other partons are rude, annoying, and jerks.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast and a side of rosemary potatoes

B5EeW7x_3-lA-rKx24pFLg.text: I had the eggs Benedict with pulled pork and guacamole on top of a biscuit. It was the best egg Benedict I have ever had. I would recommend it to anyone. The sauce that comes over the eggs is so delicious, creamy, and savory. They are cooked perfectly.. The scramble browns compliments the entree perfectly because of it's cheddar cheese, hash brown, and bacon combination. I would recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

z7RyiA9k2F5YSfQJErmv3g.text: Great way to grab a hearty breakfast. Large portions are a thing here. Friendly, patient staff adds to a pleasant experience. Gringo burrito was filling and tasty, as was the Phoenix omelet. They have Smart Balance (vegan) spread if you ask for it instead of butter. The pancakes are ginormous, so anyone can order the kiddie-sized portion and get three nice-sized silver dollar pancakes and a slice of bacon instead of enough pancakes to feed a family. You can even just get eggs-any-style. Good coffee, and they have soy milk out next to the half-and-half, so you don't have to ask. Check-in on Yelp and get a free coffee.

TXQxt1HVudbYk_dL9TICYA.text: Excited to try this restaurant after reading the reviews but the only item that I liked about my breakfast was the hashbrowns. So overrated.

2eRy60L290o__7Vv_myXvg.text: This is my go to place for breakfast especially before a long hike.  Great selections on the menu, local feel and the staff has always been welcoming.  Absolutely would recommend to anyone wanting to grab some good breakfast.

fb22ZEo5DPpKXzXL_grTyA.text: I came here for the first time yesterday and was very pleased! I don't consume soy, so they were able to change/omit the oil used for my omelet. They were so kind and helpful. The food was also delicious! My husband highly recommends the French French toast and I very much enjoyed my omelet and yogurt.

osQRjfv1O10FO4tlZQlt-g.text: Great staff---- props to the blonde girl that greets people and takes orders at the front. Super enthusiastic, professional & exceptionally nice to everyone that walks through the door.   I think exceptional staff always deserves kudos! Honestly, it's the staff and customer service that establishes the foundation to any business.

wKYYz6b7OUwN2ISsYoYKsw.text: Scramble employees are always friendly it seems, even when they are slammed. Which is generally on the weekends. When it is busy they have a smiling employee that meets you at the front door to offer you coffee or water.   The menu has breakfast and lunch items and I have eaten almost everything on it. I have some favorites like the breakfast pizza and the meat lover's scramble. Everything I have eaten I have enjoyed and it has always been brought out in a timely manner.  The dining area and restroom has always been clean when I have eaten there. Equally, the patio outside is well kept.   I highly recommend Scramble to anybody looking for a quality breakfast or lunch in a clean environment with modern upbeat music and dynamic television monitors.

FQlVgasy77F0wgP-4dC-hw.text: Still going to be my fave breakfast joint! I super love their santa fe eggs benedict. Customer service is good as well. They have vegan options as well. Coffee blends are good too! Overall, highly recommended place!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. santa fe eggs benedict with scramble browns

D4TaXl7RTTYtF4_MrA_niA.text: With so many great breakfast places in the Valley, this one comes off as trying to be both modern, and fast, and doesn't quite hit the spot.  Don't get me wrong, there are a few standouts: ie the Rosemary potatoes. But the dishes, while somewhat inventive... Are merely meh...

VHHZmzH0xC5rI77vVluhUw.text: Came here cause the taco shop was not open when they were supposed to be we stumbled on this place. They had a different approach to breakfast you order and then sit down and they give you a number and bring the food out to you. The wait wasn't to bad but they do a lot of business on the weekends so there could be a wait.

2pnKT-yZ6lS4JF8xDQCL6w.text: We tried this place out during a stay cation. I love trying local places. On a Sunday morning the place was packed.....always a good sign. I had the multigrain batter seasonal berry pancakes.  Even though it was very hard to make a choice. Lots of things on the menu sounded good. Yum! The bacon was super crisp and delicious. Loved the coffee. We will have to make the drive for breakfast or lunch one of these weekends with the dogs, who can hang out on the dog friendly patio!

1Giji3OfXmEcLTgYyGF3nQ.text: I CAN'T believe I haven't written a review for this place. We usually come here once a week on Saturday or Sunday and we have for... a year? Two? Forever.   You guys, they have a VEGAN menu. Seriously. I've stuck to the tofu scrambles but have wanted to try their vegan french toast (made with vanilla custard) for a while but am never that adventurous. I hate sweet stuff in the morning. The only thing I have tried and didn't like was their vegan breakfast burrito. It was a bit too plain.  I love their veggie omelet, veggie scramble and their eggs benedict with no meat is rad. Hey! Most people don't know but you can switch out your rosemary potatoes for a sweet potato and mushroom hash (IT'S SO GOOD) or opt for the bacon brown (my boyfriend loves these). The bacon brown is a potato cake with bacon and cheese inside. He also loves their sunrise sandwich (opt for bacon instead of sausage).   They have breakfast pizzas (brizzas), mutli-grain pancakes (THEY'RE DELICIOUS) and tons of other options. They source a lot of their vegetables from local farms and their iced teas are quality! Expect about $10-12 for breakfast and a 15 minute wait for your food (even when they're packed). We always leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie omelet with sweet potato hash and wheat toast (and sriracha all over).

xWIHDyY-MLsB6Jlcv-iePw.text: Rosemary potatoes are a must here! We had the eggs Benedict, which is quite popular, and the western omelet. The food was fresh and tasted clean. Yes, clean -- the opposite being greasy and gritty. The hollandaise sauce was rich without feeling like it was sticking to the back of the throat. And nice portion sizes! Enough for getting full without leaving you feeling like you gained five pounds.  The servers are also overly attentive, visiting tables to ask if you need water, condiments or anything else.  The decor is very bright! They take the morning/sunrise concept to the extreme! But that also goes for the cleanliness and swift service.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional eggs Benedict with delicious hot sauce.

6EKo1tgIIpIfVFw3oKGlJA.text: Came here for breakfast with friends a few weeks ago after our first choice for brunch had over an hour wait.  Food was delicious, portions were generous, and service was wonderful.  Food came out quickly after ordering. We ended up staying there quite a while, and we never felt like we were being kicked out. Definitely plan on coming back, and bringing our dog for the dog-friendly patio as well!

ffzZGG834M2-8J6YS2KYRA.text: It was just okay. The french toast was cooked nicely on the outside, however inside where strawberry cream cheese was warm yet the toast was uncooked... I imagine that if it was toasted on both sides I would have enjoyed much more. :/ nice modern environment. Didn't like prepaying with my credit card and having to leave tip before service. :// No one asked how food was which is common in food service. Didn't feel 30% tip I left was earned.

ZK6k8k2qQZW3LB0Ax948dQ.text: I wish this place was in Texas! I ordered the migas and was thoroughly impressed! I loved the friendly ambience and the food was amazing!! A must have for everyone in Arizona!!

25UE9uN0BVj4TAoYTXAuKA.text: Food here is delicious! I highly recommend the Toluca Brizza, it is my favorite. The employees are friendly so that is a plus. It can get pretty crowded on the weekend.

BhDjm3JlwUrSfTJDRQ0FgA.text: It's Sunday morning and we're running a couple errands when Jenny and I realize, 'damn, we're hungry.' We call a couple popular standbys but there is no way a 45 minute wait will do. We call Scramble and are told it is a ten minute wait. We're just a couple blocks away so we're in the parking lot in about five minutes. Considering the line is out the door, down the sidewalk, and into the parking lot, I'm having second thoughts as we stop at the end of a long queue with a lot of people mumbling (more than a few conversations about how many open tables were inside). An insincerely chipper employee at the door calls for the line to form further down the sidewalk "so no one gets run over by a car in the parking lot."  I figure the line must move quickly but, after seeing the line is growing I can only assume that, at best, the wait is ten minutes after you finally get the counter to order. We scope out the situation for a few minutes as the line continues to grow and our position moves forward only about four feet. Clearly ten minutes was a lie. I call another place, find out they have no wait, and we start walking back to our car. As we approach the vehicle, an unprompted farewell is called to us, "Take care! Have a good morning!"
