Honestly, I didn't know if the chipper employee was being rude or just didn't realize that we'd never actually entered the establishment. Either way, I don't really care. This was just such a disappointing experience that I was just glad to get out.

Il0P-W5hpEvzbmqUqwluTQ.text: The Santa Fe Benedict rocks ! Honestly this is the only thing ( besides Bacon) that I ever order here. Who can say no to thick cut apple wood smoked bacon REALLY . Don't be afraid of the Santa Fe Benedict description, it is flavorful NOT spicy.  The cornbread bottoms have a hint of Jalapeno and the sauce has just a hint of spice. It is truly a desert classic.  The dog friendly patio is a plus. And the mountain views are to die for.  You can grab a quick hike or horseback ride right around the corner. It's a really neat little neighbohood place

2N1Fo2BR5pwTXP11ou4daA.text: Definitely recommend, but I wish it wasn't order at the counter.

voUAqZANOCH4yTOfMnsF7Q.text: The breakfast at Scramble is very, very average.  There is zero wow factor.  It has a very sterile feeling, reminds me of a hospital cafeteria.  The staff didn't act friendly and the customer service is very transactional. If you are a breakfast person, like me, you may want to think twice about Scramble.  There are better breakfast spots in Phoenix.  I won't be going back.

PStWXCyl55Aqm72as4u8Zw.text: We decided to try scramble 7/9/11. There was no line when we went, but the place was packed. We did manage to find a one table! Anyways, we looked over the menu and I ordered the chorizo burrito breakfast, and my husband ordered  steak and eggs. Both came with the rosemary potatoes. We also ordered 2 iced teas and a cinnamon roll to bring home. Service was very fast. The staff friendly and the decor had clean lines and was pretty hip. Not fancy, but kinda along the same style as Ikea. The chairs were hard metal. Not to uncomfortable but they looked nice. The vibe is loud, music and plenty of T.Vs every where. And the place is bustling. I did not mind one bit actually. This would be a great place for tourists staying at The Pointe to pop in before they head out for a busy day in Phoenix. My burro arrived and I dug in.  Folks, I like more chorizo than eggs. I am used to having the egg holding the chorizo together. This burro had way more egg and less chorizo. It was like peek a boo chorizo burro. I order one of these so rarely and  I expect them  to be a spicy, sausage fest. I don't want to have to rely on the salsa that came with it to kick it up for me, Although, that salsa had a great flavor! Something I don't care for but it did not taste bad at all. Just more eggy. It also had avocado and a very thin layer of jalapeno cream cheese. I wish it had more. I could not even taste it and had to open up the burro because I did not believe it was there. I asked for my potatoes extra well done and they were just served the regular way. They were good, but not made to my liking. My husband enjoyed his steak and the eggs were ordered over medium but came back with the whites not as set as he liked. More sunny side up. But he loved the potatoes. I was shocked, because he does not care for any type of chunky home fries and hates rosemary. But he thought they were delish. His breakfast also came with a side of toast (sourdough).  I dove in to the cinnamon roll. It was pretty good a bit dry, but not bad and the they gave me a ton of icing to go with it!  They also have a few different flavors of iced tea as well as coffee so something for everyone.  I do plan on going back and will try the french toast. It looked yummy and I almost got it, and should have gone with my gut! I plan on ordering it next time!  The eggs benedict also looked great! The service was friendly and the price is not cheap but not to bad either. Less than Cracker Barrel but more than Denny's. And they had all sorts of side dishes that were relatively inexpensive. I am going to update my review as soon as I return to Scramble to get my french toast on! I like the fact they buy local and I love supporting a local business. Even though its a bit of a drive, I believe this place deserves a second review.

kLaMoF9vYQtA-6Q90ymRww.text: Honestly I'm a regular at this place equating to 3-4 weekly. I love the food and have historically always have had great experiences. Until they opened he new Scottsdale location. They have cancelled the loyalty program because "Scottsdale Location Patrons" don't like it. They moved all of their quality service people to the new location. They hired all new people who don't know policies procedures and or customer service... I now wait longer...food has been incorrect and orders have been completely wrong. I've been disappointed.  If your new to Scramble, the food is great please visit this place. I didn't write this to steer people away I clearly want management to see and also new patrons to now judge this establishment based upon it's current customer service issues. It's really a great restaurant.

VC9nJzC6IJ_pwyxIG082_A.text: This is a cool place. The prices are good and the food was good. I would not drive across town for it but i enjoyed the eggs Benedict with chipolte hollandaise. It also came with rosemary potato's which were very tasty. They have a smaller menu but they had a 3-4 things i want to try. You walk in order at the counter and they give you a number and they bring it out to you. There is a good amount of seating including a patio outside. Its worth a try. Ill be back!!!

y1_OeRz7TRnnMC4j8nwOEw.text: I have enjoyed breakfast at scramble numerous times.  Food is always great! Nice portion sizes.  Nice outside patio with misters.  Sometimes there can be a wait but that's a sign of a great place to eat!  Enjoy!

hWWfrFSGsMY7elR6P-jLZg.text: This place was a little posh and frou frou for me. It made me feel like I was back in California, however the food and service was good.  I had a Brizza (Breakfast Pizza), and while it was a little greasy, it was good. Pizza crust, egg, bacon and cheese (i substituted the Gouda for cheddar).

nwREs3m0kSpy7qym3XKM2A.text: Went to scramble for the first time on sunday, the line was out the door but we were greeted by a nice gentlemen giving out free samples of coffee and ice t he explained how quickly the line will move along.i was at the register within 5 minutes! Me and my wife ordered the eggs benedict santa fe style.it was brought out very quickly considering the restaurant was packed! The food is great the service is great . definitely glad I came to scramble.

6BBjcjIAKFyGG4TkWmlE5g.text: After reading about this place for months, I finally made it. It was 10:30 on a Sunday and it was crowded, but not unusual for a breakfast joint. All I have read about is how good the French toast is. I was all set to chow down on this delight until I got to the counter and was told they were all out! Seriously? On a Sunday  at 10:30 and a holiday weekend to boot. That was hard to believe.  I ordered the breakfast pizza and it was good but a far cry from what I had been waiting to try.  I believe in second chances for any restaurant so I will be back at some point. Should I call ahead and order my meal first?

d4Vla96L6d3bt2OjvgbX6g.text: We went for the first time today and we were thoroughly impressed! It was a late Tuesday morning so there were only a few other customers present. The staff was very friendly and the decor creates a great atmosphere. Great food selection to choose from for breakfast. I had the caramel banana pancakes in multigrain and they were the best pancakes I've ever had!!! My mom got the veggie scramble with potats and really like it. My husband loved the french toast and thought the cinnamon roll was pretty good.  We are so glad we found this breakfast spot and will definitely be going back!

Nuepabz1UvmdnKuiuLeTQA.text: I absolutely love this place!    The breakfast burrito is soooo yummy!  The brizzas (breakfast-pizzas) are very flavorful, but my absolute favorite is the southwest Benedict.  Two perfectly poached eggs on top of jalapeno  cornbread cakes that still have a slight outer crunch even smothered under the delectable chipotle hollandaise sauce......  Love the hip Decor, friendly and efficient ordering style, and the cutest darn wifi name ever!

AABG3DdKyLXnOCix98cvng.text: I love this place.  I discovered Scramble a couple of years ago, and fell in love with their brizzas (breakfast pizzas... clever, right?), various scrambles and omelettes, and jalepeno corn bread.  Great sides, too.  Oh, and bottomless coffee... and free WiFi.  One year I actually did all of my Christmas shopping from a laptop at Scramble while enjoying some tasty food and milking cup after cup of coffee.  I left feeling satisfied (although maybe a bit jittery).  Last year, though, my husband and I got into the plant-based craze and mostly swore off eggs and dairy.  I mourned the loss of this great breakfast option... because although there were lots of vegetarian items on the menu, finding an egg-less option at a breakfast joint named "Scramble" just wasn't going to happen.  For months I ignored this place when I drove by, then one day I happened to see their most recent menu online... and to my amazement, found they had added an entire vegan menu!  The next morning, we savored a vegan breakfast burrito and vegan scramble, along with this great sweet-potato based side dish they serve with the veg options.  Will be returning another time for the vegan french toast, too!  They even use different utensils and plates for serving their vegan items and different pots and stuff in the kitchen.  The waitress said those items have become hugely popular.  Another bonus?  Bottomless coffee with soy milk in a container with all the other creamers.  Since pretty much every other coffee shop charges a premium for soy milk, that was just one more bonus.  And if you want something cold, they have amazing, tasty iced teas from a local tea company in Tempe.  Yum.  I'm back in love.

dlRrZVpDka795urg9U7CzQ.text: We came here for breakfast this morning with friends and really enjoyed it.  The food was great with a diverse breakfast menu, the staff was very friendly and the location is very scenic.  I can imagine this place gets very busy with hikers from North Mountain due to its convenient location.

MoJtJU8zcYwVoTyffSlDEw.text: Really like this place and expect to become a regular. My bf and I tried it for the first time on Sunday for brunch. He had one of the egg burritos and I couldn't resist the huge cinnamon buns. Loved the decor -- simple, modern, yet not trendy -- and the fact that the place had a buzz to it. We saw everything from young families to senior couples dining inside.  The waitstaff was gracious and friendly and had no problem letting us take our time and read the Sunday paper. They circulated free samples of various items on the menu and offered to refill our coffee in a to go cup as they were shutting down.  I can't wait until the weather gets a little cooler and we can take advantage of their outdoor patio.  Prices were moderate; there were lots of healthy options on the menu too.

e5Sb2KMy3XBP4yRCp8K1fw.text: One word. Excellent! My wife and I are picky about quality and selection. This is one of our go to places for breakfast!

nEIiRybKZ9twpa0-qxRSzA.text: Great food and service! Worth the drive (from Ahwatukee). They need to start a "sister" location out by us!

Z9phINQ3VGrHjkYOdADckQ.text: My husband and I went to Scramble this morning for breakfast for the 1st time. This new restaurant is very clean, has a great atmosphere and the staff was very friendly.   We ordered 2 meals + 2 coffees and the bill was $20...that seemed very reasonable.  I had the Gringo Breakfast Burrito and my husband had the Brizza (Breakfast Pizza)  We actually could have split the Brizza actually. The meal portions were quite large (we have leftovers for tomorrow's breakfast!). Great value. We met the owner and he was very nice :) It wasn't too loud, which we like, because it's our time to chat...quiet jazz music playing in the background; not too loudly! Our food was very tasty.  Coffee was good too. We will definitely be going back to try the other items on the menu.

1oSbbN2xEOXpVgbkZ5bbng.text: Great place to eat, especially if your in a hurry,but I usually take my time with breakfast.  The place is nice and clean and lit up.  Killler spicy benedict.  everything 've eaten there has been really good and plenty of it.  Menu has some interesting things.  One being what they call a Brizza, their take on a breakfast Pizza.  A couple of differetn kinds of them.  The only drawback I had...the free standing chairs and tables in the front area can get a little crowded.  May need to lose a couple of them.  Nice large patio though.     Over all its the best breakfast goin in the neighborhood.

yb2yTZHFDC4wtMz0HC4K7A.text: the only thing keeping it from being 5 stars is a tiny bit over priced and not amazingly consistent (especially with the vegan menu). Small issues because I love that they offer a vegan menu (the sweet potato hash that you can get on the side is delicious). End of the day a really great breakfast place with options for all tastes and diets.

itqCcH0e8ZcIx21qy6m7NA.text: I read about Scramble on line so I thought I would go there for brunch and I loved it!! The Santa Fe eggs Benedict are amazing! The staff is friendly and the ambiance is incredible. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!!!

q5KlsOf6Uo4oSLEfb5qWdg.text: Tasty O'Brian potatoes made with rosemary. The Santa Fe eggs benny (served on cornbread with a chipotle sauce) ranks high on my non-traditional benedicts list (yes, I have one of those).  I wish we had breakfast options like this in Sacramento.

ZzmodUUqrnhu8Mb-y6ZCuQ.text: Very GOOD! Lot's of low carb options. The fruit is so fresh tasting. I love how they have egg whites.

MT-A-asFiUNCi3G-6NKJHg.text: My girlfriend and I chose to eat at Scramble due to the lack of well reviewed and decently priced Scottsdale breakfast locations. Upon entering, we found ourselves in a long line of yelper foodies in the same situation as we were. The decor is modern and the ordering set up is like a fast food joint: wait in line, order, find a seat and wait for your food. The wait was about 20 minutes and there are tvs set up to enjoy while waiting at your table. Although important, these details are not by any means the reason for a two star review. The food and the pricing was actually a bit over hyped. Our meal, for two people, cost almost $30 and the portions were VERY small. I ordered the baguette french toast which was chewy, tasty, and pretty small. This dish is an off shoot from traditional french toast which and was ordinary at best. The bacon that accompanied this dish was very good and you only get two slices. I also ordered a side of rosemary potatoes for around $3 which were dry and cold. My girlfriend got the meat lovers scramble and considering the name of the restaurant, we figured this breakfast would be a sure shot. Well it wasnt. The scramble was skimpy, dry, bland, light on the meat, and came with the same rosemary potatoes and hard cold toast. Also, we were very dissappointed with the cinnamon roll because it did not look anything like it did in the picture. It was dry and slathered with overpowering cream cheese frosting. The only saving grace for this place was the orange juice, which seemed to be freshly squeezed, and the coffee. We won't be returning for another visit.

NQHVgmmdKWrKDjwE8ibsGw.text: We had breakfast here a few weeks ago and I thoroughly enjoyed it. At first I didn't care for the ordering process; however after experiencing the service and meal, I was very pleased. I liked the decor and ambiance. We sat on the patio-which really sets this place above other restaurants, however that type of space/set-up is hard to come by in Phoenix. Being dog-friendly was another plus. There were several things I wanted to try, But I opted for the Gouda and bacon Brizza and Dave had the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict. Of course I had coffee - and it was delicious! The Brizza was very big, I ate just 1/2 (at it stuck with me all day). I felt the cheese/bacon proportions were perfect and flavorful. I sampled the eggs benedict - also delicious! I felt the prices were good and the menu selection was well balanced. Obviously I am not a vegetarian; however I respect their large vegetarian menu and their practice of separating the cooking areas and dishes - definitely not an easy task on their part - so that is very cool. I can't wait to try some other dishes!

k8AfHXW4Fk1OXWqkBTn52g.text: BEST BREAKFAST I'VE EVER HAD! Literally. Go and have the breakfast, Chicago Pizza. Yes, I know it sounds weird, but it is so good you will end up eating the entire pizza by yourself, even if you tell yourself you're only gonna eat half. It's not possible, its just too good. Price is pretty good, maybe slightly pricey for breakfast (i think the pizza is like $9 ish) but completely worth it. Outdoor seating available if its not too hot. But seriously, go here and eat.

284kBD89otOX1e22J_9Ybw.text: The breakfast food here is good, although overpriced. The atmosphere is very modern and trendy, like somewhere two tv show cops wearing expensive suits would eat. Overall, the brizza was delicious, I don't even want to know how bad it is for you, and the french toast was pretty good. Overall though, the food quality wasn't above anything you could get for half the price, so I'd say go once for the aesthetic, then go back to IHOP.

vCngYNCTO8eOrMIKxZT-lg.text: Loved the food. The freshness of it. Great ambiance. Clean. Simplistic elegance....

qosPGfEQHL9xaULOBg-xxA.text: After a morning hike, this place was an awesome refilling station. Their food was so delicious and the atmosphere reminded me of a neighborhood eatery with a modern twist.  Didn't feel out of place even though we weren't in our Sundays best.  Love the rosemary potatoes and jalapeno cornbread.  Thanks for the eats!

_E1WQLerqPojoRuSj9OSRw.text: Scramble has become a new favorite spot for breakfast... and clearly from the number of people that are packed in on any given visit, I am not alone.   This is one of those places that I had to ignore my first impressions. My initial thought was 'oh dear, another trendy spot that never lives up to the hype". And with it's wall menu and counter ordering, it is a trendy. But there are several points that clearly raise the comfort level.   Between the wall of windows and bright lighting there is an airy feel to the place. The drink bar in the center of the room is a five-star bonus IMO. Yes, I have been accused of being a control freak in the past (and they say it like it's a bad thing...) but I love being able to create the perfect cup of coffee, suited for my tastes and mine alone. The tables, while very close together are always serviced immediately to accommodate the constant inflow of patrons. And even though the place always seems to be brimming to the rim, I have never felt rushed through either my meal or my paper. I also love the various selections on the flat screens that encircle the room. There is literally something for everyone (and how many people can actually say that they shared their yogurt parfait with Ed Begley Jr. on GTV?!!).   Now for the food. I've been enough times to have sampled quite a few offerings and have even begun to create a list of favorites. On the top of that favorite list is the Gringo-Cherrywood bacon, egg & cheddar cheese Breakfast Burrito. This thing is large enough for two, or a second meal and is literally stuffed full of the perfect balance of egg, meat, and cheese! Ask for extra salsa, because one cup is not nearly enough for this big boy!!! The Brizzas (breakfast pizzas) and French Toast (baguette slices dipped in vanilla custard) are also tops on my list. As far as sides go, the Scramble Hash Browns are a must have! They seem to take a little longer to make and are really more of a hash brown/bacon/cheese tart-lette which are browned to perfection. I have literally had to defend mine from incoming utensils and believe that a quick thrust of the fork to the back of the offenders hand is quite an effective technique...   My only real criticism of the place is that if you have placed separate orders, your food may not be served at the same time. But this is so minor in comparison to the quality and the fact that clearly everything is made to order (not pre-done and waiting to be placed on a plate), that I can't really hold this against them. Then again, it may simply be that I have an addiction to those hash brown cakes! ; )   On-line ordering is coming to their website and that will add an additional level of love for this place.   This is a welcome addition to the breakfast scene and if you are in need of some flavorful morning num-nums, Scramble on over!

41vY_qBtMouqzA1dXt3F7A.text: Great appearance for sure.  This whole mall is actually really cute considering it's in the middle of not much.  Scramble has great food, and a decent concept.  I like that you order and then seat yourself.  Only problem, was it took us a while to get a seat for three.  Food and service were both perfect.  Probably deserves the five stars, but I don't particularly like waiting for a seat...

bWnBuonPOb9-k5gh2mFfBw.text: delicious! and the most sleek and sophisticated decor! fiance and i had the southwest breakfast burrito and  the gouda/smoked bacon brizza (breakfast pizza). their eggs are soft and fluffy and their portions are perfect. the brizza is a CRAZY idea and a great one at that! the crust was perfectly cooked and the toppings (eggs, gouda, smoked bacon) were piled high. the breakfast burrito (eggs, chorizo, cheddar, avocado!) comes with this amazing jalapeno cream cheese - i ordered mine on the side so i could control the level of spice (and fat content....gotta fit into a wedding gown in 10 months!).  i will DEFINITELY be coming back again. i looooooooove breakfast!

cG7KKhyWCrPBc2Z79fANNg.text: Nummy num num. The whole family loved Scramble. Took the twinnies, age 10, last weekend cause momma was tired of washing dishes. We ordered the Biscuits n' Gravy , egg sandwich, traditional fried egg plate, and the pancakes. Everything was delicious and hot. Great coffee too. We are heading back again this weekend to try the French Toast. No waiting to be seated here, which is super important when dining out with kids.

iG94OTrU3fTugsyizaBm0A.text: Reminds me of Pei Wei or Noodles style menu, ordering, and service procedure - which is a good thing, because this model fits nicely between cheap fast food and overpriced, overtipped servers at full service places.  Prices aren't bad either.  It fits the niche quite well with reasonable prices, decent clean atmosphere, and above average food (especially the jalapeno cornbread).  Nothing spectacular here though, and I certainly would not go out of my way to eat here as far as the food goes.

QqdDJvHQ8F7iWaFsqXdgoQ.text: I love this place.  I have only been there twice and both times were great.  It gets pretty busy in there but the service is still quick and efficient.  I am all about the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict, but their french toast is good too.  Bacon could be crispier, but I guess that is more of a personal taste thing.  I will definitely be dining here again.

XiF8DT-FPprFJUv09CyqnA.text: We love this place for breakfast on the weekends.  They have great healthy alternatives and all you can eat pancakes during the month of October.  We drive from Peoria on Saturday mornings just to eat here.

0kgfr1ZRmgjdXjrZuKE4ZA.text: All yummy. I got the vegan French toast, sweet potato hash and rosemary potatoes. Absolutely awesome!

YSV8F_OPWRyWbGKS4eFBWQ.text: For Arizona, this place does a pretty good breakfast. The french toast is where it's at though...So when you go, you'll want the french toast. End of story.

RVmuh8H1IELJ_hlx4TXvxg.text: Food is good, but nothing makes me want to become a regular. Too expensive and the concept is more of a nice novelty item. Breakfast quality is at par with your local brunchery or Marie calendars. Check it out once or twice, but the hype soon fades.

lhRKdACMBB_8vKQTJ6jSJA.text: Owner was kida rude...The food was great and the service was good to! I saw the owner on news channel 3 making his chorizo and egg burrito. So my mom and I picked up and left to his restaurant to try it out.. The lady's in the front are VERY nice and welcoming. We told them that we saw the restaurant on TV and wanted to try them out. They we're excited and started to tell us the good food they had and what to try.. well after getting my food we saw the owner walk in after from being on the news station.. I can see that his waitress was tell him that he had a few costumers coming in cause they seen him on TV making food she seemed more excited then he was LOL He kinda just glanced at us and went to the back... Then after finishing half my meal the waitress came over and said "ok moment of truth how is the food?" I told her it was excellent.. I just wish the owner was the one going around with his costumers, I thought maybe after being on TV he would have at least went around to his costumers that came in after seeing him on TV asked them how his food was and how the service was but is stead he stood at the counter talking to his busty sexy waitresses in the front, picked up and left. He wasn't busy so I don't see why he didn't have time... but other then that it was great LOL...

zJ2i0EnvZ7bkNmFA_-oozQ.text: Finally made it here for breakfast today.  Very tasty!  I had the Denver omelet, bacon and iced tea.  The omelet was fluffy and just the right size.  Fantastic English muffin on the side.  The interior was spacious, bright and very clean.  Love the quirky quotes on the wall. Will definitely be back.

UZGkKD8kHu56sb3FwHngkg.text: Knife and I recently dined at Scramble on 7th Street for a late breakfast.  The location is in an L-shaped strip mall and is easy to find since it's on the corner.  There is ample parking right in front of the door.  There is a large patio which fronts 7th Street however since the temperatures were hovering around 105* we opted to have our meal inside!  One flaw, which unfortunately is found at many restaurants, is upon walking in the door the menu is mounted on the wall on several large panels.  This causes many diners to stop and read which subsequently backs up the line.  There are also printed menus located in a wall holder.  Since this was a first time visit for Knife and I we needed to review the menu before proceeding to the order counter.  While perusing the menu, we let several people pass us.    Knife decided on the Phoenix omelet -- chorizo, green chiles, cheddar and pico de gallo with a side of sausage.  While my selection was a Veggie omelet -- squash, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes, red onion, bell peppers and Monterey jack cheese.  The omelets are serviced with hash browns and a bread choice.  Instead of hash browns, I substituted sweet potato hash.    The good news is the Veggie omelet was very tasty; the sun-dried tomatoes was the dominate flavor and the were very flavorful!  The sweet potato hash was a nice change from the run of the mill hash browns.  The not so good news, Knife wasn't impressed with his Phoenix omelet or the sausage.  He said both were flavorless.  Typically when an omelet has chorizo it is jammed packed with flavor, sadly this was not the case.  Perhaps we hit Scramble on a bad morning.  On the plus side, Scramble has a rewards program which is offered when ordering.  To join just provide a cell phone number and within seconds a text is received indicating how many points have been accumulated.  The points are based on the dollar amount spent.  In addition, the restaurant is light and bright with cute food sayings on the walls.  It is self-serve for drinks and utensils.    Scramble was a nice experience and Knife and I will need to give it another try.  --Fork of Fork 'n Knife  Be sure to check out the reviews written by my critic in food, Knife of Knife 'n Fork.  Bon Appetite!

0YEkq2vdTpdSpok7G1TVsg.text: My favorite breakfast restaurant!  Staff is super friendly and the food is top notch!  Love to spend my weekend mornings here on payday weekend!

VwnWceaeTGNxXCZu2i16JQ.text: This is seriously my favorite breakfast spot all because of the Toluca Brizza (breakfast pizza) It has chorizo and jalepeno cream cheese. Pretty spicy but so good. I can never finish the whole thing, usually end up taking about half of it home.   I love the dog friendly patio. Service is usually quick and efficient. zv0ZnPsUt-Sn0eqEz1E-pw.text: This is definitely my favorite local place for breakfast.  If I want healthy, they have it. I like the southwest breakfast burrito with turkey sausage instead of chicken, with salsa.  If I want comfort food, it's worth it! The chicago brizza is amazing!  Still loving the tea! Venetian peach iced, chamomile hot.  Can't beat the mountain views when facing the window or on the patio.  Efficient, friendly service.  Always something to provoke conversation on the tv's and there's usually 3-4 different stations showing.  I love coming here on the weekend!

mDML633YuxuqPG8eOXuFQw.text: I enjoy eating at Scramble. My husband and I go on a regular basic and we take company from out of town here as well. Great spot with good food and smoothies.

SKkWdDNccQKucYiA9eXbKg.text: Really yummy food!  Friendly server and cashier!  A little pricey but definitely worth the price.  I recommend the alma!!! Mmmm. :)

9uUG4xxOWjpvrCiRd-AJNw.text: We go to Scramble 3-4 times a month for breakfast because the food and service never disappoint us.  We some times just stop in to get the jalapeno cornbread to go because it's so yummy, but, especially on a lazy Sunday morning, Scramble is a great place for breakfast or brunch.  I really like the Toluca brizza, but my boyfriend prefers the Santa Fe Benedict.  Because Scramble uses such fresh ingredients, EVERYTHING tastes great.  The servers are very sweet and attentive, and the atmosphere is really homey.  Scramble is our go-to spot for breakfast and brunch.  ENJOY!

sh2LHhJ5oVWUlwV6xH2RwA.text: What a great breakfast place! My daughter and I were in AZ for a spring training game the next morning we wanted a cool unique spot. Scrambled was just we were hoping for! Casual relaxed vibe and the French French toast was the best I've ever had by a long shot!! The only thing missing was mimosas. That would of made it 5 stars.

KSqYNddYlGFeS00VsuOaZA.text: If  You're really hungry this  is not the place to gou nless you want to spend over $60 for two people for $30 it's not worth it I spent $30 and I'm still hungry

CbYsMsn4vpJhL-FN5nDYOw.text: Finally, vegan breakfast! They have 4 vegan bfast options. Got French toast and mushroom tofu scramble. Both were really good. I was nervous they would mix up the vegan French toast with the non-veg version but all the vegan entrees come out on orange plates, everything else is served on white plates. That little move is so reassuring! Great idea, made me confident that what I was eating was truly vegan.

tmj2_6ZNW28olh14zOG3YQ.text: I ordered the Southwest burrito and it was chock full o' chorizo, but it seemed to be lacking the jalapeno cream cheese that was supposed to be in it.  My hubby got the meat omelet and he really liked it because it really was full of meat.   I am a fresh squeezed OJ snob, and theirs was very tasty and cold.  I like the set-up, where you order at the counter and they bring the food to you.  It was fast and efficient.  I would definitely try this place again.  It beats most of the breakfast joints in our area, so it'd be worth a drive here.

4lOGbSitGb9ELWxpLsxibw.text: Love this place, the food is always fresh and consistent. It can be quite busy on the weekends but worth the wait.

vAnQMwujNv0oqzQSslSaYA.text: As usual, the food was great. This is probably the 6th time I have eaten here. I have ordered something different every time,  and would order the same choices again if only there weren't so many other items I want to try.

x9pD6slefTukrG_YHIGQJA.text: We thought the eggs were a little small but it was actually just the right amount of food, delicious

ves3H0kESaHHK0hlM9X3Aw.text: My mom and I finally tried scramble this weekend. We both live within 2 miles of it but never been - we both had heard that it wasn't that good. But after reading the reviews on yelp I convinced her we should try it!   We were not disappointed! We went on a Sunday morning at 10 so it was pretty busy - but the line went quickly and were able to find a seat.   I loved that the offered loose leaf hot tea and got one of my favorites - Irish Breakfast. My mom got coffee and said it was really good. We had to wait a little while for our meal (maybe 20 minutes) but it was fine as we weren't in a rush.   I got the French Toast with Bacon and it was delicious. I loved the bread they use and it wasn't "eggy" like some. The bacon was awesome - thick and meaty - not thin and fatty like most breakfast joints.   My mom got the veggie omelette. She said there was a weird flavor she didn't like (maybe the sun-dried tomatoes?) but she substituted the Scramble Brown (a potato cake with bacon and cheese) and fell in love! She said next time she would just get those. I tried it and it was yummy!  She said her toast was really good too!   I loved the modern decor and the staff were all very friendly. Glad we took a chance and tried this place! Will definitely be back!!!!!

widia5E-ON594EHOjqI5rg.text: We love this place. The food always comes out amazing. Their sourdough bread is delicious. The patio is dog friendly!

VLaJi01oe1D2tTfWkFHYTg.text: Scramble restaurant is absolutely delicious! They have so many options including vegan options which was a major plus. Not to mention the staff was so hospitable and inviting! I definitely recommend this restaurant for a casual brunch or lunch!

bK9C1x2SrLlo81OhxzQ5_Q.text: Got the simple oatmeal and coffee.  Service is very good with pleasant wait staff.  Food quality was very good as well but felt the prices were high.  This is a vegan type breakfast place with a pretty good variety of choices to select.

JWOjwUDF1fpekFGrQmkWWA.text: OMG. I've been meaning to write this review... what a great place! The girl who took our order could have been more focused - as we were trying to pay she was too busy chatting with someone but we finally got her attention. The guys who deliver the food and make your experience there are really the rock stars! I can never seem to order food the way it comes (I'm a cooks nightmare!).  They came out and asked me exactly what I wanted and delivered it perfectly. The two gentleman out on the floor were amazing. Definitely will go back!!

k02TTYg_J1C1tfWZnAM2Nw.text: Yum yum yum . Visiting from Chicago and so happy we stopped here for breakfast. Staff was great , food was amazing! Highly recommended!

-kOsRY1f-blezdP_rwLeAg.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast places in Phoenix. They have wonderful and quick service. They are quick with getting food out quickly. They have never gotten my order wrong. The food is served hot and delicious. They have lots of options and substitutions. They have high protein options. They have this gluten free bread that is to die for. They have a whole section of their menu that is completely vegan. The atmosphere is awesome. They have TVs and plants. They do have a patio so on nice days it is fun to sit on the patio. The bathrooms are always clean. And on busy days when their is a large line they put out free coffee and water that you can drink while you are waiting to order. Love this place!!!

70es5Hhu4MieDIMj9tEuqQ.text: Awesome delicious food with some  Gluten free vegan options  sweet cheerful attention by the staff Clean bright outside eating space dog friendly  Open 6-2 I would be happy to go back again next time I visit Phoenix

wNQFAd2NfUcouKbik2wmbA.text: Thanksgiving day, hungry, pre-feast breakfast with my sister and right brain ( dear hubby). Have to say most breakfast places are pretty much the same, not here.   First off the menu is eclectic, breakfast pizzas to eggs Benedict. Counter service style restaurant. Order at the counter and they deliver to your table. Waitstaff were all fun, helpful, spot on! Food was great. Sister and I ordered eggs bene, right brain had traditional two eggs, etc. with fresh OJ.   with so many choices here in Phoenix I will come back for sure. It was different, fun, fast. The small crowd that was there early were all happy, possibly hung over ( uh, moi?), or families getting away from family. You know how the holidays can go? Next trip out Valley of The Sun, see ya then!

byunXrlY-5FnboMOYvs9tQ.text: This was a fabulous experience for a day of breakfast. I had to wait in a line for 30 minutes to order my food, but it was worth it! I ordered a blueberry stuffed French toast with a cereal smoothie. The French toast had a fabulous flavor and texture and so did the smoothie. Great experience overall.

KLdLmxTjBBW5qm57TJCQuQ.text: Delicious variety of vegan, vegetarian, and omnivorous breakfast options, with good coffee and plenty of hot sauce choices to boot. A little pricey, but you get plenty of food for your buck. I had the Alma Brizza, which was outstanding. Worth the splurge.

_K65gRdM-7LFfwrX2UXOZg.text: This is now my new favorite breakfast joint! The food is made to order, fresh, and flavorful. I ordered the biscuits and gravy and my bf ordered the Chile Verde burrito. I recommend giving this place a try, you will not be disappointed. Also, Scramble is local and it is dog-friendly with an outdoor dog patio.  Your welcome

Q-GiKtX_z8SIbbQUNX-OEg.text: I met a friend here for breakfast that lives near by.  Was very impressed with their service, prices and quality of food.  We came on a Saturday fairly early in the morning. Coffee is very delicious.  Had their Huevos Rancheros.  Not your traditional Mexican style but a great twist to a traditional dish.  We sat on the patio even though their were definitely tables inside.  Many times when there is not a lot of people on the patio patrons on the patio can inadvertently get less attention but this was not the case.  The staff was very attentive but not overly attentive.  I would definitely come back here again.

Ig0MWlWtUD0Xm2WyzrBIUg.text: I was not impressed with this restaurant.  It is very pricey and the breakfast was just ho-hum.  The hash browns were very greasy, toast was cold, and the sausage link had a strange taste to it.  There are much better restaurants in the Valley.

_JmuLBaaWqYqo4mHXGUdvQ.text: I love this restaurant! They have great vegan options and super friendly staff. They're always so fast here too!

Mcdg6hlPxSAh8Ni7Qt5THQ.text: Decided to stop here for the first time even after living in this area since before the restaurant even opened. Love the casual order then seat yourselves as well as having access to all the condiments, boxes, water cups, etc without having to ask. Food was delicious, the hash browns are the best. We will definitely be back again to try the rest of the menu.

mW_A2YJKLR-pwG1KNNRAwA.text: I thought the food was fine but the process of getting is just not for me.  I acknowledge that it was a weekend morning - a very busy time at all breakfast restaurants.  The process is that the customer steps inside the front door and joins a long line.  It took 15 minutes to get up to the front and give our order.  There was exactly one person working taking orders.  I would rather sit down, order, and have a leisurely cup of coffee while I'm waiting.  Standing in a line was just not what I wanted to do.    I admit that this didn't seem to bother other people, so maybe it's just me.  I would not come back to this particular restaurant because I do not like standing in a long line before i can even order.  Reminds me of a college cafeteria.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The long line about which I have been complaining.
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dining room
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The rule:  you must stand in line before you grab a table.

zkRFRIzViy0hz0bGzKHZMA.text: Great breakfast spot with a vegan breakfast burrito! They were very friendly and went above and beyond to make sure our food was amazing. There was an issue with the ordering for yelp and they ensured our order was made quickly and correctly. We decided to dine in and they came out with a dog bowl for our dog and ensured we were taken care of. Their dedication to customer service made us smile and our cross country trip smoother.

o5tUuHgnO3phzlNaQPSLNg.text: This place was so-so at best. When you walk in you are greeted with a very long line and there is only one cashier taking orders. Finally after 51 minutes we got to the front of the line and placed our orders and seated ourselves. We had 17 empty tables from which to choose.   The food was cold and boring and very small portions. Mine came out in about 10 minutes (acceptable) and my date's took another 20 minutes. So now I'm faced with do I eat or do I let mine get completely cold, not to mention I felt rude eating when my date had nothing. When his food finally came out, you'd think it'd be piping hot but it was also cold.   The waitress came by and asked how everything was and my date laughed and shook his head. The waitress said, "Awesome!" and whisked my plate away mid-bite. Uhh, do you want us to leave? Sorry we've been here so long but you did take forever to get both plates to the table!   I think this place is coasting on its reputation - and maybe it used to be good - but I've tried it twice with similar lackluster experiences both times. $36 for two breakfasts, two coffees, a long line, and poor service? Definitely won't be back.

asaYjKIM9OqJilTb_jCGhA.text: I'm giving the benefit of the doubt by giving this place two stars only because it is Easter Sunday... to start it off we knew it was going to be a little packed but, after waiting 20 minutes in line with one order taker at the counter, by the time WE got up to order another worker FINALLY jumped on the other side to take orders...how rude?! You had a line out the door for 20+ mins to then finally realize "oh we better jump on the keep the line moving"...Now the food we ordered wasn't the best. I got the sunshine sandwich  and my fiance got The Phoenix omelette. The sandwich I ordered was overly greasy and the hash browns  that came with my meal were cold. I don't think I'll ever go back because this was my first time here and the customer service needs to be revised.   If you see that you have a line out the door then maybe have another employee jump on to take orders instead of making people stand in line for 20 minutes to then get the bright idea to have someone help take orders!!!   At this point, for the amount of money we spent I would've rather went to Cracker Barrel or Snooze for better service.

sCLEOuUhQ91LVGLZpzB4Dg.text: Busy restaurant for breakfast and for a valid reason! This place is great! Food was good, didn't have to wait forever for it. Even the line to order was good. One tip is to know what you want before you order. There is free coffee and water while you're waiting. The service is also on point. There was a small mistake with my order and they were so quick to fix it. Highly recommend!

DEHUuh3e7iAgtGPxYioRPA.text: Came here after hiking love this spot nice little spot. The food was delicious I ordered a sandwich and it was huge. The customer service was excelllent !!!

lClH_M7Y26RSpv3KxaU_Vg.text: This breakfast place is really good, portions are perfect they have all kinds of choices  for breakfast and is really convenient for me when I go hiking to the mountains, finish my hiking and have breakfast right after is perfect . Customer service is always very nice .

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest burrito

tpksIUxBm2tMUmGPYYWk2w.text: Scramble has a great thing going.  The santa fe eggs benny is amazing.  Don't forget to end breakfast with the best cinnamon roll in town.  This place is very consistent and has a great staff.

_9ln5TgH1CiCjL82KvSwbw.text: I dig Scramble, their breakfast pizzas and french toast are great. The hashbrowns with cheese and bacon is also good, but I really can't get over how slightly pricey they are considering what you get.   Pretty much everything is ala carte. There really isn't a complete meal on the menu. The yummy french toast comes alone. Yeah, you get a lot of french toast, but really nearly $7 for just french toast? It should come with a side of bacon or hash browns. After you add a side your breakfast not including a drink is $10. I just think it's a tad high considering I could go most anywhere else and get a complete meal for less.   I can't spend $30 on breakfast for me and my husband when A) we aren't getting full on meals and B) if I'm not getting any boozy breakfast drinks. Still, I do enjoy breakfast here.

kksmy1bHSxHap4wDFpOj9Q.text: What a great idea.  This is almost the perfect breakfast place.  It really seems to get you in and get you out quickly.  I will definitely be back.  Walking in, you feel like you are in a Pei Wei that has working lights.  The place is bright and colorful - great to help you wake up.  The menu is along the side of the entrance (just like Pei Wei) and you order at the counter.  You place your order, get your number, and find a seat.  The food selection is pretty awesome.  Peanut butter chip pancakes, pigs in a blanket, cinnamon rolls, french toast...it all sounds so good.  We ordered a smattering of things to try and they were all great.  The pancakes that we ordered were buttermilk and they were great.  Light and fluffy with a cinnamony butter and maple syrup.  Good stuff.  The sausage was nice and spicy inside the pigs in a blanket.  It was great.  I can't wait to go back to Scramble.  Not as good as Matt's but it feels like a healthier breakfast that you could actually consume without waiting outside for an hour.

uRTBF9oSzhsUISnVjMkJLQ.text: Fairly good food but prices a little high. 4 people was 50 dollars with 3 drinks

9wdhtTGigC9khcN8QG2u3w.text: Scramble is home to one of the best breakfast entrees in town: slow down... wait for it... ta da! The Santa Fe Eggs Benedict! The fact that every single review does not focus solely on this morning opus to the Southwest confirms what I have always suspected: the dry heat has finally shriveled Phoenicians' tastebuds into tiny pieces of gravel.   I kid, I kid. The Santa Fe is poached eggs and ham atop oh-so-yummy jalapeno cornbread, smothered in a chipotle hollandasie. It's got a kick, so isn't for the faint of mouth, and I can see where it might be a bit rich for some, but for me and my entree-splitting spouse, it's the best of the Southwest on a plate.   I've also tried the caramel banana pancakes, the Scramble hash brown (think hash browns juicing on bacon and cheese), and the chorizo brizza (Brizza= breakfast+pizza. Get it?). The brizza was huge, and for me a huge miss. It made me feel sluggish and greasy just looking at it. Everything else? An A-OK.   Scramble offers order-at-the-counter service and the interior is bright and cheery. They also have a dog-friendly patio where they're always sweet to my pup, who loves Scramble because of the fussing, fawning, big water bowl, and occasional dropped breakfast potato.   Pros: Yumminess, fast service, cheerful interior, large patio, dog-friendly.   Cons: Paper coffee cups (I'm stubborn and I want a cermaic MUG!), cross-armed frowners who complain about the quickly moving line.

yawokiCPjtoyuLBnfh81KA.text: The french toast was fun!  It was a baquette bread dipped in vanilla custard.  I just read a review that mentioned dipping it into the syrup and I'm going to try that next time.   I also had a bite of the chocolate chip cookie that was soft and had a good flavor to it.    The menu was also helpful in identifying foods that travel well, in case you want to take your order to go.

5dVlB0z3gJd0Qh9f392p4w.text: It finally opened! The sign has been on the building for at least 3 seasons, maybe more, but the wait was worth it. We needed a breakfast spot in this central area sorely. The order system is like Pei Wei, line up and order at the counter get a number and sit down. Bad news, the wait was long, the good news, the food is great. I guess, I revealed that I'm impatient and want instant gratification. Thank God that they gave me a cup for coffee after we ordered and got our number to pin on the table on those "Alligator Clips". Every time I use those things, I flash back to the early 70's using those clips for that last toke that then gave the super munchies.  Coffee, $2.50 a cup for a bottomless cup with plenty of choices and in a to go cup. Atmosphere.....very hip look, open ceilings, nice patio, great colors and great sayings on the wall to remind us of cool sayings to remember while we nosh. Breakfast came pretty quickly considering how many people were in the restaurant . I had a breakfast burrito that was plump and was plenty of food. I just hoped for more....maybe those alligator clips reminded me of the munchies of the 70's. Sandra had a cinnamon roll and although I thought it could have been bigger....she enjoyed and said "It was fine and filling".  Saw several friends there, all overweight and they said the portions were very satisfying.   This is stupid but I love it. The Dyson hand dryers in the bathroom. They are the best. I'll be back for more and they can earn that fifth star I'm sure.

mXdBXH0_MTO4fgkWvF3l_w.text: Dug it. Had the soyrizo burrito, very tasty. The potato hash I didn't like so much, sweet potatoes with vegetables tasted a little weird to me personally. Felt like the service could've been a wee bit faster as it wasn't terribly busy, but I liked everything overall. Will go back again to try something different! Dug the contemporary feel of everything.

n4dEbbZM34zmyD1yHKNKNg.text: This place gets two stars from me, and one of them is for its design.  It's the kind of place that I really, really, wanted to like and didn't.  It's inviting from outside and the inside does "spartan-chic"  very well.    The eating, experince, however, was nothing short of disappointing.  My dining companion commented that it felt like a cafeteria.  There was no service to speak of, and I had to fetch my drink out of a refrigerator.  You'd think that would keep the price down, wouldn't you?  Well, it didn't.  I ordered the pigs-in-a-blanket, and the blanket was awful.  I ended up eating the pigs, which were uncanny in appearance and taste to the sausage links that my high-school band sold as a fund-raiser.   A downer of a place in more ways than one, not the least of which is that its decor is writing checks that its food isn't cashing.

9uFT5uEVu3gSqEUBp0MNzA.text: The husband and I went here for breakfast the other morning at about 9 am.  The patio was about 2/3 full but the inside was empty.  When you first walk in, you are greeted with menus that are extremely reminiscent of Pei Wei.  Turns out, you order the exact same way at said restaurant and you even get a number and choose your own table.  As I sat waiting for my food, I contemplated whether or not this concept worked well for breakfast.  The place started getting busy about 3 minutes after we sat down and I discovered the concept works quite well.  So many things on the menu looked delicious, and I had a hard time deciding what to get.  For starters, they have pancakes with peanut butter chips!  YUM!  Any restaurant that does peanut butter chip pancakes gets bonus points from me.  The rest of the menu varies from omelets to brizzas (breakfast pizzas) to good ol pigs in a blanket.  The husband and I decided to share a few things.  We got the peanut butter chip pancakes, the pigs in a blanket, and a cinnamon roll.  The pancakes were awesome and HUGE!  After just one I was already feeling full.  The pigs in a blanket were absolutely delicious, primarily because of the yummy and kind of spicy breakfast link.  The cinnamon roll was also tasty, nice and fresh, but not too cinnamony.    Back to the concept of this place... once it had started to pick up again in terms of customers, I noticed how quickly the cashier was able to clear out the line.  I also noticed that the food was coming out at a really quick pace, and absolutely nothing sat on the line waiting to be served.  It works really well, but I am most interested in seeing how it works when the place gets absolutely slammed.  Overall, this is an excellent place to try.  You will not be disappointed with your fresh and delicious breakfast that doesn't make you feel heavy and gross after you leave.  A cool place for sure.

yeOmLhnK_cfuJwmZEoFGEA.text: Fast friendly service, fresh good breakfast foods.

SlVq6SXKyZFOB5S8ufVbiw.text: So good. so good. so good  the only thing that was bothersome was how long it took for our food to arrive. But once it got there, i shut up and enjoyed my yummy breakfast. :)

7NU2eQO2Upr5bMhyMncmhQ.text: Great place to get a breakfast pizza. Always a line so ordering for pick up is the quickest way to get food.

dILjkT_zxJDjVPhwTsLLfQ.text: The food is great.  You can bring your dogs to the patio and eat.  Staff will bring your dog a dog bowl with water.

apFiWno9Mz6EjGxHsUY5CQ.text: It was a pretty good breakfast at a reasonable price. I had two multi-grain chocolate chip pancakes. They were plate-sized and thick. I thought they were great and they came with two sausage patties for less than $8. Hubby had western omelet. He really enjoyed it and it was also huge and less than $8. It also came with two thick slices of toast (cut on the diagonal for 4 triangles total) and rosemary potatoes that were good.   We went early in the afternoon on a Saturday and most of the breakfast/lunch crowd had dissipated.  We definitely will eat here again.

BtgdgqaOKAaSoRx5V9-fYg.text: Just OK with overall food. Not the best of the toasts or omlets served. Good ambience to have food and start your day with a nice coffee.

XcYpvfIMVyVhO5kskF0exA.text: Great food and wonderful environment. Sat outside on patio; very enjoyable. I had the chorizo brizza, breakfast parfait and OJ. (Yes, way too much food. I'm eating the rest of my brizza and parfait for dinner right now!) Highly recommend the brizza. So good!  Customer service was wonderful, too. I went inside to get a to go box, and was looking around for about 10 seconds. Before I had the opportunity to ask for one, I was approached by someone who worked there inquiring how he could help me.

8h055_CJo_r4IeAouWKg9Q.text: Great service, fast, efficient, awesome food and great prices. Tons of space for the whole family

Fmvg0qQvbw1CvKp506Zv1w.text: great customer service. very nice restaurant. I would definitely go back. The bacon is AWESOME.

wzTwY0Ewyikde6s8mgcHmA.text: First of all, let me state that I usually don't do reviews, generally. However I was looking for a breakfast place on Christmas Day, and you know how that is. Most are closed or if open, they are usually the typical chains that are in many cities. I was looking for another place other than one of the chains since the one I was currently at was very busy, I came across Scramble on an internet search. It was a ways away from where I was but since it was one of those days when I wouldn't have much in choices, I decided to give it a try. I did call them and make sure how late they were open. I have a couple hours before they closed since they closed at 2 p.m. (On this particular day.)  Ok, Food first: I am generally at really picky eater. You know, I like my hash browns not too crispy but not too soft, like my eggs with the white cooked but the middle semi cooked, you know the usual, what you usually can't find. However when I arrived at Scramble I was a little concerned since it is the cafeterias type where you walk up to the counter and order, they give you a tag with a number on it to put on the table you chose so they can bring the order to you. Not typically my style!  I have to say though, this is a bit different.  I was treated by Sherry, who was very bubbly, considerate, intuitive, and helpful, in fact I thought at first she was one of the owners since her attitude just seem to reflect that. More on that later. She assisted me with the order since I never been there before, even suggesting a hash brown patty that I found out was excellent later. I ordered coffee and water also &  was given cups so I could go to an island & serve myself. By the way their Italian roast is an excellent coffee. I like it strong, and it was but not with a bite or an aftertaste, smooth but strong! My type of coffee!  Ok. Food: They had excellent choices, many healthy choices as well as many just good & tasty! The portions we're good. Average but we're proportionately correct for the price. I happen to like to eat a lot in one sitting so it was a little less than I normally like but still filled me up fine! It should be noted that it was served on a real plate and was presented very nicely on that plate. It took no more than 10 minutes after I ordered it so they were very quick. It was very tasty with a lot of distinguishable variations in my scramble, in other words, someone knew how to cook back there to make sure the taste blended well with one another. I don't recall exactly which scramble I ordered but it did have a combination of eggs, cheese, red pepper, onions and probably a few other things in there. I also had the hash brown patty which was excellent and it came with a side of toast in a twist of orange.  So let's talk about the service a moment. Like I said earlier,  the one that took my order Sherry, is one of the managers, along with her managing partner Mike. Both excellent.   First of all she was very professional and yet enthusiastic, with a "Glad You Are Here" attitude, which, in consideration it was a holiday, was very impressive since most employees would want to be at home with your family on that day. However you would never know that from her attitude or from the way she worked; even cleaning and bussing tables enthusiastically, and with a smile, interaction between employees and customers, and even catching my eye when I looked up at her with a question. Of which she immediately responded.  She is very good at what she does. I had some questions on the coffee since I liked it.  By the way, they do sell it there and her and the other manager Mike, answered all my questions professionally and efficiently. Mike even listened to some of my suggestions about coffee since I have a little bit of experience behind that. Which also reflected his excellent managerial quality.  I also noticed that the rest of the employees had smiles and were busy working which is probably a reflection of the managerial staff. Like I mentioned earlier I assumed they were owners, but when I spoke to Sherry expressing that I thought they were the owners, (With Mike standing next to her), they both stated that they were just the managers but to look forward to someday perhaps being owners of place such as this.  I also noticed that they both, when you spoke to them, give you their full attention and eye contact. This is very important in managers, people want to know that you are listening to them whether they have a problem which simply want to express their likes or dislikes. Sherry and Mike did this excellently. Obviously both of them set an example to the fellow employees to make the difference for this place and all of this being done on a holiday when you would expect them to want to be home.  Alright, I don't know who the owners are, I do hope they read this review.  I want to qualify couple things. First I do not know Sherry or Mike, I have never known them, until I met them at this restaurant. Excellent employees & place!!

AIl5VIMTj9qlY3y1Cnsz3A.text: Went here today for breakfast and it was okay. Expensive for small portions and my biscuits and gravy came cold. I like the coffee setup in the middle. They forgot one thing I ordered. All together not sure I'd be back. Friendly staff.

dceg1knI4ib_9d-1hgCs0Q.text: ANOTHER YELP WIN!  awesome vegan brunch. the sis & I split the french toast & bfast burrito.  both were incredible.  tasty soy latte, too.  kids had all kinds of modifications & special requests- not a single eye was rolled.  love the sleek, modern decor. service was great. went on a Sunday at prime brunch time & there was no problem with the wait.

D4UxFDBJSUgU6niespHDiQ.text: This place was great! My friend and I were trying to find a place on the way to the airport, and found this gem on Yelp. The reviews were good, so we decided to head that way....and so glad we did.   The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and the food was very delicious. I had the Southwest Burrito and the iced coffee Alarm Clock. The burrito was excellent, and the coffee was amazing. My friend had their French Toast, and went on and on about it.   The service was fast, and I loved the fact that dogs were welcome on the patio...and smoking wasn't! It was a lovely way to spend my last morning in Phoenix on vacation. Will definitely be back when I return to Phoenix.

KQQVuCm6MRjfT50g0mTKsA.text: This place is amazing and we were so surprised to find it in Phoenix of all places. Scramble offers many breakfast and lunch options for vegan, vegetarians and regular meat eating folks.  I decided to try one of the vegan options: a spinach, mushroom and sun dried tomato tofu scramble with sweet potato hash and rye toast. I also got a soy mocha and an OJ. Everything was brilliant and the coffee was the best one I've had in the US so far. I struggled to finish but made sure I stuck at it until I did.  Food service was prompt and customer service not bad either. The server pointed out a few touristy places nearby for us to look at and was pretty friendly. The outdoor seating was nice and the had a good mountain view.   The server advised us they were looking to expand into other locations in the near future. My vote is for New York, hope to see you here Scramble :D

ICdeEtrloapNDyQCD_HHXg.text: Super busy on most every time we've been.  Must wait in line to order at counter.  All foods is good but not special.  Consistent.  Fresh.  Patio.  Serve yourself.  Wish for something special.

j3wxnr3iunX30DAIFQrS8Q.text: Second try!  Went on a Friday early afternoon and there was no wait to order.  Time from ordering (according to receipt) to food delivery: about 12 minutes.  The food was served warm and my burrito stayed at a nice warm temperature throughout the meal.  The music is way too loud and is really quite awful.  Right now "why can't we be friends" is blaring and it's soul crushing.  EVERY SINGLE SONG so far has had a very strong snare drum that is giving me a headache.  I'm not kidding.  Every single song, including this Spanish "waiting for tonight" one now playing.  This is not a relaxing ambience.  I guess they're going for high energy?  Hash browns are fine, though they needed salt and pepper.  Nice crunch on the top.  The Costa burrito was very mild, but had a good texture thanks to the crunchy bacon and hash brown potatoes.  The chorizo was rather bland.  The flour tortilla didn't have flavor and was nothing special (not made in-house or by a good tortilleria).  When I picked up the second half it was in a grease puddle I had to wipe off.  Overall though it was a solid 4 star burrito.  The female employees' orange uniform tees are sheer and you can see their black undergarments through them.  It looks very unprofessional.

h10PqJ2Zb6uPU5LYklzMfw.text: Neighborhood favorite.  Whether your hiking Thunderbird, golf at the Pointe or need a fun north central Phoenix place to mix with friends Scramble is a great mix of modern, bright and cheery atmosphere. Bring a freind.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dog friendly too.

oJvYy-vOvmdYQSTA8Gzsdw.text: Breakfast is great here!  Not a huge lunch menu,  but I imagine it's great too.  Dog friendly patio and very accessible.  Service is friendly with different selections of drinks and coffee bar.  I try and come here with people from out of town.

f14rGWb03_ZD8MnbFVPU_Q.text: Although all I had was the breakfast parfait with fresh fruit. It was very good. The service was fast and friendly. My companion had the French Toast and he enjoyed it very much. I would definitely go back.

mAaT4Zk1HNAuNAaIubrl6w.text: Vegan friendly!  Great spot for brunch or breakfast. I ordered the vegan burrito with scrambled tofu, veggies/avocado and soyrizo. It came with a sweet potato patty and a side of salsa. Good stuff and definitely filling!  The restaurant is spacious and they offer a good variety of hot sauces and other condiments.

q9B3Iqh0rvzvrJeb1N2mfw.text: I would say this place was a 3.5 but I'll round up to a 4 I guess.  I always like to get Sunday brunch at a place that has a decent patio whenever possible so I can bring my fur baby along.  You line up, order and find a seat. I got the Brizza which is breakfast pizza. It's just what you think it is. A pizza with breakfast foods on it- hollandaise sauce instead of tomato sauce, with eggs, sausage and cheese.   It was good but a bit heavy of a meal for me since I usually like to eat something light in the mornings.  I will probably share this next time and get a side salad or fruit on the side.

aNE7q7la6m20Bs6X6wzSRw.text: The staff was super friendly & helpful with sugguestions!! The breakfast food was suuuuuuper delicious! Dirty Chia was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I switched the ham for chorizo... Holy.. wow, this is amazing!!

SkjyC3sQ3RKfZFYTOHTGFA.text: So good. And plenty of choice on the menu which keeps me coming back. Don't be intimidated by the lines. They move fast and you'll never be rushed. Try the breakfast pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delish breakfast pizza with chorizo, jalapeno cream cheese and scrambled eggs. So good it &#39;broke my mouth.&#39;

sQ0TmdoSv4n9MfCMvKgnqw.text: The staff is amazing. The waitress was extremely courteous and frequently as she checked on us to see if we needed anything else. She was perky and all smiles. I got the mushroom and ham omelette with some kind of cheese but oddly i couldn't taste the cheese. The waitress heard my complaint and brought me some extra cheese to sprinkle on. I chose cheddar but it was cold strips of cheddar that didn't and couldn't do anything for the dry omelette with tasteless almost nonexistent cheese. It was one of the worst omelettes I've ever had. It was flavorless and dry. The hash browns that came with it were hash browns lol The friendly staff saved this review but if the omelettes are crap then I don't want to try anything else. They have orange juice cups in a bin of ice by the cashier. The orange juice was the best part of my breakfast. Skip this place and make your own breakfast at home. Even McDonald's has better eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Terrible omelette and unneeded sourdough mounds of bread. Worst kind of bread for breakfast.

IbTUOf0HUrT7-d9MeCf_5g.text: The husband and I love this place. We have been coming here ever since we moved to the neighborhood and both the food and service is consistently amazing. We have tried most of the breakfast menu but haven't dived into the lunch menu. Our favorite is the Gouda brizza (breakfast pizza) - smoked gouda, bacon, hollandaise sauce, and scrambled eggs. Yum! On lazy weekends, we order this to go and enjoy back at our place. When we dine in, it's a mix. Their Costa breakfast burrito is delicious - something the husband orders frequently. I really like their mushroom and bacon omelet, but I also enjoy their "two eggs anyway" meal. I normally get scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes, and fruit (instead of potatoes). Super delicious and filling. Another favorite are the Biscuits and Gravy. Now this is amazing! The biscuits are super soft on the inside and slightly crunchy on the outside. They just melt in your mouth! The gravy is the perfect accompaniment. It's thick and filled with sausage. These are some of the best B&Gs I've had! The best part is how inexpensive yet utterly delicious they are!   I love that it's a local place that uses local food. Everything is fresh and the staff is outstanding. We've taken both sets of parents here as well as friends. This is definitely the go-to breakfast place. If you are ever in the area, you should definitely check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy with eggs (instead of potatoes). Yum!
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Gouda breakfast brizza to go... Yum!

jstt-3jnEuCOBvNcrtIHYw.text: We had a lovely breakfast here after a nearby hike. We had our dog with us as well. I can't believe how sweet the staff was. All of them. The best customer service we have had. They brought water to our dog. They had warmers over head - it was cold today! They brought some little wax sticks for our 3 year old to play with. The food was awesome- great menu to choose from. We ordered some flavored coffee drinks and they were awesome! I can't wait to hike again and come back! What a great find we came across today!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmmmmm

qyE8LUEbEFEmwfOMnq-reg.text: Scramble is a good place for breakfast because you can take your dogs.  The Phoenix location is a little hit and miss with their staff though.  I had a coupon on my phone one day but the cashier couldn't find it.  I said "Ill just ask next time".  The next time I went it was expired though. Sometimes the servers are really right on and sometimes just so so.  One more item is the french toast.  They don't let it soak in egg long enough so as soon as you cut in, it's just WHITE BREAD!  If it wasn't for those things, they could be a 5 star

SwaeBMNKGiG_g1ofd-rRbg.text: Have always had a great experience here... And we come often, so that says a lot. Our favorite are the Brizzas (breakfast pizzas) but can't go wrong with anything. When we have visitors from out of town, we make sure to take them here for breakfast or brunch.

HtkR8HFRS4M1A_Le-XjtWA.text: This place is awesome! Their food is so delicious, they've definitely perfected the art of breakfast. Their eggs are so light and fluffy but I was more impressed that they make their own bread. We had their jalapeno bread that comes with their omelette and it was AMAZING! The consistency was more of a cornbread but it is a must try. The atmosphere was very modern and trendy which was pretty surprising considering it's not located on the best side of town. All in all I was pleasantly surprised and I think I just found a new go to breakfast joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southern breakfast burrito

nBVnmi_wQv4WKmwpi8mkuA.text: Egg whites and oatmeal and brizza oh my! I've been hearing about Scramble for months now and I finally made it in for a breakfast meeting today.  I loved it...  The oatmeal was not only the biggest bowl of oatmeal I've ever seen, it was served piping hot with pecans, raisins, and milk / brown sugar on the side.  I also had a side of egg whites done just right.  (I was trying to be healthy since I recently realized I gained some LBS in the last few months).  However, I did have a few bites of my dining companion's brizza - it was also delicious!  The coffee did the job too... I left with a nice caffeine buzz and a full tummy too... the perfect way to start my day!  I love the clean, urban feel to this place... the staff was super friendly and the bathrooms were clean.  I wish I lived closer to Scramble as it would definitely be a regular in my rotation.  Even though it's a bit of a drive for me, I will be back... especially to check out their upcoming "breakfast for dinner" charity events on Wednesday nights.  (Stay tuned for info on the Yelp events calendar).  You've got a new fan in me, Scramble... see you again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the biggest bowl of oatmeal ever!

O2lzM3FITZCkEvDcVH3j1g.text: As a new member of the vegan community I am in constant search for vegan friendly restaurants and was pleasantly surprised to come across "Scramble A Breakfast Joint." Since going vegan one thing I miss is having breakfast options, and to my surprise Scramble has many. I chose the Spinach and Mushroom Tofu Scramble that came with sundried tomatoes, hash browns, toast with vegan butter, all cooked with a multitude of spices. Not only was the service fantastic, but the food was delicious! The staff member even thanked my friend and I for being vegan when delivering the food-- I found the gesture very thoughtful! I would recommend anyone in the area, or passing through to give this restaurant a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The delicious Vegan Mushroom and Spinach Scramble.

NQoQm6daH-0lMloh_aDYdw.text: This is an excellent breakfast spot!  Great menu and the staff is exceptionally friendly!  Wish that I had one of these closer to home!

OA2q9Cs5KiPGk7jk1o2qUQ.text: This location is right up the street from us, so it's a nice option for breakfast before work or brunch on the weekends. Love their huge selection of hot sauces and allergy-friendly (vegan) food options. It's a great place to bring the pup as well, since they have a dog-friendly patio.

2uT0MCgZdVXa4AsGy5EqLQ.text: They have many options, even vegan ones. The staff is friendly and the food is pretty good too. The portion size was good as well. I'll come back again.

IJEPsXpxA9Dwd_r-2R0rjw.text: Great food, but the setup of this restaurant is the stupidest thing I've ever seen. Stand in line for 45 minutes to order, while there is literally 15 open tables. So stupid.

-yKhnKF7wuzj0ifLIsroIw.text: I make better tofu scramble at home BUT it's nice that they have vegan options.  Their coffee is great and I love that they have honey and soy milk at the coffee bar. It's a little pricey for mediocore food but every time I take an omnivore here they love it. I wish they had more vegan options and gluten free tortillas .  Otherwise it's pretty good

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu scramble ,  sourdough toast,  hash browns

C4lpKIhyzLtteHQ29FF3mg.text: Great place and great atmosphere. Great food!  We were greeted by a friendly host.  Hueveos Rancho were delicuous the steak and eggs were awesome. Keep up the great work.  Great atmosphere. Very clean!

0LrTAf5qsSYpTNOG0fwSEA.text: Went there the other day thought it was going to be really good to have high expectations. Ordered a medium steak with eggs and my steak was well done. My friend ordered a iced coffee which tasted horrible so we left it there all in all it wasn't  that great of an experience it could've been a lot better I thought with the reviews it was gonna be way better.

ISO_Mt8FRSkmuhVng9fwOg.text: Scrambles pancakes are gross. I thought I'd give them another try, I guess I could have gone to the frozen store section and bought frozen rubbery pancakes for breakfast, because that's exactly what they are. Eggo' my pancake. The food is very rubbery to me. I tried my friends plate and it wasn't good. I'll stick to First Watch for my breakfasts.

ZRI8j-xcRjihGmlhGWNKFg.text: VEGAN BREAKFAST. The vegan breakfast options are so good! My sister (non-vegan) loves this place too! I love the pay and sit style so you're not interrupted during dining. The patio was also a great addition.

E7-jdEN16Zo-iRjA9aHMpQ.text: Great food, great set up.  Pet friendly patio.  My only complaint is the serving. Very small serving for $8-10 meal.  I ordered a cup of fruit separately on the side and it was $3 with HALF a strawberry, 4 grapes, & 5 pieces of cantaloupe. The cantaloupes were fairly small.   I wouldn't suggest coming here if you're starving.

Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast &amp; chicken bacon panini w/ jambalaya soup.

g6mY5P4qQnSmInCKa1vb0g.text: Wouldn't recommend. Staff was friendly enough, but $45 for very basic breakfast for three of us. I got the vegan breakfast burrito. After a 10-15 min wait (perfectly acceptable), our food came out. My burrito was way too spicy (dont think it was marked that way) so I asked if I could swap for something lesser in value. I chose the vegan French toast. But even though it wasn't busy, had to wait about 25 min for it to come out.  Of course my party was done eating (and boxed and ready to leave) before mine even came out and I had to take mine to go, leaving the restaurant $45 poorer and starving. Positives: friendly staff, great smoothies Negatives: Pricey for what you get, Slow  Summary: Find a better bang (and fuller stomach) for your buck elsewhere

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wouldn&#39;t recommend it.

t6q0wdJ22Plk_OuWStOECA.text: After about six visits to scramble both locations, I've decided the best thing about scramble is the free wifi.  The food is basic at best, border line on step above ihop..no seriously.  Yes its a local place who uses fresh ingredients.. But so what. The culinary makeup in this town is at its peak and i feel like scramble is coasting by with a pass.  Pancakes are always undercooked and plain. Hashbrowns Always undercooked and flavorless. The eggs for every meal weather it be omelette, scramble, plain..is simply lack luster. The amounts used in each omelette is very scarce. There is just nothing creative or unique about any of it.  Every time lately i wait in line for over 15 mins and there is barely anyone seated. I kept trying the restaurant simply because i live a block away..but.. Im over it.

hDYMp_KNPzJFfvysuDdeWg.text: Great food and staff. Cant wait to come back next time im in az! definitely made for a great start to my vacation week

IjldW31sOwxEfQuzWXKcJA.text: Ive passed by this place many times on my way to work only to discard it as another one of those breakfast places. Ugh was i wrong! This place has amazing food and its so close to my house which is not really a good thing..    I had to get the french toast of course. They make it so different but its amazing. To me it lives up to what french toast is supposed to be. Sweet, cinnamon, vanilla goodness! Although a little too sweet for me. 4/5  The scamble browns i completely fell in love with.. these are pure heaven to me. Creamy, rich, bacon, cheese, and egg all mashed together with potatos...  1000/5   I felt so sad when i dropped part of my scramble browns on the floor. Im so tempted to get another side order to eat and another to take home.  Not to mention if your a Cholula hot sauce lover like me they have a great selection!! You wont be disappointed..! I for sure will be back!
