SoulEzR78N8wWHJD9DU9HQ.text: A bit pricey, but very tasty.  I tried the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict, which was the perfect amount of spice.  Coffee was decent. They have a great selection of hot sauce too.  Sitting outside under the shades is nice, but the traffic noise can be distracting.

PV3VDeU7O7VQpuvxEyHmuw.text: Portions much smaller, they changed the toast and it's now about 1/2 size. 38$ for 2 and there now asking if you want to tip? Nope won't be back.

a6pZhF2YJ65gjZYtY1fEpQ.text: Stopped in here to get some breakfast. The food was very good! Only thing that was annoying was the line moved pretty slow to place the order. It's one of those places you walk in, look at a large menu up on the wall, and place your order as soon as you approach the cash register. Sorta like a typical fast food joint. But yea- the line wasn't very long and it took quite a bit before I made my way up to the register. I guess since where I'm from everything is so fast paced and I'm used to that. The customers were too chitty chatty with the register people and held the line up.   Anyway, I got a table outside which was nice. The weather was 80 degrees and gorgeous out - so why not sit outside. You put your little number on the salt and pepper shaker thingy and they come over wih your food when it's ready.   Food was very good! Place is big! Indoor and outdoor seating so check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Western omlet with sausage side hash browns and toast

A4dGJmr4TmPZ7w8GtnmC9A.text: Great food, been going since day it opened!  My favorite is the Brizzas, breakfast pizzas!!!  I used to work nearby so I miss going as much as I used to.

aSwczEME2GoQzjXToKSl9w.text: Great food, good prices, friendly staff. Always a pleasure to come to this restaurant.

kFGnovdWiKrJ3i8gikgGJA.text: Went for father's day bkfast. Good quality good, decent price. Staff very friendly.  I would like to see a little for variety on their menu though.

Ja4stXdNYr39u5CZHMNtjw.text: I love breakfast/brunch, and I've gotta say I found a place that really fits me! Scramble was everything I was looking for!   The food is great, the people are nice, the location is adorable, and decor is fun/modern.    I also like the way you order, there isn't pressure to wait for a server to come to you, you can get your refills as needed, and enjoy your experience without hoping that you get a good person and not a server having a bad day.

5dR0mY2KDVCNLbUyTPuyjg.text: I tried this place for the first time based on how many great reviews it has gotten and I came away greatly confused as to why.  First off you order the food chipotle style and then you have to play the "where do I sit??" game for a while and hope something opens up.  We ended up having to sit on stools along the windows which was really uncomfortable.  Then we proceeded to wait 40 minutes for our food.  The waitress dropped off our food with barely a smile and not any kind of acknowledgment of how long we had to wait.  The food was good but the portions were small.  I ordered the biscuits and Gravy, my wife had the veggie omelet and my little one the chocolate chip griddle.  Again the food was good, though I'm blown away at how amazed people seem to be with the potatoes as they tasted average to me.  Eventually another worker came by and asked how our food was but never waited for our answer as he just pointed out everything we ordered and wandered off before we could even respond.  I wanted to like this place but I will never return here.  Maybe it was an off day I don't know.  I'm not going to waste the time to find out and will stick with The Perk.

Ro_vIyCESPPDCotk8Qemlg.text: OMG! This place is awesome. Best turkey sausage I've ever had. Hands down. Ever!  Went here after hiking North Mountain. Love the style, love the decor, the service is actually great. It may not seem that way at first as you order at the counter and they give you a placard to place at your table. You get your own drinks, silverware and condiments. They have a lot of condiments!   Server brings your order to you after you sit, you enjoy your meal. We bussed our own table and then left. Others left their trash because they were Scottsdale 30K millionaires who think the world is there to clean up after them. The place is full of nasty rich types but that's not the staff's fault.  Please leave a tip as the four tables of proper ladies I watched left the poor server nothing (again the world is there for their pleasure).  Dog-friendly too!

Rr79y0ZpOW_EyvK0Bj2OUg.text: So this is my second time in here and I forgot how much I love their breakfast. First, they have a cute modern feel with outside seating. Second, they have great coffee! The pancakes are moist and not too filling and my favorite was the jalapeno cornbread. I want to go back just for that!

IDr1ZbyASN9vKHCOfpVLPw.text: A nice casual breakfast spot. Food was tasty and even though there was a line out the door, it moved fast. We did have to sit outside because the tables inside were full. Only disadvantages to note: it's serve yourself/cafeteria style. You have to get your own silverware, condiments and drinks. 2nd is they do not have any alcohol so you can't get your Sunday mimosa or Bloody Mary here.

YCT27US8gDie4yGnBaXIoQ.text: Very good food. Their Brizza was a nice twist for a BKFAST pizza. Love it!

9ZGWG9dX-QpXL9yjRH00tw.text: My best friend and I found this place via yelp after a horrendous experience at Mimi's Cafe... so happy we did! Food is great and everyone is so friendly. You can eat out on the patio with shaded tables, or you can eat inside while they play great music (we were dancing to James Brown while ordering our food). It'll be our new breakfast spot from now on!

Tsd9GQDyCLhfqyoPdz8JqQ.text: This place is awsome. The food is great. Staff is friendly. Its really cool looking place.  What more do I need? Nada!!!

wfxpakUniTfzUZXKk7CT3A.text: I'm giving this place a solid 1 star! The people working there were really happy! The food on the other hand was sad.. My daughters egg breakfast, scrambled eggs looked like about 1/2 an egg, her one slice of bacon was also sad. It was sad that it was cold and over cooked. The toast was burnt, the "clean" utensils still had food on them from the last happy people who ate there. Other than the food being mediocre at best, having it warm if not hot would have stepped this up to a 2 star rating!

Xhea_kM3NBMZ7lsNm8uz8w.text: First time I finally stopped in. Ordering is weird sort of like at a fast food joint. You get your own napkins and silverware and drinks. The good thing is you dont have to flag down wait staff for extra napkins or have to hope they come by to refill your drink. Ordered the biscuits and gravy. Once it was brought out I was concerned. The visual was not there instead of white creamy sausage gravy it was a cross between brown and gray. Tasted better then it looked with lots of sausage in it probably adding to the off putting color.  Clean and bright inside. No home fries only potato choice is hash browns finely shredded and sat flat on the plate. Just hash browns nothing special.  Overall tasted good but nothing to look at. Would stop again if in 'Slope in the morning.

TblEEiPzb-vApiAL9RwaOQ.text: Wow, what a great stop for breakfast.  I was hesitant to go here because I used to go here when it was Le Peep and it was just okay  but now it is has a  refreshed look, new name, great food, and a newer type restaurant that you order at the register and they bring out your food but still have waiter service.  I love the atmosphere and service was great.  I ordered a western omelet and it was delish, the potatoes are fresh cut looking and very flavorful.  My daughter got a breakfast sandwich with ham, cheese and egg that was great!  Check it out soon.

4W-n8GM4NdY9kIs7kv0MxQ.text: There's not too many breakfast places that peak my interest. I'm more of a make my own at home kind of guy, but on those rare occasions when I do venture out I go to Scramble.   Two things that stand out to me the most:  - The presentation of the food  - The outside patio  On Saturday morning, went with a friend of mine. Line was long but goes pretty fast. This is big turn on for me as I hate the long waits I find at more mainstream breakfast oriented restaurants . I just like to sit down and relax in the morning as soon as possible. Decided to go with the Veggie Omelet this time, friend went with a bagel with cream cheese and salmon. We made our way to the outside patio and sat down facing the mountains. Perfect weather this morning had to do it and as stated above one of the reasons why this place gets good marks from me. Food arrived after about 10 minutes which is reasonable, and left good opportunity for conversation with my company.   Veggie omelet came with four slices of whole wheat french toast and potato wedges. I sprinkled some Tapatio hot sauce all around which you can grab at this kiosk type thing on the inside. Omelet was delicious, no complaints there. Potato wedges were also divine, just crisp enough and full of flavor. Hit the spot just right and the portion was also just right. I think this is important. If the food isn't taking up all the space on the plate I don't have the compulsion to eat it all or waste it. It's just a pet peeve of mine and Scramble does a good job of giving just enough to satisfy.   The final point I want to make about Scramble and why it's one of the few places I travel to in this ungodly hour is because you don't get bothered. You buy your food, you grab your utensils/condiments, sit down and the food it brought to you. It's simple. It's easy. And the food is somewhat healthy. My rating is close to a 4.5 only because it's not the best breakfast food I've ever had but the environment and service bring it's close to a 5 star.  With all that said, I would highly recommend Scramble.

TPxTj-1_tFo2OenlycQdoQ.text: Nice little change of pace from the resort breakfast! Always fun when you can sit outside and eat some breakfast, especially knowing the fact that within a few hours we were headed back to Ohio and the snow...so we definetely savored the moment!! Will be back again for sure!

aRLwV70A_31TMjGYQHYSrg.text: This is my favorite place to have breakfast and lunch after a good hike! I highly recommend practically anything off the menu. I always like to try something different every time I come here. The service is good too!

ZfRclWaBx3C2TRxyCSmzRQ.text: Went here for breakfast. Waiting in a long line to order at a counter is never fun, but the atmosphere was nice and the service was great. The food was a little bland, but I highly recommend their hash browns. Their coffee is excellent, and the patio is really nice.

_yfdE7xq2O0UvCSp2PZwmA.text: Great place. Friendly obliging staff. Well organized. Food delicious and presented attractively. Menu--something for everyone.  Love it.

0ykaQ0sVPUC085JiV6Itbw.text: This place is such a surprise. Strip mall location, but boutique quality food and totally refreshing atmosphere. The food is great and the owners care. I love it!

y7bdHcV3uu-SVTw6mq0w0A.text: Meh.  Plus for cool decor. Minus for being in a strip mall (but hey it's Phoenix...)  Cinnamon Roll was good.  Awesome icing. Toluca Brizza was unique, but nothing spectacular.  it would be a good place for groups, with a vast menu (that i hear is very vegan friendly), but they are better places around town for brunch, both in terms of quality and price points.

ACY63gkhFRkNKu4xk6RmFg.text: Looks, feels and tastes like you're eating in an airport cafeteria.  Not crazy about ordering at a window and waiting (a long time!) for the food to be delivered.  The food is colorless, tasteless and boring.  I ordered what I thought would be the most flavorful item on the menu, Southwest Style Eggs Benedict... the "hollandaise" sauce tasted worse than jarred versions, the canadian bacon was chewey and nearly impossible to cut with a knife, the jalepeno cornbread never met a jalepeno in it's life!  The "rosemary potatoes" seemed to be missing rosemary - or salt, pepper, anything with flavor!  The eggs, on the other hand, were fresh and delicious- so just order eggs!  My friend ordered a breakfast pizza with sausage.  It looked and tasted as if it had sat for hours under a warming light.  Had absolutely no flavor at all.  I took a bite and could not begin to tell you what was on it, have never had sausage that tasted just like pizza dough!  I've had better frozen versions.  Honestly for $23 for two breakfasts and two coffees I'd rather eat in an airport cafeteria... the place was exceptionally clean tho, and the staff very friendly.  Will never go there again and cannot recommend it in good conscience.

n0saBDi4WSaSYNWdTR5tNQ.text: We went for breakfast yesterday.  There was 4 of us and they offer 4 different vegan breakfast choices so we ordered one of each,  We often employ this strategy so we can try different things. The place seems borderline cheesy to me.  The service was over the top good but the quality of food and coffee not so much.  Of everything we tried the French Toast was the best of the lot!  They had some sort of sweet potato hash brown that was undercooked and the coffee was on par with the quality of a convenience store.  Bottom line - gimmicky place with good service, below average food and lousy coffee.  I will not be returning any time soon.

hTak3csydbg3cC1km8VFXg.text: We have been coming to this place since it opened. In the beginning the food was wonderful. Lately, the quality of the food has not been up to par. This would be the only hesitation that I have in recommending Scramble to you. The service and coffee are great! They really need to work on their food items and get better chefs in the kitchen for breakfast. We haven't had an order delivered as ordered in the past 12 months. We finally complained last visit and received a card good for two meals on them. Even she said the food did not look appetizing. We keep hoping for the food to be as good as the coffee once again.

XSWVVwhlCKkpeu4s7iPSdw.text: Staff are friendly,  food is tasty and fast. Lots of seating and easy to find. For 3 people we spent about 40.00.

P3tM5itXP7XVRHAp6nMkmQ.text: I was honestly just really disappointed all together. The place is much like a fast food restaurant in the sense that you have to order at a counter. I was excited to see that they had vegan options and ordered the Vegan Veggie and added quinoa on top and as my side I opted for the "fresh cut fruit" which was mushy and sad looking as well as sour in taste. When I saw my tofu scramble I was instantly regretful. The tofu was hardly warm, the sun dried tomatoes chewy and tasteless. All together regretful of the $12 I spent.

7KvWnS0VYBmJsM-hv0KeUA.text: Great heated patio and view of the local mountains. my wifes omlet and rosemary potatoes were really good, but my favorite is french toast.

So, I had the turkey wrap w/ potato cheese soup. It was so yummy!! The soup was awesome as well :) The staff has always been friendly each time we've been and helpful with suggestions when we were unsure of what to try. We will definitely be back!

g5Vq9YDIjKKnRnzqg1fiYQ.text: Awesome..eggs done perfectly and sausage was so tasty.Service was quick and efficient. I would have came every day if I knew it was this great but we did come our last two days

huU6DsmC7-lH2u5WuqRycw.text: The setting is very fun and great energy.  Food was very basic but then we did just order basic items.  Service was friendly and fast.

6GEw3sRFWKEv7O7x9gvAZQ.text: Great food and great service! Has an open and friendly vibe. I just wish they had vegan bread to go with their vegan meals.

nePRzOS2zKQOZYyOQVH-YA.text: We are regulars to this place. Great food, excellent coffee and superb customer service.

69X5hydLT8rpkppKgCDQaQ.text: This place was off the hook incredible!  I took my college student here for breakfast.  We were warmly greeted and the gal behind the counter was so helpful.  The decor was fun, vibrant, hip and very classy clean.  My daughter ordered French toast that was to die for.  I ordered a basic egg, toast and potatoes and the entire breakfast was off the hook amazing.  Definitely going back and next time I am ordering French toast and ordering cinnamon rolls to go!  Definitely a must go to place to eat :-)

Y0r1DsDg7j0j8Ta9uoZu4A.text: Line can be a little long but worth the wait. Staff is always friendly and happy, food is always delicious! A little pricey but that's typical for a brunch joint. Love scramble- go all the time & will continue to!

gAxGw0-EUfaHh1Z3HJegYA.text: Great customer service! Delicious coffee! And the food is amazing!! Definitely will be back!

h-yQ2A4rKKgeYA__I1F3hg.text: Came across this place here on yelp and let me tell you it was totally worth coming here, delicuous! I got the French french toast  with scrambled  browns. The French Toast was different from any I've had before. it was made with a baguette, but was still awesome! My boyfriend got a chorizo burrito with the scrambled browns mixed in and that was so good! Some of the best chorizo I've had in awhile! He got yogurt on the side with his and even that was good! Love how it's self serve drinks and coffee with the option of soy milk:) one of my new favorite breakfast joints!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZJ6c34Dy2VOKq6zZT5FHQQ.text: I go hiking every Sunday and end it with breakfast at Scramble. The food is always excellent and the staff is courteous and kind! I enjoy the outside patio with the misters on during the warmer months. Great place to take out of town visitors. It's not your typical breakfast place. Love it!

kB8uDj-m9QMmmIkA1fs4vg.text: I was trying to find a place i wouldn't have to wait long. At this place you place your order in line take a number and sit. The couple in front of us left asking for a refund and we waited 25 min after placing our order to get out food. For the price it was not a lot of food and it was just average tasting, not sure if i would go back.

zmboOseV3shWhpQX1ngEMg.text: Very clean and put together. I got the vegan french toast and the bf got the toluca brizza. Both were tasty. Fruit was fresh. A friend got one of the eggs benedict dishes which he absolutely loved. It looked really good and i would consider getting that next time. We sat outside... and there were the inevitable flies. A very solid place.

a1LC8ic3SRJba1yGvcq7uQ.text: Our visit was a good one. The greeter out front was a nice way to start our experience. I asked for a special sandwich and management made sure it was right. The sweet potato hash was very tasty. I liked the breakfast blend coffee too.  We asked for crispy hashbrowns and they were just right. Looking forward to trying more items on the menu.

FTJijCiG_vLAmwmYPXDWWg.text: Really, really, really good. Fresh food. Great menu. My bf says the eggs Benedict were above average...some of the best he's ever had.  I had the special swirl pancakes. A dessert bomb. The service was fabulous. Very friendly and speedy. Fresh squeezed OJ. Good coffee.

3GaqxA7fVgj7GYLqe38N5w.text: This is our favorite breakfast spot!  We love the Eggs Benedict (but we've tried other menu items - all great), coffee, staff, decor, etc.  The prices are reasonable.  It's our go to spot.  We've been going for a couple of years and Scramble has never dissappointed!

E0M23n66njGPUiwhvgVpaA.text: Yummy! We had the chicago breakfast pizza. Enough for two people. SUPER friendly staff. If we are ever back in Phoenix, we will stop in!

itIywITiTibY-zfl9QuFJA.text: Great service!  Prices are reasonable. I love that you can take your dog out on the patio and there's no smoking out there.  The "Brizza" or breakfast pizza was a hit with my kiddos!  We will definitely be back when we're in town again.

d8NH5U-PicmAHWMa-z3_QQ.text: Clay, the owner, saw my less-than-stellar review on Yelp. He sent me a private message letting me know their Scottsdale location does serve alcohol. He also offered to send me a gift card if I emailed him my info. I emailed him, but he never followed up so I never got my gift card. That was last year so he's had plenty of time to send it.

JJwKztw4XWWUnj4GEN8EEg.text: HAPPY BIRTHDAY Scramble !  as always , another great breakfast and served with a smile !   and even better , it was 50% off  this morning !  The staff is top of the scale when it comes to customer service , and run by a "WORKING " Manager.... great to see !  food is always FRESH and done just the way I like it every time.  Glad You are here in the Valley of the Sun , right where you belong !

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hugh fluffy pancakes oh hell yeah

UnpLvdLOMqGrH8PqEIey0A.text: I love Scramble.  We were the first people there on Easter Sunday. They open at 6 am & we were there at 6:07.  How can that cute girl taking orders be so nice & cheery that early in the morning?! And it was the same girl as last time. She makes my Scramble experiences fun. The other shorter girl working didn't seem as nice.  My gouda brizza was quite tasty. Omg was it hot when I bit in though! I was SO hungry I just wanted to devour it. Yeah, wait a second before trying to chow down, ok?  Could the cinnamon roll have any more frosting? Wow! Luckily, I like them smothered in the stuff. They just pile it on & you spread it around.  I want to describe Scramble as fresh, open, clean, bright, & modern.  The counter girl agrees with me that they need more than just the cherry flavored Capri-Sun. She said the parfaits are good too. I'm going to have to try 1 some time.

Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wx5VEmNOTcqKytjPdHxVgg.text: We were deciding between US Egg and Scramble, I'm so glad we decided to go here. I ordered the vegetarian scramble with sun dried tomato, squash, zucchini, onion and Monterey cheese. The sweetness from the tomato was delicious. The scramble came with rosemary potatoes and toast. Rosemary + crispy potatoes, what's not to love? I decided to skip the toast and add the whole wheat pancakes. When our waitress set my plate down the smell of cinnamon was overwhelming and inviting. They put fresh cinnamon in the pancake batter.   I don't normally eat a large breakfast, but from time to time I will make an exception and visit Scramble. The restaurant is very clean, simply decorated and had good music in the background.

OknoZQ-D-vhGprikDqH6Gg.text: A friend of mine informed me that this place was mediocre.  In my opinion he highly over rated this place.  I wish a manager would sit in the corner and watch the employees.  Might learn a few things about why the food is delivered cold and only after an extended wait time.  I can't believe we sat there watching our food get cold on the server bar while the two guys had a conversation, laughed and joked.  If you can't fix the service, at least black out the glass, so I don't have to watch my food sitting there getting old. After an extended time period, the server did come over and apologize because there was an incident with my Eggs Benedict and they were going to have to remake my order.  Guess what?  The other meal we ordered sat there getting even colder. This place had a nice amount of customers coming through the doors and many will not come back if this is the type of service they receive.  I felt sorry for the young lady at the register.  On more than one time I heard her apologizing to customers about different things that were going wrong. It is a shame because we could use a good breakfast place in the area.

5YkBowYr7ykb78SDvI2ILQ.text: Went there with my family on a Saturday morning and had an excellent breakfast. Try the Santa Fe Benedict, it was great. Very clean and bright and efficient and friendly staff. Definitely be back.

8uVGpgYX-z4ccjvMJZZW3w.text: Customer service was great, the restaurant was extremely clean and the food was amazing! Served 11 folks in our group and everyone enjoyed all the variety of options. Cinnamon roll rocked! The creamy spread can be portioned onto the roll as desired. Loved that it wasn't dripping with goop! Great value and generous portions. Only downside is the uncomfortable metal chairs and cafeteria-style layout.

tjhocuJOVTtKJocK04MXdA.text: Have you ever been to one of those places that always seems to have a line? Well this is one of those places. But the line always moves fast, and its well worth the wait! The food is out of this world, delicious and locally sourced whenever possible. My favorite so far has been the toluca brizza, which is a breakfast pizza with chorizo, bell peppers and jalapeno cream cheese. The service is top notch, you can really tell that management puts an emphasis on it. If you're in need of breakfast this place should definitely be on your list.

0iFnpfv8NZTXjY6WzlKDzA.text: I love, love, love this place. My boyfriend and I come here at least once a month. The food is amazing; I usually get the Costa Burrito, Strawberry French Toast, or a brizza (breakfast pizza); today I was wanting something a bit healthier so I tried the Apple Power Pancakes ... they were most excellent and super filling.  The staff is also extremely friendly and helpful.  It is nice to sir inside or on the dog-friendly patio and is an overall great experience.

8F3AsgwF25Dun2vdx2323A.text: After a year of being vegetarian, came to Scramble for the biscuits and gravy after reading about it in the New Times.  The over easy eggs were perfectly cooked and the bacon was wonderful.  The biscuits and gravy were too thick for my palate and the sausage tasted a little too much like a pizza.  Overall though a good experience.  Customer service was super friendly and a real plus.

7-tYh5r4NmyOjBjQw7NJ-Q.text: Good options for both healthy and hearty eaters. I've been on both sides. The brizza is legit. You feel it for the rest of the day, but it's worth it. Went this morning and had an egg white western omelette. Not on same level as brizza, but can't expect too much from egg whites.

euPiYk3yenhjtuWqSyFK6g.text: I used to frequent this place years and years ago when it was Le Petite Cafe so decided that I might as well try this new place. It's completely gutted from when it was the other restaurant and has a very open but hipster feel to it. The menu is on boards as soon as you walk in and you go further up to place your order with the waitress. Number in hand, you sit anywhere and someone delivers the food when you're ready. I've been to places like that before but it's still a weird concept for a "sit down" place. I got the Sunrise Sandwich which is basically runny eggs and ham with cheese on toast and a side of pan-fried rosemary seasoned potatoes. The sandwich was really good with plenty of ham and a lot of flavour but, and I say this as a potato lover, the potatoes were not edible. They were rubbery and flavourless like they had been sitting under a heat lamp all morning. This wouldn't bother me from a place like Denny's but if I'm going to be paying nearly $8 for something I can make at home at a fraction of the cost, I expect high quality and flavour. Also tried the Italian coffee and cinnamon roll. The cinnamon roll was very fluffy and had a good helping of frosting on it. I liked that they didn't melt the frosting over it. The coffee was very good but a little costly at over $2 for self-serve no-frills coffee. Even Starbucks is cheaper than that.   Overall, much left to be desired. Decent food but I've had more satisfying experiences at iHop at much better prices.  I can only assume all the high ratings are from people who aren't super into breakfast like me. It's my favourite meal so I know when it's lacking. I'll continue mourning the loss of the little cute France-themed breakfast joint that was.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunrise Sandwich, $7.79

TA8w-pXWfQJz6mTC6NgpjQ.text: Great breakfast food! Love the experience and just the whole idea behind this place. I like that they have everything from vegan food to very decadent dishes, definitely something for everyone. Their employees are really friendly too.

McBjkmLS62pb0B9Rm8bLgg.text: Great place for vegan breakfast! I love the French Toast and the Soyrizo Burrito.  My husband loves the Sunrise Sandwich.  It is great to go out to breakfast and both be able to order something delicious off of one menu.

_syOxBQo7Eiz8XQ4XQzhww.text: Really good breakfast food with limited lunch. Great service and the price is reasonable. Open until 2 pm.

-zNL_RxHEdqm_ZBl-1o9xg.text: This place rules!!! I mean, I think so. My boyfriend who I love sooo much, and he is sooo cute! and he is sooo funny and smart and I am soooo in love with him!!! Anyway, we came here and he gets the biscuits and gravy which he always says, ''these are hearty as fuck!'' He likes them. I get the berry pancakes which are totally good! but I can't finish them. And I eat them with hash browns which are the BEST! And we drink juice that is orange. The employees are nice and whatever. I just really love my boyfriend!

VMbem_0C4gLyWb-hlR2Nyw.text: Came here with a bunch of coworkers to celebrate another coworker's last day with us.  Everyone felt like having breakfast and our supervisor suggested this great place.   The moment we walked in we were greeted with happy staff people.  I still think it's a tad bit too early to be that happy!  But oh wells, they probably loved their job.  The place was super clean, and quite delightful, and smelled nice.  We ordered and sat down, and the food came out pretty fast.  Their pancakes were amazing, and I don't really eat pancakes.  But they were delicious!!  I had to eat my coworkers because she was stuff, then I ate my supervisor's when she wasn't looking, and I ate her supervisor's as well.  Ate too much that morning, had to use their loo.  Super clean and well kept at the time I used it.  I love the sound of the flush too, like a massive wave crashing down.  More powerful then a common house toilet, but not as powerful as the ones at the mall, perfectly balance.   Overall a great place, and I would definitely come again if I'm ever on that side of town.

uSc6iAb8km5XWC9zuEfPzw.text: Party of 4 adults and 2 kids on a Saturday morning, and found a table outside with a great view of the mountains.  Everyone loved their food, but the highlight for me was the blueberry stuffed french toast with white chocolate.   The portion was generous and the toast was accompanied with tasty hash browns.  The line was long, but it gave us time to decide what to order, and it moved fairly quickly.  I'd have no problem recommending Scramble to anyone.  I'll be back without question!

ekm2EeuVhkaPScdcoy-Uuw.text: Had an amazing Tex mex Benedict and the flavors and textures were really good. The biscuit it was on was very soft , the Hollandaise sauce was fantastic . My egg was not perfect but that is my only complaint. Did pick up service and the cashier was very friendly. Will definitely be back

VzvxhiGHLS0BHjwxv6iC5g.text: This is a fun, trendy place to stop in for breakfast. I ordered the biscuits and gravy with hash browns and it was huge! You could definitely split this with someone. It was good but I would have preferred a little less gravy - it was a lot piled on. The atmosphere was great in this quick service style place. Definitely worth a visit!

n93WQWsljOj7r_NFV5Zt7w.text: This place is AMAZING. The staff here is awesome. My girlfriend and I are regulars and have been coming for a while. They basically know our order. Everyone is so friendly and if they make something not to your liking the own it and take care of it with a great attitude (this happens very rarely). Never once have we had a bad experience and we are here about 4 days a week!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4kqKrcN0lL8_DazIK8YZwA.text: Scramble has quickly become one of my favorite breakfast spots in the valley! The staff is friendly, they have bottomless coffee with many types of creamers including soy milk. They have a nice little vegan menu that my husband are thrilled about. We often get the Vegan French toast or the Soyrizo Burrrito I am sure the other vegan option out just as delicious, one day I will find out. In the meantime if you are looking for a great spot that has food for all lifestyles check out one of the three Scramble locations you will be happy that you did.

mwoliZAFXxIGWB5Vt_HQow.text: An interesting format where you get in line to order then the poor servers have to wander around to find you. This place seems to be trying to be Eggslut or Snooze but it's just not there yet.   The food was decent but bland at best....and really no Tapatio available? My sourdough was very dry and the eggs were overcooked.  $20 for a California omelette and a drink? $0.75 extra for almond milk? Then they try to force you to tip with a card by hiding the "no tip" option. I would much rather go to US Eggs and wait the extra 5 minutes.  TLDR; Decent but basically an overpriced Denny's

92sUEwULviumobDbi7CmIQ.text: We visited Scramble on a Sunday morning that Google advised was their busiest time. We were pleasantly surprised that wasn't the case. There may have been 4 people in front of us online and plenty of seating options.   Unfortunately, that's where the issues began.   Multigrain Pancakes: The flavor of both the pancakes and syrup were good but they were undercooked. The middle of both pancakes were very doughy and mushy.   Sausage Patties: The flavor was slightly above average but they weren't very warm.   Biscuits & Gravy: The biscuits were decent and the gravy had pretty good flavor. But they were both cold which was strange since the plate was very warm.   Hash Browns: These were about average in the flavor end but were definitely overdone causing them to be dark and super crunchy.   The Switch: We asked someone about the biscuits and gravy temp and they gladly took the plate along with the hash browns back to the kitchen. Someone else brought back a new plate of biscuits and gravy but this time with bacon on the side and without the hash browns. We explained we didn't order bacon and the hash browns were our side. He immediately asked if we would like to keep the bacon (which was nice) and went back to the kitchen to get the hash browns. He was very courteous, polite & apologetic. We thought, no worries, they were making our order right.   Round 2: Unfortunately, the 2nd round of biscuits and gravy were similar in temp... Possibly a bit warmer but definitely almost cold. Also, the replacement hash browns were strange. They were some recipe that wasn't offered on the menu. They offer traditional, bacon & sweet potato but these were dripping in oil and heavily doused with garlic something else (possibly rosemary). The gentlemen helping us admitted he didn't know what those hash browns were. We wound up sending the new order back as well.   Service: It took maybe 3 minutes before the young man waiting on us came back with a full refund of our meal. He apologized profusely and said they are usually on top of things but had definitely missed the mark on our meal. He invited us to come back & gave us our refund receipt.   Summary: My guess is we caught them on a bad day. The flavor of the food and customer service definitely warrant a second chance. The atmosphere is nice and casual. I've also heard good things about their burritos so it's a place I'd definitely recommend everyone to give it a try.

2ED0dCG0R3DG52POwYN1iw.text: UM. When Jesus resurrects this is the first place he'll come to. Yes. You read correctly.   I indulged in the Soyrizo Vegan Burrito except I had it as a scramble because I can't have gluten and the cashier let me sub in tomatoes which was bombtastic. In addition to not being able to eat gluten I have other food restrictions so I don't eat out a lot. For that, I am SO happy to have found scramble. It was honestly the best breakfast I've had in years. The employees were also super nice, helpful and attentive! Yay for customer service not being dead!!   I brunched with my boyfriend and he ordered the Chile Verde Burrito and the Blueberry French toast. He describes his experience at Scramble as a culinary journey of deliciousness and adds, "it's like the big o in my mouth." Hahahaha  We are from out of town, and we can confidently say we will be back for more brunch!   P.S. IF YOU ARE HANGRY - just read this. PHENOMENAL BREAKFAST SERVED ALL DAY.

cRkzVDCpcZzRQlqe4yKftA.text: Came across this gem of a place today, thanks to Yelp. My boyfriend got the huevos rancheros and I got the tofu scramble with an iced white mocha. Food was great, staff was very kind and helpful and yay for all the great vegan options!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gq2JRsXtvOSaG-0-ZjOOVg.text: Scramble is average-at-best.   Beware: this is not a full-service restaurant. If you want to sit down and have a server bring you cups of coffee and piping hot food, this is not for you. You will wait in line for at least 45 minutes before placing an order with the cashier You will then sit at a table with a little plastic number for 30 minutes waiting for your food.  The coffee is bad and my eggs were cold by the time my food came.  With so many great breakfast//brunch spots in Phoenix, I probably won't be back.

nAuu7ob7dQl-Yg1k3iirKA.text: Vegan Scramble...Vegan Burrito...Vegan French Toast...do I really need say anything else? Ummmm Yeah I do RUN don't walk to this awesome establishment for great food...great service and good prices. Eat, Drink and be Merry, my Friends!!!!!

gusvaSKegvim3wj_-wC7aw.text: "Yelped it" and found this place. It matches the great reviews! There was a little bit of a line (it is a place where you order and then they bring you your food, however the wait wasn't crazy long and the food came out really quickly!) ***We came in a little bit before 11am.***  They also have latte drinks, smoothies, and Brew Coffee, even a fruity pebble cereal smoothie! We got the meat lovers omelet, the blueberry stuffed French toast, and tried maybe what was the best thing we ordered,  the breakfast pizza, or "Brizza" called the Chicago. The hash browns were crispy and delicious, which is one of  my major pet peeves with breakfast joints. Everything was well balanced flavors, nothing was over seasoned. Also they have a good sized Vegan menu, which sounded tempting to this carnivore. The staff was very accommodating and very nice, everything was clean and well kept.  Try this spot out!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meat lovers omelet, &#34;The Chicago&#34; breakfast &#34;brizza&#34;,  and the blueberry stuffed french toast with white chocolate cream cheese stiffed.

lBGKC2Bo37NfvhwlrtFsoA.text: The food was great! I would recommend the hash browns, the cinnamon roll, and pancakes. The eggs were great too! The staff was great, we went in the afternoon & it wasn't busy at all. Next time I'll try the coffee drinks!

bXE2iY9L1vmUbcHRpTL9VQ.text: I went there on a Saturday morning for brunch (that's so typical of me). You will find a queue as soon as you enter. Don't worry! The queue moves fast. It will even give you enough time to figure out what to order. I wanted to vegan that day and I ordered Tofu scramble with a side of regular hash browns and fruit bowl. I never knew tofu scramble could be that tasty. It was a scramble made of tofu, portobello mushrooms, spinach and sun dried tomatoes. The service was great with very little waiting for food. You have plenty of options on the menu as well. Overall,it's a good place for a happy brick with family.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

G9ZHHoRJtJEuV7_PDk57Sg.text: Met a friend here for brunch. Customer service is amazing the cashier had a very great positive attitude and helped us make choices!   I ordered their soyricho breakfast burrito and it was super delicious. They are definitely vegan friendly they will adjust any meal to your preference which is always a huge plus!   I also ordered their vegan French toast which was also very yummy and highly recommend trying the out!   All in all I will be coming here again!

WU5cHlSsC2EyZl5BxQqKLA.text: I ordered the huevos rancheros through uber eats and I didn't like it at all. It comes on tortilla chips which are way too salty and too many of them to the amount of other stuff. Ended up adding my own egg and salsa so I'm not eating salty dry chips. More like breakfast nachos not huevos rancheros.   Will be willingly to try something else next time since this place has good reviews just not the greatest dish to order.  I would add a photo but I already broke up all my tortilla chips and added the extra egg and salsa you don't want to see it.

tUMvQRJ1oaYB2h-cDjOajQ.text: For a breakfast joint you would think that it would be excellent breakfast. Scrambles were a joke, I get more meat at McDonald's all egg in both of them. The hasbrowns(did you mean raw potatoes) cook the. Not many people I know like raw potatoes. I was really excited to try this place out. But it did not leave up to the reviews!

vq0SOk9OwDKvCTwxyUmM9Q.text: This place was so cute and with an awesome mountain view. You order your food when you walk in and they bring the food to the table of your choice. Pro tip: Check in on Yelp for the first time and get a free coffee (as of 10/22/18)!  Everyone was super friendly and the atmosphere is very laid back. I was solo dining and felt very comfortable eating there and hanging out a bit to read.   I got the Western Omelette with egg whites, sweet potato hash (because of a Yelp review), biscuits, a side of bacon and coffee. The omelette was okay, a bit bland and kind of runny, which I ignored just to get through it. Once I added salt and pepper, it was delicious. The bacon wasn't crunchy enough, but that was my fault for not specifying. The hash browns were meh and I didn't eat all of them. The biscuits were super fluffy and fresh and the coffee was really good as well.

ptnQGpp2QShkzGVFDd0V9A.text: The service and menu is out of this world.  The cheddar hash browns is amazing, nothing like it.  Ranch is Huevos is amazing, also the breakfast Brizzas.  This is local, the owner and staff are great..

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

NsIOsAYctu5NSzCJjngpGA.text: I was hoping to find a cozy breakfast place with good bacon, fair prices and a nice warm morning vibe.  Scramble is none of that.  Bright white and  chrome chairs with club  music it feels like a modern European youth place.  I find it annoying that you stand at the counter to give you order and pay ahead of time, where they put a big "tip" line on the receipt (for what?), reading off a glass covered 'menu', then get your own drink, table service, napkins & water.   Want ketchup?  Over there on the rack, with the salt & pepper, Tabasco, etc..   Kind of like eating at home, only more expensive.   Very modern / trendy, but very cold.  The young gals working there (can't really call them servers or waitresses) were polite and cute, but there will be all new ones next week, like most Scottsdale eateries.  The food was OK.  Not great, but OK.  Very average bread, cold hard little butter wrappies, white square plates to match the motif.  OJ, serve yourself, not fresh squeezed... watery.    Kudos for having Fox News on the TVs!     Can't really give it more than an average rating and won't go back

YiQc7surECJuUdtMFmmoOg.text: I enjoyed this place so much that I can't wait until my next trip to AZ to eat there again! The food was fresh, simple, and affordable! Their menu had every breakfast option available to please everyone. I had the Santa Fe eggs Benedict which was different but so delicious. This place also offers an amazing view of the mountains from the patio seating, which was a major plus for me! The customer service was beyond great as well!

MLeP14BVsBiFykNIjo4hig.text: This place is AWESOME! Today we had Banana Pecan Pancakes, and Southwest Scramble. The food is excellent, the food is outstanding, and all staff are very friendly. We will definitely be coming back, SOON!

1yEl0WtDgNChVuVue-kqbw.text: It's and order at counter place, which I don't normally like. However was greeted with a welcoming smile and a bubbly host  Wide range of items but I stuck to usual  Eggs were cooked just right and sausage patties taste homemade with the light bounce in them when you hit with a fork  I loved (and mean loved ) that they have loose tea. I had an Irish breakfast. Please don't ruin it by not having it with full fat milk  I love you Americans but your tea drinking habits have a lot to be desired ;-)  Next time you in Phoenix pop Im - worth it

Eq3HfPaq5QRmrfrPjeM1gg.text: The breakfast pizzas are amazing! I ordered two of them on gluten free dough and was very impressed. I especially loved the jalapeno cream cheese. Coffee is also super yummy!

PoEgP74WNld7WwYOR2vhvA.text: Made my way out to Scramble this past Sunday with my lady..  Place is not what I imagined...you place your order, sit down, and food is brought to you in 5-10 minutes.  Outdoor seating is great and dog friendly, and a nice little mountain view.  While my french toast was great, the pancakes were solid...but the breakfast burrito stole the show. The Costa Burrito to be exact, highly recommended!  This is a must go to breakfast spot. Friendly staff, comfy seating, great views and great vibes!

ZwGJbJSymLFInEkvhkFMHQ.text: This place was packed on Saturday for brunch.  So packed that they had to stop the line from ordering for 15 minutes so the kitchen could catch up.    I was with my family - a party of 9.  Luckily we were able to find a place to sit outside that accommodated all of us considering how busy it was. You have to scout for your own table so on a busy day you have to be an expert with the eagle eye and find your table before someone else does.  Food was really good - I had the eggs benedict and an orange juice.  The service was nice considering how busy they were.  I would definitely come back again.

Pwj8eERWuIiwKFgjucqQTA.text: Staff was great. It's not a concept I'm familiar with where you order at the counter and wait for it to be brought to your table. I really felt rushed to make a decision since there was a line and I had never been. The cost was way higher than I would have expected. I spent nearly $80 for 5 meals, 5 drinks and 2 yogurt parfaits. The food was not that wonderful for the price that's for sure! I won't be returning next time I'm in the area.

bZ1Sq7xHRWpB8GbZ7HcvcQ.text: Very overpriced. Small portions. Also self serve. Nice indoor/outdoor atmosphere but Won't be back.

iafrQgiTaNYUge5-ludiwQ.text: Scramble A Joint is definitely my go to on a lazy Saturday or Sunday Brunch. Absolute love all breakfast items which I've tried. They deliver through Eat24 and Postmates. Way cheaper through Eat24! Plenty of food and good grub if your hungover ;)

DivnZx--3U9K5zzztB2QWA.text: We don't usually get a chance to come to this side of town but are doing a staycation nearby. We decided to stop here for breakfast and weren't disappointed! Everything was delicious! The California omelette and the French French toast was delicious. I would definitely recommend popping by. I also love that they have not traditional wiki sticks for kids to play with. Much better than the usual cheap Crayons and paper.

FIVKhbKI8khpVfmALTJAmA.text: Great service, great atmosphere and great food. I was in Phoenix for the day and decided on this place based on yelp, totally worked out

-Gl2y22TQ0q2byBYUi1kPA.text: My  husband and I shared the egg white veggie omelet and chocolate chip pancakes.  The pancakes were so thick - I LOVED them!!!  The egg white omelets were also pretty good (as good as egg white omelets can be!) and we loved the sausage and potatoes that came along with it.  We were in the area for a quick getaway as the grandparents helped us watch the kiddo.  We live pretty far from here but if we ever had the chance to come here again, we would!!

lSwLA291IsMqp1ywnwDGSw.text: The food was cold & mediocre. I wasted $30 on bad food and fake perky employees. The employees are wayyy to happy & in your face the entire time. Do not go here hungover. I would have only given 1 star for bad food but they allow puppies on the patio...

PIKLh8BPgya7AaDvKbN6Qw.text: This place is outstanding!  I'm sitting in front of a gluten free friendly plate of bacon - the most wonderful hash browns - and eggs, and everything is delicious.  My husband has a veggie omelet that came out right the first time (no small feat for most places!).  The servers are super friendly, service is quick, and the restaurant is absolutely spotless!  This place is a keeper!

LWZCWKcr3vK3kJ1oNiLiJg.text: Ever since my friend recommended this food place I be been coming here ever since, the service is great and all the girls are nice and friendly.. the food is amazing! I get the sunrise sandwich!! I won't stop coming here!! A++

3qLXTmmShqYC0fkzTHUCFg.text: First time visitors, didn't realize that it wasn't full service, so p;aced order at front desk, two breakfasts came to $28.00, (extra charge for bacon) on to coffee distribution area coffee luke warm had to find someone to nuke coffee for us. After getting our food mediocre to say the least, certainly not worth the price.Will say the staff was very nice and pleasant .

R3_9M7FwtQsRMthvit19xA.text: Live walking distance away from this breakfast joint and all I can say is nothing but good things. The service is quick and friendly. Food: amazing. I've had the waffle, southwestern breakfast burrito, and biscuits & gravy, all delicious! My girlfriend has the eggs Benedict every single time- always cooked to perfection. The outdoor patio seating is wonderful & dog friendly (which is a plus for us dog lovers)  Oh! and all you can drink coffee too :)

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits &amp; Gravy....YUM

1urmv6362I635AgUG0YM5g.text: Time to focus on the positive. Scramble has turned their quality control around and I need to recognize them for doing so.  In my previous reviews I go on and on about the Toluca breakfast pizza and was dismayed as it seem to be getting less fantastic every time I stopped in. To the point of not recommending it anymore to anyone. Did it stop me from checking in? No. I'm glad I kept checking.   At least a half dozen in a row over the last few months have been great. I'm so happy!  Special notice regarding customer service: Stacy rocks! She's is the kind of employee that keeps a business going and customers coming in. She gives a damn and works hard. I believe she might be responsible for the triumphant return of the Toluca! She always asks me how it is and is actually interested in my answer. Thanks Stacy!

sOW47bgcI3RTB_Q8UHXkNA.text: Great place with modern menu, they're not as flexible on menu alterations! Thru charge xtra for everything now.. use to be One my fav hang outs for breakfast but they need to do something about managing this place! The line could be all the way out the door and it doesn't important enough to attend to the people in line instead they have one person running the register when there's 2 registers! It's always a problem here.. so we took out business somewhere else! As a business owner myself I just don't understand it.. because see people just leave and guess what I was one of them today it's ridiculous!!

7erTtiW6Xb3AYbqVY_E3sg.text: Anyplace that serves breakfast all day is a big plus in my book. It's hard to screw up breakfast, but some are better than others. I went to this place twice on my last trip to PHX. It has decent food and the cinnamon rolls are incredibly soft. Will go again if I am in the neighborhood.

C6xsDfmLvRTKmXJtN28heQ.text: I almost went with "meh"... I had a lazy morning so I decided to venture far, far away from my CenPho hangouts and try out this bfst place I'd heard bunches about.   Sigh, I thought it was around Glendale and it wasn't... it's way way north.  I could almost touch the Pointe at Tapatio, and was about to turn around when I saw it's big bright sign.   Okay, yay!  Breakfast.  I was hungry by then. So I go in, and, sigh... I have to stand and study the big plastic menu boards, very similar to Pei Wei's... mix and match, each item priced individually, pick an omelette and add some sides of your choice.... sigh, it's a chain.  Or if it's not a chain they decided that looking like a chain was the way to go.  Not for me. Interior is uber clean, give 'em that. Kinda too efficient, too slick.   Midcentury modern styling with the Toledo aluminum chairs, cool colors and styling - they got it goin' on in that way.  But for breakfast, I just wanna sit down and order off a menu.   This is that "fast casual" style where you order at the counter and they'll give you a number you clip to a stand at your table.  Service was friendly.   The food was good.  I had a veggie omelette, rosemary potatoes and some pancakes. Oh they blew it with the syrup.  Yes I'm a syrup snob.   Aunt Jemima fans:  don't ever, ever try real maple syrup from Vermont because you can never use that thick gloppy fake syrup again.   Yes, Scramble serves that thick, gloppy fake syrup stuff.  The pancakes were just a little less than "okay" - a little too rubbery, a little too thick, a little too dry, and got cold fast.   And that icky fake syrup doesn't help.  Anyway, this place is okay, but I wouldn't ever go back because it was a looooong drive for me.   I'll stick with my faves: Matt's Big Breakfast, Over Easy, and I'll keep mourning the loss of my beloved Palatte.  Sigh.

H0-yODdN31_vzyj0vpKIyg.text: We went to scramble for the first time today.  I ordered the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict.  Delicious!  Similar to the traditional eggs benedict but with a southwest flair.  If you are a fan of eggs benedict I would recommend this dish.  My husband had the Tocula pizza.  Which was very savory.  The menu indicated the pizza was spicy but the spice was more derived from the chorizo and a little kick of jalapeno.  Not as spicy as expected and very good.  On top of the delicious meal we recieved a frequent visitor card which gave us 10% off, which we can use on our future visits.  I'm not sure if everyone gets one of those cards or how it works.  Definitely try Scramble if you want Breakfast that is above ordinary.  We can't wait to go there again!

TImVKbY4hoWD5gbf1voMzQ.text: Great variety on menu, you really can't go wrong with anything you order.  Must try the cinnamon buns, they're really good!!  My favorite thing is the biscuits made from scratch! They also have good specials, I'm not sure if they're only on the weekends.

36Tk1AB0b79pulQ5Fhe7xQ.text: This place is truly a 2.5.  Its neither good or bad really.  I've tried the breakfast pizza (brizza) and a burrito.  Id recommend the brizza over the burrito.  The brizza is just like it sounds, a breakfast pizza.  You can get a few different combos of ingredients.  The inside of the building is super clean and that trendy/modern/chic style that we've been seeing lately.  They had about every type of tobasco ever invented on the condiment bar.  The price was a little high for what it was.  I would much rather try out something new than repeat this one to be quite honest.

7CS-XGYC9EjSFWBFT3ck6w.text: I'm a chef and I know my food. I'm usually skeptical when it comes to eating at breakfast places. This place was amazing! My boyfriend had Sunrise Sandwich and I had french toast. The bacon they use is fantastic and the french toast is made from baguettes. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast. We're definitely coming back! Next time I'm going to try one of their breakfast pizzas :)

9latwpq8Fd2B17dlSZ_x-g.text: Nice people but I didn't love it. The sausage was really fatty and the multi-grain pancakes were heavy as lead. My friend didn't like her meal either especially because the red potatoes were overcooked on the outside and undercooked on the inside.

d5ERtXQTOXdcIw9cC-64JA.text: My husband and I were looking for a place for breakfast recently while visiting Phoenix and with the help of Siri (on iphone) we found Scramble.  It is a very nice, clean and considering the size of the room a very quiet place.  We happen to enjoy being able to order of a simple menu at the counter and very quickly finding our way to a table,  The food great and the service was friendly.  I thoroughly enjoyed my French Toast and my husband loved his Eggs Benedict.  The place was fresh and clean.  Simply decorated too!  We sat near the kitchen service area and never heard any noise....as well as the piped in music was the perfect level....no one had to raise their voices to be heard!  We look forward to going there again someday....unfortunately we were only visiting.

_wazS0grjzdPrCa6IqpVIg.text: Scramble is a breath of hip air in the otherwise mundane north valley.  It adds a bit of flare with it's college hip atmosphere (although at times thrown off by the families and senior citizens, but hey....they're all cool too!) into the border of Sunnyslope and Moon Valley.  The food is a wonderful fusion of classic/southwest and it is all as healthy as it can be (come on, how healthy can sausage and loads of butter be?).  If you sit out on the patio, your reward will be a beautiful of Sunnyslope with the mountain preserve as your backdrop, and a nice sunrise to lighten the whole thing up if you make it early enough.  Definitely one of the best breakfast/brunch places in the North Valley.  Hopefully this catches on..............

kFV79Slx-HXaaNKHz7H68Q.text: French toast hard, had to use my knife with force.  Never had scrambled eggs flat and perfectly round.  They were not fluffy or tasty. Won't go back I've had better

xf0DMFbRLYiW6RN-EzohMA.text: Great breakfast spot-quick, casual, good food. Really liked it!

2tY0LklnZNaCbTEABojvPg.text: Wife loved the santa fe eggs Benedict, the chocolate chip pancakes were made chocolaty(a good thing)..was expecting fresh squeezed o.j. but overall a good eat.

kp1U81SKFVYaNrVNX3uU2A.text: Yummy yummy yummy!  Delicious french toast, pancakes and eggs.  It's a treat to go out to breakfast and a double-treat if you go to Scramble.  I wish the breakfast included a little more food for the price though.  Otherwise it would be a 5-star for me.

k0paoDN8DNrxmU6aJTKHGA.text: The french toast is amazing! I enjoyed the set-up and flow of this location. I enjoy the fact that after serving your meal the employees do not harrass you while you enjoy said meal. However, should you need assistance they are close by to answer any questions.

Uo7eyuDNOSn601qu3jQ3KQ.text: Found this place thanks to yelp and I am glad I checked it out.  Nice laid back atmosphere with a help yourself style.  I had the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict and the jalapeno corn bread was awesome.  Also had the Chorizo, peppers & jalapeno cream cheese Brizza and that was also very good.  If you are looking for a new breakfast joint with some new takes on traditional breakfast food I would give Scramble a try.

QCVgt7HkE0dZkJW313BVww.text: The santa fe eggs benedict was delicious, so was the gouda and apple wood bacon brizza. I highly recomend both. The orange juice was nothing out of the ordinary. Id stick with a regular drink. the hot sauce selection is what made this place a 5 star  for me.

o-jWMUMSpj8fx3MMI98YfQ.text: Consistently a warm friendly place. Staff is always smiling and helpful. The food is awesome but this place is always happy. Working in the service industry for 35 years smiling faces with a helpful positive attitudes is a big plus. My compliments to the owners/admin for grooming an outstanding environment.    Just today, I was in a bit of a slump this morning and when I walked through the door a worker passed me carrying food and looked over, smiled, and said good morning I will be right with you. A guy in a black shirt walked passed carrying food looked over, smiled, and said good morning. I placed my order and started towards a table Cherri smiled and said good morning. Cherri is always smiling, professional, and helpful. It brought me right out of my slump and put me in a better mood. I just wanted to say thank you! Scramble, you have a top notch place here at 7th Str. Thanks again, Cory

r5VnwFh4S-gdHnpJCtqNkQ.text: Just had a delicious lunch at Scramble - I had the turkey club and it was FABULOUS!!!!!

7z9-zHmCcTp7_YiATK7vzA.text: We are in town to catch some Spring Training games and always on the lookout for local gems. We were looking for a breakfast spot close to our hotel and the reviews for this place looked good. This restaurant is fast casual. You order at a register, similar to a place like Pei Wei, get a number and find a table. I ordered the Brizza which is a breakfast pizza with Gouda and Applewood Smoked Bacon. The wife had the breakfast burrito with chorizo.  The kids wanted oatmeal, and we got the smalls for them. The food was brought out by a cheerful server, the rest like silverware and beverages are self serve. The food was delicious. The Brizza was awesome and definitely tasted like breakfast. My wife loved her burrito, which had nice spice but was not overwhelming. The kids were happy. My only knock on the place like others have mentioned was the drink prices. Everything was $2.50 to $3.00, which took our bill for four north of $40 which is bordering on the hotel prices. Overall excellent food quality and enjoyable atmosphere. High recommend from me.

miB682srBGecpAvuDGJAZg.text: hands down, i love breakfast food... i like eating it for lunch and dinner. scramble has a fun flare for egg lovers....and if you have ever been to half moon sports gril-- they're the same owners. ... back to the eggs... mine were made perfect to order, the service was friendly, the atmosphere was a "morning-feel, fun, hip, breakfast-joint." even better when you're with friends and saving money! here's a free printable coupon on a local website supporting arizona locals. the-penny-pinchers.com/C...

Pgq-RgvdQ4-lXlT3Mf694g.text: Came here by myself after a hike with my dog.  I had never been here before so did not know you need to go inside to place your order.  A waitress came out and realized I was alone, brought me a menu and then proceeded to take my order and place it inside for me. Had a delicious breakfast and will be back!  Customer service here is exceptional!

EgElBEVtHRzoiEKkI0_hog.text: We've been here pretty often-I totally forgot to write a review eons ago.  It's a fun place.. menu items right on the wall when you walk in.  Modern decor, simple and to the point.  I love the meat scramble and the brizza-very tasty.  It gets crazy busy on the weekends. We went as a large group on a Sunday-eek, got stuck having to sit outdoors which would be fine, if it weren't August in Phoenix. This can sometimes make me think twice about going-the line can go out the door!!  The seating can be limited when it's busy, so keep that in mind.  Kid friendly with nice kid options too, and they get a little kids packet thing to play with.  Plenty of high chairs!

gCkXT4QxuL7gJEIkuprqoA.text: I visited Scramble for breakfast with a group of coworkers and I wasn't really impressed.  The food came out fast but the taste was just ok and I felt I paid too much money for it; at least the Americano coffee was the best part of my meal.  So I thought ok let me give the "popular item", the cinnamon roll, a chance.  That was a disappointment since the frosting was cream cheese and I had to scrape off the mountain of it.  I suggest they notate on the menu that the cinnamon roll comes with cream cheese frosting since they typically come with vanilla icing. Over all the customer service better than the food.

x0oh2gFi2vHyGM_c8u34Ag.text: Had breakfast here early Saturday morning and there was already a line! I got the Garden Scramble, French Toast to share and a hot Chai Latte. Service was amazing -- they happily remade my Chai Latte after I told them it needed more Chai. It was delicious! The scramble and French toast were good as well, though nothing outstanding enough to mention. Bf got the Brizza, which he said he liked. Good enough place for us for a hearty breakfast!

RCCTf9kP9adot5kkHj5Zww.text: I usually have client meetings in the morning, which is followed by breakfast. On a regular basis, I search for some good place to have a breakfast and Jeff suggested the "Scramble A Breakfast Joint" and afterwards this place became one of my favourite places for breakfast with clients.  The Atmosphere, Staff and Food are AWESOME!!!  The Music is really touching and which makes my whole day Joyful.  Go and feel the atmosphere of Scramble A Breakfast Joint

CjfONqSef2hUAPsOpApBmw.text: Boyfriend and I met his parents here on a beautiful Saturday morning. The place was packed, but since it's an order at the counter, take your number to the table place, there was no problem finding a spot on their sunny-yet-shaded patio.  I appreciate that it's semi-self serve, because that means I can refill my coffee as much as I want and grab any condiments I want (Cholula! Varieties of Tabasco! Ketchup!), but I think the price-point is a little steep for this type of service. Almost $50 for 4 at breakfast? I dunno. Seemed a little ridiculous.  {Side note: What irked the HELL out of me was watching people bark at the food runners to go back in multiple times for silverware, napkins, etc. GET IT YOURSELF. IT'S RIGHT IN FRONT OF YOUR FACE WHILE YOU FILL YOUR SODA. THESE PEOPLE ARE CLEARLY BUSY. YOU ARE LAZY.}  My omelet had a really tasty combo of roasted veggies, and I loved the way the zingy sun dried tomatoes played off the fresh mozzarella. The roasted rosemary potatoes were tasty enough, although Wildflower's are better in my opinion. Toast was toast. Get your choice of jellies when you go pick up your own silverware and napkins, because you are not a dick and can do it yourself.  The place was slammed by the time we left, but all the staff was still as smiley as can be. I just can't get past that price point though. If we were back in the area and hungry, I'd certainly try it again...just with someone else footing the bill.

aEdahxKdx8jRi784mmniiA.text: The service and setup for this place was awesome.... Which was why I was terribly disappointed when the food came to the table. I ordered the heuvos rancheros and it was so incredibly bland. My eggs were dry and overcooked, my husband's sausage was rubber, and the coffee was literally the worst I've ever had. Not worth the price.

O0l3JodHeeFLl9C-cdAumw.text: Tad-bit pricey, but a great selection and location nonetheless. Definitely a go-to-when-craving breakfast joint living in the area.

_ihpnV5MqpQ6h5lPzbBCpA.text: We had the vegan soyrizo burrito and multigrain pancakes for a Saturday brunch. Both were okay, not bad and definitely good as healthy dining out options. I liked the pancakes a little bit better. Just the right amount of food for 2!  By the way, there were some vegan options on the menu online and the take out menus but not on the boards posted inside the place.   Normally I would give 4 stars for a place with food this healthy and also good, but I was not wowed by the overall experience. First and foremost, it took forever for anything to come out - can't remember exactly how long but I remember thinking it was way too long for 2 simple plates. Even the coffee took forever to come out! The other thing is that it felt like I was sitting in a chain restaurant, which wasn't bad, but nothing special and probably contributed to the wait dragging on so long - nothing interesting about being there.   Overall I would recommend to folks looking for a healthy breakfast, but would not necessarily choose this over other great brunch options if you are visiting and trying to hit the best places in PHX.

s5uKcwx8oycDb0RgyMmklQ.text: I came here for breakfast and have been wanting to come here for a while.  Its a bit of a drive for me, but I finally decided it was time to go.  Overall, I had a good experience and enjoyed my time here.  Its a fast casual type resturant, where you walk in, place your order at the counter, and they walk the food out to you.  They seem to have a nice selection of food, mostly breakfast with some lunch items.    I went for breakfast, and wanted to keep it simple.  I ordered two eggs over medium, with toast and potatos.  I found the toast to be a bit dry, and a bit to dark for me.  Usually I like my toast a little lighter with butter on it, but that was not the case.  Also, I found the potatoes to be a bit bland and boring.  I will probably be back, but was not blown away by this place.  I rated it high becuase I think overall its a good place, and the food isnt that half bad.

lVXt9zPJv_F1PDQti1YOQA.text: Get the southwest burrito with Soyrizo. You won't be sorry! Adorable decor, lots of TVs, vegan options, and doggies on the patio. Love it!

2RyP-F_mxHMQVGlD7FDP8Q.text: So one day my wife and I went on over to our local breakfast shop Scramble. The place is a great addition to our area and their menu is both breakfasty and Arizonaee, which we like.   When I got in there my Italian stallion kicked into gear and I ordered the brizza with ham and cheese. Heck yeah! Sounds so good. A pizza, a breakfast, hams, eggs, and cheese pizza I can has. I got this thing and was like, "Ah, no's. Don't like." Basically it comes down to this. The pizza crust was too bready. It dried my mouth out and I couldn't taste nothing for days mang. I mean it is filling and somewhat tasty but I think it's really not the best idea ever.   Honestly this place is awesome though, I'm just not recommending the Brizza. We eat there all the time.

W_tqhOkSIBEkMuk7LAd_Dg.text: I drove past this place a few times when heading up to North Mountain and Lookout Mountain to go for a hike. My bf and I love to go out to breakfast so I put this on the short list to go to.   Today was the day. We headed up 7th and jumped on line. It was very crowded but things moved fast there and the staff was super friendly.   I couldn't decide between 2 eggs anyway or the pancakes, come to find out I could get my 2 eggs and sub my toast for the choc chip dollar pancakes. Score. My bf got the meat lovers' scramble with toast. We grabbed a table and they delivered the food fairly quickly. It got a bit tight in the seating area and people were taking chairs and grabbing them for themselves, leaving other tables without. A little frantic but the food was good. AND they had the Women's World Cup on. Bonus!  A great neighborhood place. Maybe I'll check out the sports bar and burger place in that plaza as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. meat lovers scramble with wheat toast
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2 eggs scrambled, potatoe, such choc chip dollar pancakse for toast

-5j8j_gZZ2uWQgvWEWwjqQ.text: Really good food. I had a nice fluffy meat lovers scramble. And my husband had a tender new york strip cooked to perfection. And the house coffee is really good too.

FLt8FqL-vSHSEzIt_6N7yA.text: Found this place thanks to yelp and it was solid. We had the brizza and it was pretty tasty. We liked that they were very accommodating for gluten free eating as the offer gluten free breads and crusts for the brizza.   Overall the place is very clean and welcoming. Food was solid but nothing extraordinary. Would go back if I was in the area again.

kNOxRZyY2Bi3utS_M4S4Kw.text: Used to live three blocks away.  Went here twice.  Both times, very dissapointed.  I mean, the food is mediocre at best.  And it's WAY overpriced.  If I'm going to pay this price, I expect good food... maybe even great food.  If this place had been better I probably would have gone here weekly.  But the fact that it was one of the few decent Sunnyslope options, and I went here twice in 5 years, says something.  I don't know what it is, but everything in this little subdivision is run by related family members, as far as I know.  And interestingly enough, despite them being genuinely nice people, it's all of mediocre quality and over priced items.  Look elsewhere.

_RsrlP1xbDmMfzB2lm1_PA.text: Scramble is great! I highly recommend doing an early morning hike at North Mountain, then heading straight there for breakfast. If you don't make it there before nine or so on weekends, the line will be pretty long, but don't worry, it moves fast. Once you get inside, the decor is simple and modern, with a bright, clean, open space and plenty of seating. There's also a nice patio when the weather is good. This is an order at the counter, get your own drinks, and seat yourself style place. Pretty awesome concept for a breakfast place, in my opinion. You can help yourself to your own coffee (they have a few different roasts and a variety of creamers) and hot sauce (great variety, though, sadly, lacking Sriracha).   Everything on the menu looks so tasty that it's pretty tough to decide what to try, and so far everything I've ordered has been really good. My favorites are the veggie scramble (sun dried tomatoes, squash, peppers, & cheese with a side of rosemary potatoes and toast - really delicious toast) and any of their brizzas (breakfast pizza - fresh dough, scrambled egg, and toppings like sausage, chorizo, Gouda, &c). Just go ahead and try anything, I really don't think you can go wrong.

OB1DltA8EZt6V5Q2S--Scw.text: Very good! Set up like Sauce. I got the spinach and mushroom scramble and my husband got a burrito. Both were delicious! Eggs were light and creamy and hash browns were cooked perfectly! Loved all the vegetarian and vegan options. We will be back!

YgSQzj6NrPG-dbhbNBeKSg.text: Walked in and the atmosphere was great!!! The cashier  was very nice and welcoming. I ordered a dirty chai latte with an Alma BRIZZA!!! They give you a number, you sit down wait a few minutes and my  food was ready!!! My Chai Latte was so creamy and pure amazing!!! The Alma BRIZZA was Ginormous to my standards. It was a good sized portion. Garlic spinach, mushrooms and Monterey jack cheese BRIZZA! It was  beyond my expectation for sure. DEFINITELY COMING BACK ;)

1P8jYDymeicqLlZZ6Lah_A.text: Quality food is the thing that stands out the most to me for this place. They do a great job of emphasizing flavor and/or spice in their food and that it is food that doesn't just fill and exhaust the eater, but rather energizes and refreshes.  Some things I love about this place: 1) The quality of their food as I just said. My favorite is their breakfast burritos. 2) The gourmet coffee station where you can get as many refills as you want when you want. 3) The way they streamline the ordering and seating process, which is usually a drudgery at other places. Here you order at the counter, choose your own seat and a waitress will bring you your food and check in with you at least a couple times to make sure there are no issues and that's it. 4) I like their use of windows letting in the natural sun light into the place. It makes for a pleasant and natural dining experience. 5-ish) I like that I can watch whatever game is on there, but as much as I like sports, they seem to have too many TV's. I mean they don't have to be everywhere and sometimes I want to get away from the tv and be in real life.   The reason I don't give Scrambles 5 stars is the bill ends up being a little spendier than I like. I don't think it's overpriced, but it still doesn't change the bottom line when it comes to my budget. Other than that it's great!

mMKWs76WvmiQBg0fcn55ig.text: I love restaurants like this. Sort of like a Chipotle with a little less fast-food esthetic. The decor is modern and clean, the service is efficient, nearly everything is help yourself.   Wife and I split the veggie omelette with toast, they actually served us separate plates, an excellent touch. Son had a grilled cheese which was delicious. The meal was quick and we were in an out in no time.

t4bd5pqsuQSCHPCHorepRA.text: I can remember when this place had just barely opened.  No one knew what and who they were and coupons were provided in the local ads for their breakfast.  That QUICKLY changed, but I know understand why.  This used to be a quick hop and jump away from my old apartments.  My fiance and I visited nearly every weekend and sampled a variety of items on the menu.  Each time we went back, it kept getting busier and busier.  So, to beat the crowds, be sure to arrive early (i.e. before church gets out or the morning hikers are done).  When it comes to breakfast, I am pretty basic.  I don't need anything fancy to satisfy my taste, although I am partial to greasy flavored food.  Our last visit went smoothly and quickly.  I ordered the 2 egg special with bacon and rosemary potatoes and an ice tea to drink.  My fiance ordered the chorizzo (sp?) burrito which also came with the rosemary potatoes and an ice tea to drink.    ALL THINGS ICE TEA:  I am a huge fan of ice tea.  I don't like the crap out of the pump, nor do I like any sugar in it.  They serve FRESH ice tea in multiple flavorings to soothe your palette and quench your thirst.    FOOD:  I love their bacon!  It never comes out under or over cooked and always has this deliciously wholesome taste to it.  I also am not a big fan of eggs, so when I do order them, scrambled is the way to go.  The last serving I got were moist, fluffy, and not over/under cooked.  Perfectly whipped to perfection!  The potatoes had the right amount of crispiness and flavoring added.  What a delicacy for my breakfast palette.  The only down side to Scramble is how far they are located to my new place.  However, anytime I am in the neighborhood I make it a point to stop in for breakfast.

bDqCFZ3G8rTBuZz_wiityw.text: This place is BUSY!!  Every time I drive by, there are a TON of people in there.  When you go in you stand in line like at Sauce and order at the counter and get a number for your table.  My high hopes for this place started to go away when it started to feel like a chain restaurant with the same boring food pumped out to the masses...   Happily I can say I was wrong.  They use fresh ingredients by local AZ businesses!  I'm happy to support local business and will be coming back here again!   Costa Breakfast Burrito: Spicy chorizo, bacon, cheese, & scrambled hash brown.  ... WOW!  The flavors are incredible!!  This was easily one of the best breakfast burritos I have ever had!

LB1D-Zuha4i0pMt4syU91A.text: Cute, trendy place with pretty decent breakfast.  I got the Traditional Eggs Benedict, and my friend had one of the pizzas.  Both were pretty good.  My eggs weren't cooked enough, and the English muffins were a bit burnt.  The Hollandaise was decent, though.    Orange juice was $3.  A little steep considering there aren't free refills.  Probably would've given it 2 stars, but the burnt English muffin/undercooked egg could've been a fluke and the service was really good.

1pDQyKiwjnk5B-V9L6LOcg.text: I went to the Scramble in Scottsdale and everything was great. Good . Staff and. Cleanliness. Couldn't wait to return with my wife. I really talked it up.
