Heard about the Scramble in Sunnyslope on 7th street so it was convenient and we went there. Monday morning around 10:30. Everything was the polar opposite, her eggs were over well done yokes dried and burned. She ordered medium. Hasbrowns were similar way over cooked. Butter was in wrapper on food. Who knows were they were before. Toast was bread not toasted . Bacon was clumped together and also over cooked. Staff was not friendly and the water was terrible. Coffee was fine. Place seemed dirty. Tables with stuff left newspapers left and it smelled like someone was smoking. I was embarrassed to have recommended the Place. I went back to Scottsdale out of curiosity and it was good. So don't judge your Scramble just find the location with the right management and chef.in place first and go back there only. I will try Sunnyslope again but it will be a long wait..

9WDFTdcLaCvXn-WTn-2Lbw.text: Love, love, love that they have a new vegan menu!  Scramble has all the options down pat, they've even got 4 vegan breakfast entrees, some great loose leaf teas, fresh made OJ, soy milk, various flavors of hot sauces and more. Their outdoor patio is rad. They're pet and kid friendly. I also highly appreciate the fact that they use separate cookware and plates for their vegan dishes.  My biggest problem with Scramble is their consistency. The food just doesn't come out the same way every time.  My first visit to try the tofu/soyrizo burrito resulted in a burrito that was extra oily and sweet potato hash that was blackened (burnt) and extra oily.  My next visit (today) resulted in a burrito with tofu that wasn't cooked/seasoned as well as the last time (big chunks of white tofu). The sweet potato hash was good this time.  I'd also like to see a bit more soyrizo added to the burritos.  The miniature cup of salsa provided with these dishes should also be increased in size, as it's easy to run through in a few bites.  I still really dig the place, I just hope that they get their cooking/prep down so that the dishes turn out more consistent and better.  I'd also like to see a vegan Brizza (breakfast pizza) added to the menu (with tofu instead of egg).

I9v0o6Vu0NpMAb67PUR_gQ.text: Love this place. The new Scottsdale location has awesome bloody marys and is closer to my house!

EZ9m2_ZD4xjW75-k4DX5iA.text: Probably the best breakfast I've had in quite some time. We ordered the southwest burrito and sunrise sandwich. Absolutely delicious. If you like avocado and chorizo you will love the burrito. I was very impressed with the service. Always nice to be greeted with a smile. I will be back when visiting.

-KPW7wTgF9_QjyMGSRj49Q.text: Top notch restaurant for breakfast options.  Please not that I tend to be biased against places famous for breakfast.  I can't give you a good reason why, though.  It's just how I am.  The food at Scramble, however, is worth mentioning.  I read about Scramble in Phoenix Magazine.  Turns out I have driven past it many times and never knew it existed.  Very happy to have picked up that issue (I don't read it on a regular basis).    Their Santa Fe style Eggs Benedic was great.  It's served with ham on jalapeno  corn bread and covered with a chipotle hollandaise sauce.  Rosemary potatoes are served on the side.  It wasn't as spicy as I hoped it would be but it was delicious.    The Costa burrito is also worth a mention as is the salsa it was served with.  One minor beef I have with Scramble is overpriced beverages.  It's a sacrifice I am willing to make.  When the food is quality I won't hold above average drink prices against Scramble.  Give Scramble a shot.  You'll be back.

sAmw1GQWKWFrFbvyJ494Zg.text: This place is hands down the best breakfast place in my neighborhood. Been going in for a while now and the omelettes and biscuits and gravy are awesome however I find myself with more frequency thinking of their southwest burrito served with potatoes when I'm thinking breakfast. The one thing I've found disappointing until this point were the potatoes served with the southwest burrito I usually get. Today however I was pleasantly surprised by a delicious cheesy potato hash cake. I've noticed that they often change up the potatoes but please keep this greasy masterpiece around it's definitely a winner and reminds me of breakfast in the morning with my family back home.

d3oqIA86_XBVHDLHtHDyzA.text: I don't do breakfast out very often, mainly because I don't think anybody does it as good as I can do it at home! That said, sometimes I just don't feel like whipping out the griddle so we do find ourselves going for breakfast at times. Most of the time we stick to Waffle House or Bill Johnson's because, well... we LIKE them and we don't have to sit in line for four hours like you do over at Matt's Big Breakfast (what the heck is that about anyway, can eggs be this good? I'll never find out, I can't stand lines - especially at breakfast).  Last time we were at Il Posto we saw this place right next door and although it looks more like an IKEA store than a breakfast joint, we said we'd make a point of visiting it next time we were jonesing for breakfast, and we did.   I really wanted to hate this place because it looks so trendy but darn it if it wasn't perfectly delicious. I can't even complain about their coffee because it was dark and rich, just like I like it. Service was quick and friendly. If I had one complaint about the place, it would be that the second you walk in the door, if you're unfamiliar with their menu you're UNDER PRESSURE TO DECIDE immediately because the knobs in line behind you already know what they want so GO GO GO... but that's a fairly minor issue. I had the veggie omelette and the wife had the French toast. We both agreed that it was delicious and we'll definitely be back!

U9DnN_HXo9FdF4KGUdGKRg.text: Our go to weekend breakfast joint. Love it!! Locally sourced and yummy. Great staff and awesome outside dog friendly patio too but where are my favorite rosemary potatoes? ? Please, please bring them back. :-)

pltbfgQVHJBi7-2L7HSHJw.text: Horrible service. When my food arrived one of the items (a scramble brown) was ice cold, like it had not been heated up. I took my plate to one of the managers and he said he would bring a new plate out. Ten minutes later he brings me the same plate of eggs and toast and says the scramble brown will be right out. Another ten minutes goes by and nothing. In the mean time my husband completely finished his breakfast. So, I mention to the server clearing my husbands plate that my food has never arrived.  I see him go check with the manager and the manager grabs one that had obviously been sitting on the counter and brings it to me, TWENTY minutes after I requested a replacement for the cold one!  At this point I said that I'd just like my money back. He asks for the receipt, which has already been taken away by the server - so he says how about a free entree for next time, no there won't be a next time!  I mean really, is it too much to ask that I receive all the food that I paid for at the same time??  Go somewhere else if you want a good breakfast.

fhjyHDbeUUBm47qpKRD7QQ.text: I try to like this place real bad since it is in my neighbourhood and its te only breakfast offering nearby. The food is just generic and they dont use real eggs. It tastes like eggs in boxes. Not sure what the name is but I have bought it in the store and tried it.  it is a fun no pretentious place and the staff treats you well. I hope the menu gets more creative.

iBXf-wLc-YvixL9ZuXDyDA.text: The breakfast we had there yesterday was marginal, at best. The omelet and hash browns were tasteless and the food was overpriced. We will not go there again and will also advise our friends to not go there either.

CSTfVy7EByqJx0O3OL9--A.text: I take back my first review of Scramble. Last time I went with my Aunt, Mother, and Grandmother and had shared with them (and after my Grandma opened the topic to the bus-gal), that I was annoyed they used so much Styrofoam and other wasteful products. I believe last time the only way to not use non-recyclable dishware and utensils was to bring your own. This time, they still had disposable drink cups but I was very happy to see they were now a light plastic. I was soooo happy!  I got an egg sandwich, minus the ham and on a enflish muffin rather than sourdough bread. It was fantastic! Like a dream in my mouth. Cooked to perfection! I could've easily shared this with another diner, which was my first thought, but after one bite I just couldn't stop. Loved it.  My only one criticism is the employee who greeted us and took our order wasn't very warm or welcoming. She cut me off like 3 times and repeated things in a very annoyed tone. Hey, it's not my fault you are hung over and work at a breakfast place.  Overall, I'm glad I gave it a second chance.

63m_mpfLTvkK9dR7hf6rqw.text: With all the choices in the are for breakfast I would have to say that this is one of the worst. I will explain why. First. Do not ask for your tip before you serve me. I don't like not having to order in a rush. Why order in line. Give me a damn menu and sit me down. The food was poor at best. The kids French French toast was the best thing our family was served. My panini was a joke. My wife's vegan burrito was so overly seasoned t was almost inedible. I highly recommend looking for somewhere else before you waste your money. If you are worried about hygiene a comparison would be an ihop with worse food.

ZfEwuPct9M7tvSmljSjEiw.text: Really outstanding vegan French toast. Vegan chorizo tofu scram wrap. Coffee w/ soymilk.  5 options for hot sauce and maybe 3 more tofu scrambles I haven't even tried yet.  This is serious brunch business, phoenix area vegans.    Now I won't be able to blame my grumpiness on lack of breakfast that's not oatmeal when I'm home visiting my family... Dang. This place is life changing.

wkF5lVpLIXmTXwdiBQ2upA.text: I was visiting some friends in the Phoenix area and I thought I had saw this place on Diner's Drive In's and Dive's, but i could've been wrong.  Anyways, we went here for breakfast.  Food was prepared excellent.  Coffee was outstanding.  Move through the line fairly well.  Cinnamon Rolls were gigantic and had like an inch of frosting on them.  I took one bite and knew that if I had anymore I would've gone into sugar coma.  It was FANTASTIC.  No waiter service is my only downside.

m4lkv5ksqtdXvlIVIftH_A.text: Breakfast food an I have become good friends since I realized I was lactose intollerant. For some reason I have been eating a lot more eggs since cutting out dairy. So, a friend and I took a drive down from the resort we were staying at. We found scramble at the recommendation of some friends. I'm glad we went.  Nothing beats a fresh, hot, delicious egg scrambled full of veggies and bacon. This accented with small wheat pancakes and crispy potatoes is a sure hit. The breakfast blend coffee was great. My friend is allergic to dairy, wheat and doesn't eat meat. She was able to come out of there with quite a spread. This was truly a morning miracle.  I have to say that scramble has increased the quality of my friendship with breakfast. It was one of the best breakfast places I have visited. And they utilize local, fresh ingredients which only adds to the experience. If you go and you have a dog, they can come along too. Another added bonus. They do close at 2pm though.

PdxcGbtxAAYlulP8OgJNoQ.text: If I could give scramble an extra 2 stars, I would. The service is incredible. I work at a restaurant and always give my customers my all. Whenever going to a restaurant, I look for the same thing in return and can always find this here. When you first walk in, you are greeted from the cashier, this morning being Destiny who was so upbeat and knows how to carry a positive conversation. After a little mix up with our food (being brought it in a to-go and then the wrong food) the manager, Lorraine comped the whole entire thing after introducing herself and checking up on the meal... WHICH WAS SCRAM-DILUMCIOUS:D Wonderful way to start the day. My girlfriend and I will be returning soon, thank you for reading:)

73aVdRizeWqkFwjqmvSJBg.text: It's east to see what it's trying to be, but it misses.   First, the design. It's very hip, with its brushed steel and clean lines, counter around the periphery with power outlets and free WiFi. The easy menu is presented mounted in large sheets of glass. The staff are cool and friendly and accommodating.   It took a long time to choose our breakfast because there were so many intriguing options on the menu. The food we got tasted pretty good, but there wasn't any excuse for so much of it being cold (mid-morning, not crowded). The signature rosemary potatoes? An English muffin? Really? The omelet was stellar and the biscuits and gravy were yummy (though extra salty). The fried eggs were overcooked, despite the VERY detailed explanatory poster (explaining the spectrum of subtlety in egg doneness) that hangs next to the ordering station. I knew what I wanted, ordered same, and got a couple of degrees more done than that. (If you're going to make a big deal about the finesse of your egg frying technique, you'd better deliver every time.)  They had made too many parfaits that morning and comped us one, which was tasty--but would have been better with fresh fruit instead of compote.  They automatically lose a star for having conversation-hostile televisions (though my bride wants it noted that they were all on different channels, so one could choose one's interest and find something to watch). Another half star gone because if the ambient music. Techno on a Thursday morning?  We may go back, but we're only here for a week and there are other options available.

OxBESvbJbLBU3WINw-HROw.text: Went here on Sunday morning had read great reviews about the place and the food it was a must try. Well we tried and didn't like. First off just walking in was a disappointment cause you can't sit down and check out the menu thoroughly you order right as you walk in. My husband is handicapped and has a hard time standing for any period of time. So of course he ordered the first thing he spotted he might like steak and eggs, eggs over easy steak med rare. I order eggs Benny and our grandson ordered kids pancakes. Have to get your own utensils napkins condiments and your drinks. Then sit down finally.They bring your food out.      Well steak well done hash browns over cooked which my husband likes that way, but mine were over done too they were crunchy. My eggs were perfect but everything else was over done ham and English muffins were burnt around the edges. Anyway manager got wind of husband's over cooked steak and gave us a card for a free entree when we return. Not returning so have a free entree for anybody who wants it. Even our grandson (who is 10)didn't eat but a couple of bites of his pancakes but he loved the bacon.   So here's a couple of stars for good bacon and eggs cooked perfectly.

iEkeMajr4nCkbVVUeNT4cA.text: So we took a gamble when selecting Scramble so please forgive my Scramble ramble. Ugh. So much potential. Friendly staff. But so so food and though friendly, an untrained staff. Upon entering I like the open and airy room. I like the railing along the east wall with great views of the mountains. But. Wait. What are all these people standing in line for? The host I'm sure. WTF? It's an order at the counter sit down with a number on your table kinda place. Ugh again. Not my thing. Like camping. Or hiking. Or that second Narnia movie.   I'm with two people and they are ordering up their grub. Scanning the menu. Asking some questions. At one point my friend was ordering a blended coffee drink. The shelves behind the cashier were loaded with frape type powders. I couldn't believe I heard her say "Oh. Yeah. I don't know how to make those!" LMAO. I had grabbed some bottled Vitamin water so I was in the clear on potentially prepared beverage fiasco.   When we sat the food arrived in a timely manner. Pancakes and sausage for me. Same for my friend. My other friend had the breakfast burrito and a cinnamon roll. My side of eggs came out quickly afterward.   I'm starving so I'm diving in to the fluffy (actually doughy) pancakes. I prefer a thinner flapjack with some slightly crispy edges. Sausages. Much like Phyllis Dillers's hoo haa..well...sadly they were dry. And I purposely ordered pork sausage cuz I wasn't in the mood for turkey.   Now. I'm noticing my friend TRYING to cut up his pancakes. I cut as I go. But he likes to get everything all chopped up apparently. Now he's a big guy. It was hysterical seeing him trying to cut through those DOUGHY pancakes. He gave up midway. Needless to say neither one of us finished our cakes.   Lastly he realized as he scanned his check that his omelette he ordered didn't come out because it wasn't even listed on the bill.   So Scramble. You got potential kid. I felt the heart in the room. Just didn't get much from the brain.

J7UYH2Bn_ppgwiz7TvmNbg.text: I do not for the life of me get the hype for this place other than its clean an modern in appearance. It's not like most breakfast restaurants where a waitress come to your table then returns when you need more coffee. This is a order at the register have food brought out to you and self serve coffe station. Not that this is bad just different than traditional. My problem was with the food itself. After driving by this place numerous times and deciding not to stand in line we finally were there early enough to get right in to see what all this excitement is about. I ordered the Califonia omelet. It came out in a reasonable amount of time but the omelet had two spinach leaves and 5 tiny specks of meat with very little cheese. There was a nice avacodo garnish but I was basically eating eggs which I'm not a particular fan of without the meat and veggies. I mixed the hash browns in to offer more flavor which was more than I bargained for because all hash browns are smothered in pepper. It's possible based on other reviews that I just got a bad plate but honestly I have no intention of hitting this place up again when there are MUCH better breakfast joints all over that aren't maybe quite as stylish but I'll get what my stomach desires. 2 miles North is Moon Valley cafe which is low on ambience but extremely high on food quality and price. I'll gladly drive the extra miles.

A2rtJoVBlSM07fb8YEYhLA.text: I would have given this place 5 stars because flat out, the food is amazing BUT I took one star off because the dining area was very messy. There were dirty dishes all over. I was with a group and there were no cleared tables for 4 so we had to ask to have a table cleared for us. They did get one cleared fairly quickly though. They seemed understaffed on the whole, I think I counted 4 people working in the whole restaurant. Just didn't make the best first impression but hopefully this was a fluke. I will try this place again for sure because again the food was excellent.

qqxWV1l7K9zur6t9dJOF4w.text: Delicious food, awesome atmosphere and our server, Stacy, was the best!  I had lots of family and friends who gathered here the morning after my son's wedding - it was the perfect place to enjoy each other's company with a great breakfast.

eRqUnikiE8jcgPzyIqrWzg.text: Had a business breakfast meeting on the patio this morning and I enjoyed the atmosphere, the food and the service.  I ordered the Brizza (breakfast pizza) which was fun, tastily prepared and well presented.  I liked their menu selection, upbeat (yet relaxed) atmosphere, free WIFi (a must for meetings these days) and the self-serve free re-fills on bevies.  Our meeting was running a bit long so I went back in and got a choc chip cookie after my zesty, savory chorizo Brizza.  It was just OK.  Nothing to write to Mrs. Tollhouse about, but not bad and fresh-baked today so it didn't taste like Saran wrap.    The young woman at the counter was super helpful and helped me carry drinks outside for our table and bussed our table expeditiously as we were having a meeting which I appreciated. Everyone was super nice and it just had a great, chill, mellow, happy breakfasty vibe.    I'd like to take friends there sometime if they ever come out to AZ to visit.  Considering our current state politics, that's pretty unlikely in the near future, so I suppose it's up to us locals to keep supporting awesome little AZ finds like Scramble.

VaJXh7NXgUKKvg3_wwAwtw.text: This was really good! Love the sweet potato hast with the steak and eggs. Really friendly staff!

alMiAiEUNiKERhafBLz5rg.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast eaterys in the valley. they know my order by heart and the staff is so nice! its clean bright and very modern inside. great music everyday and cartoons sports and news on all the tv's ...a little bit for everyone! i wish it was a tad closer to my house for when schools in its harder for me to get there. they need to open more locations!! great place definitly in my top five for breakfasts in the counrty

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best place for food

brsqGMRLboD4mKYzBFnKeg.text: Great, fresh food and excellent service. They never disappoint. A perfect place to be a "regular". They always remember what we like to eat and serve with a smile.

sYFnT8H2AM5zvLXm1WzvRQ.text: I have to say...why would you take a signature item your known for off the menu completely? Their menu dies still advertise them but the cashier told me they no longer have the rosemary potatoes. I am very disappointed they no longer serve the rosemary potatoes.....they now serve horribly crispy hash browns. This makes this place no more special than Denny's.  I gave them 2 stars cause they do have big screen TV's and nice temorate A/C.....otherwise I would have given 1 star.

28ueRnB7KWvVxZL5FRhrig.text: So good!!! I had the Santa Fe Benedict. It was different, yet amazing. The first place I've seen the cholula chili garlic. Outstanding. Can't wait to go back

_b7t6FBraxlmttYSCE1WpQ.text: I am not much of a breakfast person, but I will say that I love this place and the food! The staff is very friendly, the place is always clean, the Southwest burrito is to die for and the fresh brewed tea is delicious!  My family and I have made this our Sunday family tradition(just try to be there before 8 if you don't want the line to be out the door!) but totally worth waiting for if there is a line;)

R5EW85UGf1EepkJpAmjUmg.text: Glad there was no wait. Food is similar to a cafeteria style breakfast. Really not sure where the great reviews come from. Not really cheap either.

tul88jAkuoN6dpK3bycINQ.text: Love this breakfast place! Some of the best breakfast items! You order at the counter and sit wherever available. They definitely need to expand their space and open another location. It's nice they that they cater to vegan and gluten free. Food is excellent -- try anything on the menu and you won't be disappointed.

TLROIbwhlRO7RVJOkVB5IQ.text: I love the food here, but I am completely baffled when I arrive and there is a line out the door, about 20 empty tables and one lone cashier taking orders.  Are they trying to space orders out?  If so, they need to work with kitchen on timing!  Irritating.

s_70y5OhY2nHLdys5sbArA.text: Their vegan burrito & sweet potato hash mmm soooo good!! :)  Love walking the dogs and stopping off there (for a Chi Tea) sitting outside on the patio ;) ...very clean & very friendly! Recommend giving it a try ;) !!

gMNOU-hLm04Jk9TLp6nc_A.text: I just wanted to say I had the most amazing service today. My Eggs Benedict was made to perfection and I had the best server Stacy Rupp. I will definitely recommend this restaurant and will enjoy going again.

poZLNQ2P7YHgKklGjOJGqQ.text: Walked in and there was a wee bit of a line. Moved quickly, no biggie, no drama (3 yr old boy's boy and 7 mo. little princess) Ordered  the breakfast pizza, a burrito and some oj-the super cheap husband balked at the price of the oj. The husband was turned around when he tasted the oj-fresh, so fresh. A little more hyped than i thought it deserved, but overall good stuff.

vw8Qs788rkaVrrGHKM7pqQ.text: Very cute, order before seating yourself breakfast joint. Must start off by saying their coffee is amazing- full refill station right smack in the center of the restaurant too! As for the food.. I haven't tried everything on the menu but based on what I've tried and by the looks of what others ordered around me...I can bet the menu is nothing short of amazing!   Came here after a hike and it was the best way to gain back all the calories lost! wahoo

2Zi0t4wbTXxMxrk1KqfQSQ.text: Their breakfast is fantastic!! Very delicious assortment of sweet and savory breakfast choices.  My only hang up is their coffee.  I usually love drinking black coffee, but at Scramble, I just can't drink it.  The sweet drinks are good though if you want something sugary.  Overall, I know I will be back a lot!

3RnVszHJayTvGtLSc1hozQ.text: This place is definitely one to check out. It may be a little expensive but the healthy food that they provide is worth it. I ordered their apple cinnamon pancakes with bacon and this chocolate shake. It all filled me up pretty quickly and was fantastic. They do use wheat on their pancakes which is something I wasn't expecting but still was pretty good. Staff are very friendly and are quick at the service. The place looks very clean and well established.

qlW6H1CgRCmKwKjrj9GuAg.text: Simple bright decor, line up to pay first, sit down and they deliver to your table.   great coffee, had the western omlette w/ eng muffin, crispy hash browns, great strawberry French toast, stuffed w/ straw crm cheese, side of crispy bacon, good brizza brkfst pizza of saus, hash brn, jack and cheddar almost like an open face burrito, and the prime rib panini, great mushrooms, carmelized onions, understated horseradish crm chs, a lil lite on the meat but good flavors throughout.

6uybdkyc148oGMUtmxyZZA.text: Beautiful dog friendly patio with great views! Good food, good variety, just a great place to gather and relax.

tkGudu9DWCQKpXB2q1-hjA.text: The food was average breakfast. We had an omelet and pancakes. The pancakes were very dense.  Too high priced for the portions.

ffOFyZA6QUX1fDvvmXLW8g.text: I've been here twice with my mother and stepfather. If you're looking for an excellent place to find a nice, cheap, and tasty meal, this is it. Kudos for the veg/vegan fare too. Phoenix isn't well-known for catering to non-meat eaters but the vegan breakfast scramble and vegan French toast are grrrrrrrrrreat. The coffee is good in that not quite Stumptown or Blue Bottle level but waaaaaay better than Starbucks or Tully's.  Extra super-dooper points for the patio that is both smoke-free and dog-friendly.

y5n98MgvHKdksd7Hqzz_uw.text: Had breakfast with a friend this week.  Fast, courteous, and good quality food.  What more could you ask for?

JClK8xVhVHgmJV0SonKcgg.text: Loved everything about this place. Service was quick and very friendly, the food was TO DIE FOR, prices were very fair, and the ambiance was fun! It's set up cafeteria-style, but that doesn't bother me at all! Order food, get your number, wait for food. Simple, easy, no big deal. It wasn't incredible busy when we got there just before noon, but was "line out the door" as we left. However, There were plenty of open tables around the joint.  I ordered the chicken bacon panini and with every bite, it got better and better! The bread was toasty but soft on the inside, the chicken had great seasoning, the boursin and jack cheese combo was out of this world, and bacon is ..well, bacon.   The hubs ordered the biscuits and gravy, and he practically licked his plate clean.   We will be returning as soon as possible! LOVED it!

VWF8V66JmyiKlhkS-rkyag.text: Long line. Must be good, and worth the wait. Great news: the line is fast... and it's so worth it! I had to have a Scramble, but the French Toast looked so yummy - so we got an extra plate to share and it was amazing! Everything was good, including the service, and their Strawberry French Toast has fresh homemade strawberry cream cheese served with fresh strawberry slices that is incredible to bite into.

mKHSmcwYGeq_rqvgL0mHpA.text: I finally went to scramble, it was quite the scramble this morning for the staff since they were down a grill.  I had to explain to people in the line that he gal said "down a grill" not "a girl" as they were saying, can't they call a back up girl in??  HAHA- kinda funny.  Anyhow, down a grill must have sucked for them and for all of us in line that went out the door, but it did move quickly, the line moved quicker than the food arrived, but they did tell us while we waited in line, that it would be at least 25 minutes for food.  I was with a good friend who I wanted to catch up with so we didn't care and it didn't seems like it made anyone get out of line and leave either.   We ordered, it's basically everything any breakfast place would have.  They have the drink station in the middle, get you liquids and condiments yourself.  I'm cool with that, I kinda liked it b/c I would rather just grab what I want rather than have to keep asking.  Ketchup, hot sauce, more napkins, drink refills whatever- do get it yourself is fine with me.   My friend had the meat lovers omelet, she was into it.  It was a lot of food.  I had the gringo burrito and a cinnamon roll.  I was a bit disappointed with the cinnamon roll. since the reviews made it sound like it was so great.  Mine was dry, I only ate a quarter of it.  Brought the rest home.  I'm staring at it and considering just throwing the darn thing away.  Why waste all those calories?   We hung out for way longer than normal people do since we were catching up and they were cool with it so that was nice.  There was a nice variety of people there too.  Something about it made me like the place even more.  A table next to us was a family with teenage children, they held hands and said prayer before they ate, the table on the other side was a really hot same sex couple, behind were super fit people who must have just finished hiking b/c they looked like it and I bet they ordered egg white and fruit or oatmeal.  I like it, it had a good vibe.  The patio looked inviting too but hell, it's already too hot to go outside, so I have no interest in that area.

MuY8Cm9IKL8k1F4yDy30fw.text: Everything was great. The downside are the lines which are a really pretty long while not the restaurants fault it is something that you should keep in mind if you've never been here. All that been said I had a lovely time and the food was amazing and no one gave me funny looks when I got an extra egg to go on the side with my eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

egz2M4Go3Wz9UEkrPNlF2g.text: I absolutely love this place! such a wide variety to choose from. Love how close it is to the mountain. Staff is always friendly and polite! wonderful environment! can't go as much since I moved from the area but I still go whenever im in the area! I wish they could serve mimosas here. then it would be heaven!

BwXjTjRIJBpIhmymu1M2MA.text: There are many words which could describe this place. I will start with one: YUM.  The vegan french toast even fooled my meat loving counterpart.  The quick ordering process was seamless and cut down a considerable portion of the waiting game. The drinks are self-serve but not tacky either. The place is spotless, clean and offers your morning addictions from CNN to sports to 90s reruns. Throw in a latte, loyalty card and a smile and I'm sold.  I couldn't be happier and either could my tummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan French toast &amp; sweet potato hash

hIZ8Xn52zH0y4E_S7vERNw.text: Methinks Yelp outta have the ability to scramble 3 and 4 stars to yield 3 1/2.  Scramble has a lot going for it.  I like the idea that it's brought a bit of new life to the Sunnyslope area.  It's great when a business sees potential for growth in an area others may not.  It's also got a clean, mod decor and local sourced products.  More wins for us all!  Four stars!  When it comes to the food, I wasn't especially impressed.  I ordered the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict (eggs, Jalapeno corn bread, cured ham & chipotle hollandaise) and while it was good, the only flavor standout was the cured ham.  It came with a side of just-above-room-temperature rosemary potatoes and while I could SEE a few specks of rosemary, I couldn't TASTE any rosemary.  While delivering the The Gouda Brizza (Eggs, smoked Gouda & applewood bacon) carryout order I placed for a friend, the aroma wafting through the car made me wonder if I'd made the wrong choice from the menu.  As it turns out, maybe I didn't.  I'm told it was OK for flavor, but the crust looked and tasted like a glorified cracker and there was no discernible flavor of gouda.  The service was fine, but could use a little more pep, considering people are there to jump start their day.  Three stars.  I can't say I'm completely disappointed in Scramble, but it could step it up a small notch when it comes to flavor/texture and price.  Breakfast pizza hasn't really caught on in PHX the way it has on the east coast.  Back east an entire (full size) breakfast pizza can be purchased for little more than the personal size available at Scramble.  Then again, price is soon forgotten when quality is the star.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Gouda Brizza
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santa Fe Eggs Benedict

UAmkMUNjcIeEpSjrzD4_Og.text: Food here was excellent  very nicely prepared and tasted great and great service. Going to go back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santa Fe eggs Benedict

MawA4cGwi3gZ3FdBVSvxFg.text: Had a mid morning sat. breakfast at this place. Enjoyed the meat lovers scramble. I gotta say the food was great. If I had one suggestion it would be get the food to the table faster. Both our breakfast were almost cold. Felt like they may have been sitting around until it got to the table. Even though it was luke warm I had to give then 5 stars for how fresh taste, cleanliness. Worth a try. They only offer breakfast and early lunch.

aJRebZF5WjIVJArx8Y9C4w.text: My hubby and I have driven by this place for over a year! We finally moseyed our way on over to this spot. What took us so long? Oh my gosh! We should have come here earlier. This is a spot with modern decor, a simple menu, and fresh flavors. How can you not love a spot with quotes on the wall like this one?  "It may be the cock that crows, but it is the hen that lays the eggs." Margaret Thatcher  Heck yeah! They had a hen in the back droppin' some bomb eggs on our plates and they were oh so tasty.  For our first time visit we decided to try the Veggie Lovers Scramble. We loved the Veggie Lovers Scramble. The Veggie Lovers Scramble includes eggs scrambled with bell peppers, sun dried tomatos, and cheese. The eggs are served with rosemary potatoes and four slices of some freakin' tasty toast. Did I already say tasty? Sure did, and I'll say it again. This food was flippin' tastay!!!  While enjoyin' our tasty food, we found ourselves next to someone else who was also a first time visitor. He was throwin' down on some biscuits and gravy. He said that he hadn't had biscuits and gravy since the 70's, and he felt like he was right at home when he ate from his plate. Any food that transports you back to you childhood is alright with me. Remember that flashback moment that the critic had in Ratatouille? I think our new neighbor at Scramble was having a similar experience.  Portions were a nice size, and the staff was friendly. This is a nice brunch spot. We're more than likely eating brunch there tomorrow. Get there early if you are going on the weekend, this spot is usually packed.

U2rRo7UyOEL6s1RkSqFSSA.text: Found this place by accident on Yelp looking for a quick breakfast place & fell in Love! The staff was great & really nice (:  We sat on the patio , your have a great view of the mountains. Ordered the Strawberry French Toast & The Gouda , egg & Applewood Bacon Brizza ( I think it's called that ) . Wish I could go here everyday!

EzIvzcram_-UfWm_eyFwWQ.text: My new favorite breakfast joint. The line can get lengthy, but there is usually ample seating after you order at the counter.   Good coffee. Food is fantastic. Omelets, breakfast sandwiches and burritos all have been delicious. Hash browns come a little soggy. I ordered extra crispy and I couldn't get enough. I cant wait to try the breakfast pizza, BRIZZA (how clever!). I will absolutely be back.

TSZWWqwxBCpFGSm_YSmaWg.text: I gotta tell ya . . I wasn't a big fan of what I ordered "the jalepeno eggs benedict"  I iked the jalepeno corn bread. Around me was a couple in their 60's , a couple in their 40's and a young cute couple in their 20,s - I think we all had the same reaction when we saw a couple of the girls that work at The Scramble. C'Mon! it's breakfast! yet they have their bright orange t-shirts tied up from behind exposing their lower backs and one of them had  diamond strudded dimples on her lower back - I' mean its cute and she has a nice body - but ain't that just kinda inconsiderate for the couples? I mean, if my boyfriend was with me we'd be talking about it just like the yound couple was. They were actually kidding about it - calling it business casual uniform. Anywhoo - food? okay? service? eh ahiight. However if thats the way the manager dresses too - she better have a smokin body.  Hmm. I wonder if thats the way they dress to work at all the Scramble Restaurants.  good eats everyone

2p9cRu8FJl5OGR5x9OKq2g.text: Came here on a Sunday morning and the service was speedy enough to keep the line moving. Nice music and great feel to the place. The outside patio was a great place to eat, even with the sound of the traffic right up against 7th street. Food was outstanding with good portion sizes. I highly recommend the biscuits and gravy...incredibly fresh!  My family and I will definitely be back!

ur3Qk-4dMAPhxCl_TOIkxg.text: Friendly service, a nice change of pace. The veggie scramble was tasty, just wished there was more scramble and less carbs. They didn't upcharge for a few substitutions we made, which was awesome. Jalapeno cornbread was a nice change of pace, but didn't taste on bit of Jalapeno. Vegan burrito was nice size, and sweet potato hash was a fun and different offering.

yWG-SGc8ThGAoyJR3NfTUQ.text: Scramble is delish!  I've been there several times and really love the veggie omelet with a side of the jalapeno cornbread (any combination of spice and carbs is always a favorite of mine!).  The food is not the typical eggs and potatoes breakfast...its hyped up by a wonderful combination of fresh seasoning, vegetables, and cheese!    I've taken out-of-towners here over the past year and when they come back they request Scramble for breakfast at least once during their stay.  The atmosphere is casual and modern.  My husband and I really love to eat outside when it's cool enough.    Overall, the food is great but the prices are kind of up there for breakfast (estimate $25+ for a breakfast and beverage for 2).   But, again its NOT your typical breakfast joint and worth the money.

PQMdeVFMt7l8u9ojCY9REQ.text: This place is fantastic for vegans! Phoenix does not have a ton of breakfast options for vegans and it is so nice to discover a new place. They have 5 options for vegan breakfast, and also vegan pancakes which were not advertised but apparently there. They seem to know what they are doing as well, all the vegan meals come out on different color plates then non-vegan meals, which is somehow comforting. The staff was very friendly and totally accommodating. The place is cute, more cafeteria style and laid back which is perfect for a morning breakfast. Sitting outdoors was great, there is a beautiful view of the mountains. Overall, I would say this is a new Phoenix favorite for me!

9-acgEKOqxUi3cZoiIbO3A.text: I am a huge breakfast fan and l love scramble. My family and I eat here often the food is amazing, it is close to our house and the service is always outstanding. I have tried many different things on the menu and have not been disappointed yet. The last time we went I had their wonderful french toast. If you have not tried the french toast I highly recommend it, We make french toast at home but it is nothing compared to this it is dipped in a vanilla custard and is out of this world. I also love the southwest burrito tons of avocado and just the right amount of spice. Another reason I love scramble is it is kid and dog friendly! My daughter who is six and not a big fan of food loves scramble too she like the pancakes which come in several different flavors and the cinnamon rolls ( soooo good!). Not many restaurants allow pets so I think it is awesome that scramble does they even offer water bowls which is nice since it can get hot :) So if you're looking for a new breakfast place to try please go to scramble you will not be disappointed and if you're not in the mood for breakfast they have tasty lunch options as well!

QAkQ09fqVtnEqLp4LbK0cg.text: I ate here once based on a yelp review.  I was quite impressed.  5 stars from me.  Very clean, very friendly, very good, very reasonably priced.

jK3AXIHQMDuO7DYpVrJu2A.text: Their food is AMAZING. I loved it, but felt that the prices were a bit high for breakfast... the tastes made the meal definitely worth the cost.

vJfEOXdTcAJqmOVtmRaqkw.text: Scramble is good if you are in the mood for really big portions of sugar-laden pancakes or french toast - and let's face it, sometimes we are in the mood for that. However, my last experience will likely keep me away for good. With only one person taking breakfast orders, it took about 10 minutes to get to the counter. Scramble is one of the few places in the area that has more than one vegan option and I went for the vegan veggie scramble. While waiting, I found a seat in the too-close-for-comfort dining area and unsuccessfully tried to connect to the free wi-fi. I decided to move to the "bar" area (after extricating my flip flop from a blob of syrup that had cemented my foot to the floor), hoping to get a bit more space, but the stools are bolted to the ground and are so high my feet dangled (and I am not a short person). I moved yet again only to look up to see Fox News on the tv - not exactly what I want to see anytime of the day, let alone when I am eating! My food arrived quickly, but the aroma of the rosemary on the sweet potato hash was enough to make my stomach turn, not to mention it looked like a large hockey puck. The tofu scramble was edible only after being doused in hot sauce. The sourdough toast was good, but they do bread-type things well here, so that was no surprise. Bad food, no wi-fi, sticky floors and Fox News = disappointing breakfast.

3dT0am3nKqR8DXIudeoLNg.text: Scramble is our go-to place for Sun morning breakfast when I cant convince the Monkey to try something new. The service is fast and the atmosphere is refreshing. I love, love the jalapeno cornbread cakes and the hash browns and there is something about their cherry bacon that makes me a pork lover even more. The prices are fair and the portions are just right. I recommend Scramble for a nicely satisfying meal.

SiPLe9vX4Ape5higU0aEZA.text: dont be scared by the location, its not ghetto!  this little plaza almost makes you want to move down the road, almost.... very good breakfast food that is available past the typical 10am cut off. the breakfast pizzas are definetly unique and worth a try.

oykXZUqRecSKzskeYJJztg.text: Wow!  Went on a Sunday around 11am - busy but not packed.  Roomy and comfortable.  GREAT food.  Bacon meaty and tasy.  I had the french toast on recommendation and it was fantastic.  Great atmosphere...just an all around great place.  We were in from LA for a baseball game and wanted a non-chain local place and found this place on Yelp.  Glad we went!

jh2kZOd7VJ4hDutD1w2HEw.text: My wife and I had a late breakfast at Scramble earlier this morning. We live nearby and passed by it countless times, but this was our first time stopping in. The first surprise was the restaurant does not offer traditional waiter service. You order and pay when you arrive, and the food is brought to your table when it's ready. Technically speaking, it's fast food. Our food arrived promptly, and my wife's initial reaction was her omelet was the best she ever had. The potatoes that came with my biscuits and sausage gravy were delightful. However, the biscuits themselves were just okay, and the sausage gravy was merely so-so. The contemporary atmosphere was mostly pleasant, although the numerous televisions were a distraction. The place is definitely not cheap. With one breakfast entree and one beverage each, we paid about $22 for the two of us. It might be good for an occasional splurge with out-of-town guests, but it certainly won't become a regular breakfast joint.

xSkC1oH7C5lRNzSq_Y-wMw.text: The service is fast and friendly.  The interior is comfortable and well designed.  The food is tasty and original.  The breakfast burrito is my favorite.  This is a good place to go if you want to grab a quick bite.

yIlcYdYsqoTHw6uJVA65Cw.text: I have been wanting to try Scramble for a while - being excited about having a new breakfast place in the neighborhood.   I went this morning with two others who also had not been there. We all were very disappointed. It is pretty close to fast food, but the prices were along the line of a regular sit down, full service restaurant. The only service you get is they bring you your food - everything else is self serve.    All of this wouldn't be so bad if the food was great - but sorry to say it was not. I  had eggs benedict - the WORST I have ever had -$8. It first came to me with the egg pretty much raw - the white  part was all clear like it looks when you first crack the egg open. I had to take it back myself to the order desk. The person was very nice though. I waited a while - the others I  was with were now half way done and I had to ask someone about my meal. Someone brought it to me - only this time it was way overdone - the yolk was very hard. I then asked for the manager - he apologized and then had it redone. This time the egg part was correct. However I have to say also the hollandaise sause was not good - very thick. The other two with me each had a cheese omelette. Neither cared for it much. One had hash browns - very average - and one had bacon - kind of too smokey. One had the Jalapeno Corn Bread which was good. I had a side of  dollar pancakes - and honestly I make better ones with Aunt Jemima mix.  This was a lot like cafeteria food.   The manager did not deduct anything for my eggs benedict problem, but instead gave me a card to come back for a free eggs benedict. I'm thinking - No Thank You!!!

wL7KAItD1pvnQGMfxHscFQ.text: Scramble indeed. Scramble away from this place and into your neighborhood IHOP or Village Inn...at least you'll pay less for equally dismal food. I expected so much more from a new neighborhood place, especially one that's gotten some good reviews and publicity. First of all, I like the system of ordering at the counter for casual lunch and dinner places, but there's something about breakfast that it's ill-suited for. Breakfast is just a full service kind of meal, at least to me. The decor/design is certainly nice and modern, but I wish the food matched. With the exception of their "brizzas" (breakfast pizzas), their menu items are the kinds of basic things you'd find at any chain (actually, there's less selection than many chains). We tried the pancakes (we asked for 2 buttermilk and one multigrain) with carmelized bananas. They brought out the pancakes first and then said the bananas would just be a couple minutes. When they finally brought it out, it was one banana halved and carmelized, for three large pancakes - terrible presentation. The pancakes themselves were no better than IHOP. The eggs benedict was equally disappointing - they were served in an ocean of hollandaise sauce, the ham was a tad too salty, and the english muffins were soggy. Originally, I thought of trying one of the "brizzas" since they're unique to this place, but I'm glad I didn't. The woman next to me was eating one - it was basically eggs and cheese on a raw-looking flat dough. She didn't appear to be enjoying it at all, picking the eggs off and leaving the dough. I guess I'll be sticking to The Breakfast Club when I do breakfast out.

6giGYJbku8pWKQgA1FaL1g.text: It's ok. The food is alright but I don't like the business model.  Wait in a very long line to order your food, then hope you find a table before it's ready and the server comes to try to find your number.  What if there aren't any tables available, or you're stuck in the sun, with a baby or next to barking dogs on the patio?   Oh well!  They have your money and why should they care if you eat it or not?  I don't like that kind of pressure and having to rely on jackwagon Joe Public to be conscious of others waiting.    Sure this is the VEGAN spot for all vegans in the valley and if you don't mind the stress of the waiting in line, finding a table and battling for a good seat, then by all means; but it's not for everyone.   Fairly expensive for a breakfast spot. Most is a la carte. There is a very messy and sticky beverage station where you get your, flatware, coffee, tea, soda and water.  Wait staff is too far above doing anything other than bringing your food but they will drop and scurry off with a smile.

Oom2orM22ZUH5r4hxkW-tw.text: I've always seen this place as it is down the road from where I live. I finally had a chance to check it out with my boyfriend.  The restaurant is bright and open with a modern feel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We tried the gouda brizza the first time around. This pizza was amazing! It had the right amount of toppings. I've been missing breakfast pizza ever since I moved here from South Dakota (Casey's breakfast pizza will always be the best pizza, there is no competition).  The second time we tried the French French toast and chocolate chip pancakes. The french toast was one of the best I've had. They dip it in vanilla custard which gives it great flavor. I dont really like french toast but I would eat this again. The pancakes were nice and fluffy though the batter wasn't all the way cooked through in the middle. Still very tasty. I liked that they use mini chocolate chips. We also tried the applewood bacon. It was thicker cut with the sweet/smokey flavor of the applewood and was cook to just the right crispiness. Overall, this is a great place for breakfast and I will be back to try the rest of the menu!

N7grgnDlShR6E0tKUzvwsg.text: Love their burritos and egg dishes but their pancakes and waffles taste like they were made from a box. Their service is great 99 percent of the time and it's a very casual serve yourself your beverages and condiments. In North Phoenix it's one of the better breakfast places in the area. It's worth giving a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

P_0Svc4QtxjNevWytRvMuQ.text: Bland.  Overpriced. Not remotely worth the ten dollars I spent on my pancakes that IHOP does a better job with. Avoid at all costs.  UPDATE: One of the managers (The one with the awesome mustache) comped the meal, and thanked for the feedback. So A+ on service.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Boring pancakes I couldn&#39;t even eat due to a lack of flavor. I&#39;ve had better packaged food.

G0yR0sezgLyfrKSMjoPHHQ.text: Had the California Omelette. It's got kale and I've yet to jump on the Kale Bandwagon but now I have. I demolished everything on my plate. I am not a member of the clean plate club, but damn I ate everything including the orange wedge. I live 35 mins away and was starving when I started my breakfast adventure today but I must say they live up to what I heard. Well done. Dog friendly patio. Breakfast bar or table seating. The line stayed going out the door entire time.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy amazing kale goodness

3sqE-nNBSaL0vKVYeCtsew.text: Great customer service, cute spot but our food was just not as tasty as we had hoped. We got the traditional Benedict and veggie scramble. The poached egg on the benny was very overcooked where the yolk was completely solid. And the scramble veggies seemed like it wasn't the freshest. Our overall experience was good though so hopefully it was just an off day.

QoTNvCMqRsdpW5qcZ-f4Dw.text: Fantastic food and even better service! Love the dog friendly patio too. This was our first time here and is definitely our new breakfast spot!

31IJofT3niOpcY6ETG_zig.text: So stinking good! We ordered breakfast from UberEats and the portions are huge and the food was incredible! Highly recommend!

SLNhcLSUOrlWMZNXtvcTqA.text: I have been to Scramble a few times. I ordered the Brizza,  which is the breakfast pizza and the French Toast. Each time I went the food was pretty good and it didn't take very long for it to be brought to our tables. Despite the enormous amount of patrons on the patio, I don't think the food is THAT amazing. Lol sometimes I think it's just for show.  Anyhow, The only thing I don't like about this place is that dogs are allowed on the patio where you eat. It's a bit unsanitary in my opinion.  I know there are people who will go on and on about animals being cleaner, but who cares. If you can't be without Fido, take it to go maybe. I like dogs, but eating with them is another story.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Brizza! It&#39;s pretty small, if you&#39;re sharing you can make out with two small slices perhaps 3 haha

LdPXOVv7ph0Oxi1Pihj7Pg.text: I come here for the vegan menu. My family enjoys the rest of their menu. It's a hip place too. Typical breakfast place with a modern feel. It's just a good place with good people working here. The food is delicious. But the environment is even better. If you need a place to work during the week - come sit and plug into one of their many outlets, enjoy the free wifi and maybe a soy latte.  Man. I'm hooked.... This place is going to take all my money.

-xh1GGMr052YUZmMDOl6bg.text: Yum!  Great find on our vacation to Phoenix. We were very happy to happen on this place for a great breakfast. Loved the fast casual concept of ordering at the register and then sitting down for your food. I had the multigrain apple pancakes. Def stop in if youre on the road!

6d5SegZ_dWm3jPagQL9ZuA.text: Great and fast service I ordered the soyrizo burrito with a side of hash browns it was delicious my omni boyfriend had a burger and he loved it as well .. Glad I found a vegan breakfast place

NXFuKsOZgpDDoVDScPFUdA.text: Talk about an out of the ordinary breakfast joint, not your typical breakfast spot with same boring menus. Love this joint, my go to breakfast spot, decent prices, everything is so good, I love the eggs Benedict with turkey bacon... can sit indoor or out, very hip atmosphere, fast service and overall great experience , a must try

vMlngMx6aWLxlZpzYRORmQ.text: I thought I should go somewhere else when I saw the line, but it went super fast, and it was totally worth the wait. This place is incredible. You need to at least try it once. Everything was so fresh and clean... I hate eggs, but I had ordered 3 plates.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I hate eggs, especially too much of it. But here I was, 3 plates and loving it!

jmv5FwmnTSTXLUx8ssSedg.text: I was trying to find a nice breakfast place with vegan options and I happened to stumble upon scramble! I ordered the vegan French toast with the sweet potato hash. Very satisfying! The service was quick and the staff was extremely friendly. The environment was very casual and family friendly. I also loved how pets were allowed out on the patio. It was fun to pet a bunch of dogs after enjoying my meal. I had a great experience and I plan on coming back the next time I'm in Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan French toast

4DDkHeFagQ85lG3Dj2aZ7A.text: The French French toast is SO good, and the sweet potato hash is fresh and delicious as well. Scramble has become one of our go-to breakfast joints.

e6U1sjA_VFJGi_3iJw9CHA.text: I gave this 4 out of 5 only because seating was limited.. But I love they have vegan options! I had the soyrizo burrito and it was amazing! Very good Fresh food and they were all extremely friendly.. Definitely coming back..

w_D7WqlXwXMET7PiCBfuAQ.text: If you happen to be in the area and are craving delicious breakfast (or lunch), then head over to Scramble. It has a very modern feel and a nice outside area to eat. As soon as we got to the cashier, he greeted us with a big smile and was very kind and helpful. We got seated and or food came very quickly. I ordered some pancakes and they were some of the best I've ever had. I highly recommend the applewood bacon as a side. They have a wide variety of drinks ranging from juices to soft drinks. We all left feeling very satisfied and full.

I7jfUMmM95DGUIk2Tz2MIA.text: Vegan French toast was AMAZING! Vegan veggie scramble was lacking. The flavor wasn't very good, curry I believe, too much of it. Included very few veggies. I was expecting full bites and it was mostly mush.

lxz8K0uNn3FQBXOCoKq3vQ.text: Super fun space to eat in - the windows bring in the bright Phoenix sunshine. Great color schemes and plenty of seating inside (plus seating on the patio, although 7th street can get quite noisy).  I tried the Vegan Veggie Scramble with a side of toast (rye!) and fruit. The scramble was okay - not a lot of seasoning or spice to pep it up. The toast was yummy, and I appreciated the vegan spread served with it. My husband with the Vegan Soyrizo Burrito with the sweet potato hash. The hash was disappointing - more mash than hash, if you will. Crisping it up would be ideal. The burrito was also ok - nothing that wowed the tastebuds.  I always appreciate when restaurants - especially those that serve breakfast - have dedicated vegan items. I hope Scramble continues to keep those and add a few tweaks to really elevate these meals to a new level.

iqjlP1uD4VysFcJzc0lgfg.text: Only two words needed here when ordering breakfast...."Southwest Burro." No need for lunch. Enjoy....

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest Burro Again

3t0vW6Rc9pR66rBs-QJX4w.text: Absolutely amazing thank YOU for being open on Christmas . As a single lady and sole prop business owner I value the "little " things when I'm eating out  .. Wow is all I can say I love eggs Benedict and have traveled all over Arizona to try new places !!! The sauce is definitely worth it and I will be back !!! And NOT to mention THANK u for carrying Kombucha my favoriteeeee brand Nice decor super earthy and great service!! Thank you all for all for working on a holiday.. bless you and continued success   Humbly HairDoc TK

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My favorite kombucha

vxgEISEa_XjRrMxIKbhcGg.text: Straight fire. Driving cross country with my partner and we stayed in Phoenix for the night. We decided to grab some breakfast before getting on the road and we saw this place on yelp. We both got the vegan soyrizo burritos, but they had lots of other vegan/vegetarian options that looked amazing. This place had incredible food and great staff. Absolutely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan Soyrizo Burrito Breakfast

8beEpid5mbnToqHyCKYj0Q.text: Was craving their iced caffe caramel & hash browns this morning! So definitely came in & got an omelette as well. A lot of places don't have everything I want on an omelette so I had to make(build) my own. You can pick up to 3 items free of charge but after that it's like a $1 an item.   So I ordered an omelette with spinach, tomatoes, avocado, sausage, bacon, onions & cheddar chs. It comes with hash browns & toast (4 slices). Also I got a 20 oz iced caffe caramel.   So you basically order first & pay first at the register & tip first if you want. Then they give you a number and you get to sit where you want. The drinks are self serve if you pay. Also you pick your own utilities, condiments & etc., there's a little place in the middle to pick your stuff. Then you wait for your order to be brought to you. They brought my coffee first then my food.   The hash browns were a bit different but definitely good! So happy they weren't stingy with the portion either. The omelette was good too but there wasn't a lot of tomatoes in it(it looked like carrots), not sure if there was onions. But they definitely cut the veggies pretty tiny. That's good.   Also make sure to check in on yelp to receive a free coffee with your entree.   Also sign up for their loyalty program to start earning points.   There's also seating outside. They do have a tv inside too.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yXcT90D1Lnwq9VWSFtDvcQ.text: Their traditional Eggs Benedict is AMAZING! Bacon is delicious. My kids are picky eaters and they finished all of their breakfast. Yogurt and fruit is tasty and fresh. I highly recommend ordering online for pickup.

9JRcFqsPzGjBpTn4HIrMlA.text: Delicious- fruity pebble smoothie   Plenty of yumminess on one plate - the Toluca brizza ... jalapeno cream cheese, can I say anything more!?! Yum!  Santa Fe eggs Benedict covered in chipotle hollandaise - satisfaction in every bite.    Just do it - come in for breakfast, brunch - you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

neYC4B-Q_huMh6fWbvrnwQ.text: Here's My Order: Drink-Alarm Clock w/Almond Milk & Food: Tex Mex Eggs Benedict w/ Hashbrowns This meal was AMAZING.   We also tried: Sandwich, Omelette, & Breakfast Burrito  Service was slow but it was pretty busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tex Mex Benedict Breakfast
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RlaMlLii33nrRv4k_Hrtag.text: Normally a great place. I've been here quite a bit, but after today we won't be back. My friend and I ordered avocado toast and bacon, which the toast is not on the menu, but we both have gotten it there in the past and it's been very good.  Today, at first, we got slices of toast on one plate and about a quarter of an avocado in slices on another because "the way it was rung up at the register we didn't know how to do it." So she took it back to correct it and we got what you see in the photo minus the slices of avocado and bacon ... dry, dry toast with a teaspoon of smashed avocado. So.... we asked for more avocado and our bacon. Waitress leaves, comes back, with bacon and about the other quarter of avocado and...... another bill. "We forgot to charge you for the bacon and we have to charge for extra avocado." (It wasn't extra it was enough). Ultimately, I paid $26.00 for two plates of what you see above. Disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Avocado toast&#34;

P-N5uwTcCwK-00QspGAxgg.text: I ordered the sunrise sandwich and it was honestly really good! I looked at the pictures of other yelpers and this meal looked delicious. Upon ordering, he really helped us out and made sure our meals were made to what we wanted. I substituted the sourdough bread to an English muffin and it was still great. I'm not a big hash brown person but the hash browns here are delicious as well! I definitely recommend and they have amazing customer service here. Also the bathrooms are really fancy too!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K98VbeeFtMAkepz6s8RI_g.text: Absolutely not!!!! It was so expensive for 2 breakfast plates. They were really nice, service was ok. It's just to hipster for me. Nice and clean but the food had no soul.

beM5GI90qJqKBjxzbWSuWQ.text: The line here gets kinda long on weekends, but their service is pretty fast even if the restaurant is full. Good food and service. I always get the AZ Sunrise Brizza (YES, a breakfast PIZZA) or the Southwest Burrito!

mbAV6IL3vuehn42-QkUk3g.text: Decent breakfast joint.   You won't be amazed by any of their dishes but nothing is low quality. My main issue with this Scramble is how they ONLY have one point of sale system running on the weekends when I come. The line goes out the door and the queue wait time is just too long. You guys need to invest in another employee to man the other POS system and that place would be much more attractive. Think of it this way..... you guys know your quality.... the longer someone waits the better the food needs to be. By that logic just cut the wait time down and a review like mine would have been a 4 because of the quick service.  Just a though.

3ttbpIUhZPRD4YawvEqoHA.text: We visited here on Sunday around lunch time. The restaurant was clean and cute and we were excited to try it out. Sadly, the three stars is over the quality of the food. I ordered a Phoenix omelette which was supposed to come with chorizo. There was a small amount of sausage mixed in, but no flavor at all. I'm not sure it was even chorizo at all. Worse, the eggs were so dry it tasted as if it had been microwaved from leftovers. Either that or terribly overlooked. I couldn't finish it. It seems hard to mess up breakfast food at a place specializing in it, but it just wasn't good.

optJDGFbwiVvncpNtLw1HA.text: Love the food it's always good and my sons a picky eater so the fact that I can have a mimosa and let him sit in enjoy his bfast or brunch is a good morning

qLkL5-4E4ivWv-DHX_NtGQ.text: Good was excellent, staff very helpful and no lack for service or access to water, coffee, condiments and all top notch quality. Highly recommend and I rarely eat out due to poor service and poor quality it says a lot that I was impressed!

5ylQiowFTFLxi5t3FYD66A.text: Saw the reviews and was not disappointed.  Good food with large portions and good coffee.  Good service and clean. Plenty of great choices, even veg or vegan, and self serve condiments so you can get everything tailored to your liking. It's hard to get that many details correct and that earns my 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

N-PlmZFE4jBY7gb4KAFaog.text: ******* Awesome Spot ********* Found this place on yelp and it was everything we thought it would be and more.... we were greeted by the "breakfast bouncer" lol that's what he said when one of the people in line asked him how he got stuck outside when it was so hot ! Ha ha My group thought it was hilarious! We had a 15 min wait and were offered ice water while we wait and they also had misters which was nice. He explained the menu and offered options for sides ( so this bouncer knew his info ) we worked our way through the line and everything was fabulous! Sat down and quickly received our food which was amazing ! Kids meals were a good size and I ordered the southwestern breakfast burrito  it was filled with , chorizo eggs and cream cheese topped that with a side of salsa ! My son ordered biscuits and gravy which I'm sure were made from scratch just like the other muffins that they had! Definitely a must go to spot ! We were checked on several times and the staff was phenomenal!
