1w1dewSyh32kOQNHGA4HZg.text: When I got their. There was a long line but it was worth it. The girl working at the register was very friendly. I got the gringo burrito and got the Fruity Pebbles cereal killer smoothie. Both were very good and the food came out fast for being very busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fruity Pebble Smoothie
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gringo Breakfast Burrito

v32lptNH4X-mKPK8LNck7A.text: BKFST today for French French Toast Wednesday at 1/2 $$, dee scrumptious; never a disappointment, food, service, atmosphere warm & comfortable no need to rush out...have a second cuppa (: Sister and I also enjoy the BKFST Sandwiches mmmmm. Try the Scottsdale or the newer place in Tempe, can't go wrong. We've been going for 9 years!!

qz3iNC37j-LGf4tyLgRbag.text: My boyfriend brought me here today as a cute surprise for us to try something new. The place was cute and clean. The service was nice. The food was fresh and yummy! I tried the western omelette with hash browns. The orange juice was fresh and the chocolate milk was super good too. Will be back.

whGewg5LWfABTLkZ9KOT1w.text: I went here for breakfast they had a lot options both health & not. The service was fast and friendly, food was fresh and good.

4QRgnqVNJ1WgXRhQzhPLAg.text: My boyfriend and I are vegan and the options for dining out are limited. I found this place on yelp and after reading the reviews and taking a glance at the vegan options on the menu, we decided to give it a try this morning. We both got the vegan French toast with a side a fruit and vegan sweet potato hash. Everything was excellent. My boyfriend has quite the appetite and thought he needed to order two servings for himself but it was too much food. He said next time, 1 plate will be enough :-) we will definitely be back soon.

uqSA-0SJtcph1_53miexBw.text: My husband and I were visiting AZ for a conference. I found Scramble on yelp and decided to try it because of the great reviews. I loved the friendly, comfortable atmosphere. The staff were so kind and helpful too.   We both ordered the Southwest breakfast burrito. It was okay. I was expecting this amazing, never before tasted burrito bug it was just meh. It had too much egg and not enough jalapeno cream cheese. My husband agreed. Although I will say their hash browns were tasty, fruit was fresh, and coffee was good.  Last but not least, we ordered a cinnamon roll, again it was just okay. The frosting is very sour creamy, and my hubs and I like the sweeter kind.   With all that being said, we WOULD go back to try other items on the menu the next time we are in AZ.

p1nOjNRdpxiw91jgl0r0hQ.text: This place has it figured out. Great menu, great staff, quick and painless, and excellent breakfast. Scramble, burritos, pancakes, all amazing and well priced.

6OMAjFIs8h908HjBQASt2g.text: Very good place. There are few places that have vegan options in the NW/Phx area. I had the Vegan Soyrizo Burrito which was awesome.  I would totally return and would recommend this place to anyone whether they are vegan or not.

8k8Xgb3L9FTJpuqQBpTRDg.text: We had a great first visit to Scramble yesterday.  You have to remember that it is cafeteria style ordering so do not expect a waitress.  We were fine with that.    The Santa Fe Eggs Benedict were great.  The spicy hollandaise went great with the corn bread cakes.  Highly recommended for those that like spicy and have not tried Eggs Benedict our do not like traditional hollandaise. It comes with rosemary potatoes which were okay but home fries would have been better.    The french toast was better than most.  Also recommended.   The star of breakfasthad to have been the sweet rolls.  The reviews are right on these.  Ours was moist all the way through.  The whole family raved about the sweet rolls.   We will be back for sure even though it is far from the house.

3UmtwhkiFazcot57-IcQ4g.text: Went back to have their french toast...heavenly would probably be the best way to describe it.    There's a hint of orange, the bread is perfect and paired with bacon.. it's the ultimate breakfast dish.  I will be craving this in the near future.

ksvJxSTOAYDhEHTXukU-6Q.text: I am so glad my mom found this place, the food is 10x those breakfast chains and the staff is so friendly. My 3 year old actually has a great time with one tv on toons and little activities to entertain him. Lastly Lorain the manager is the nicest and most helpful person I have met. I actually do not live in Phoenix anymore but every couple months I am in town I have to eat here.

QZhSVVMD_8Q1cuaOT6binA.text: I've been here twice now and I just can't say that I love it or would highly recommend it.  I've had both breakfast burritos and prefer the Costa (spicy chorizo).  Ask for the jalapeno cream cheese, that stuff is awesome.  Usually I overdue it and gorge on a breakfast burrito, but I didn't want to finish my meal both times I went.  Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, it's just not great.  The food was cooked well enough and tasted fresh, though the rosemary potatoes were cold and not very good both times I went.  Highly recommend the Cafe Caramel Coffee, incredible.    Short of that, everything else lacked the wow factor or really great overall flavor.  They seemed to play it safe across the menu.  Even the pancakes were a little bland.  On a side note, they make their waitresses wear wife beaters, which I thought was pretty original/cool.

80y8Ju0YqLmD4HMjjbDqMQ.text: The staff were courteous and polite. One of the better breakfast spots in town,  the breakfast blend coffee is great.  Definite worth the trip!

eGGGbteiFoeFuSYt9jhomQ.text: I love their fresh sassy breakfast food! (Particularly the Santa Fe eggs Benny) The service is great, so is the view and the patio is a great place to get some shade & refuel with my pooch after a hike

duGK9FRI2M1ptErkQaQS5g.text: We ate here on a Saturday morning and got seated right away. Service was good, friendly, and quick. My husband ordered the corned beef hash and I got turkey sausage. Both of our meats were very overcooked to the point where they were black and burnt tasting. Our eggs were decent. Overall, pretty underwhelming and probably won't be returning.

YZ49xBfM7-jxI1xjWe_qhg.text: I love this place. My wife and I stop and have breakfast after hiking. Dogs are allowed outside on the patio and they bring water bowls for them. Oh...and more importantly the food is great!

fIni1hG6Xz8qQ4o342-Dlw.text: Absolutely amazing service , first time in there and it had delicious food and the atmosphere was very upbeat and friendly. The employees were all so friendly and they would check on us while eating to see how we like everything they were all willing to let us know what they liked which is why I got the French toast because multiple employees said they loved them and they lived up to the expectations. We WILL absolutely be back to experiment the rest of the menu!

pKnfbbbNI90nvTSKeEQsuA.text: What a great spot to stop for breakfast or lunch!  I love the variety and quick service. My favorite is the french toast.  By far the best in town!!

J1yz9lmHaUe-_0_A30QzQQ.text: The service is nice. Everyone greets you with a warm smile. The place is clean and easy to access with spacious parking shared by all the businesses in the strip. And the food is delicious!! I always get the breakfast burrito and a coffee. I'm in and out fast!

cXX8vRkauQw9QZMf8NStPQ.text: This place was AWESOME!  Before we even walked in a staff member offered us coffee or water to drink while we waited in line.  The BF grabbed some coffee and was blown away with how good it was.  He asked if he could buy it in bulk when we left.  The girl at the counter was super helpful and friendly.  We got our food fast and everything tasted amazing.  The only thing that's remotely a downside is that it's a bit far from our house.  Here's hoping that they put one in the Arrowhead area soon!

5utxQZoJlzWUoKX3at-Vkw.text: Fantastic spot! Very creative and delicious menu of American breakfast! Just like grandma makes it! Only if they had cinnamon raisin bagels and toast! Sherry is a super friendly and nice manager, always makes sure your meal and experience is as best as possible! Good work scramble!

fo9SGX1mrCX4A_HuAh0tXg.text: The above average food quality, friendly staff, and a hip trendy space makes for a great way to start your day. I opted for a tradition breakfast of bacon, eggs, potatoes, and toast and was quite pleased.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UsSFjJ7SdZp9GU4IIbSavQ.text: Just mediocre. My husband ordered the sunrise sandwich and he couldn't finish it since it was SO salty. The issue for me is that I ordered the "mixed berry" yogurt parfait with granola. What a joke. No berries at all , just some fruit drizzle in the yogurt..barely any granola. Also ordered the turkey sausage too--very salty and it was spicy which the menu should have stated it was spicy. Not that good. We won't be back as there are too many other choices for breakfast and that are fresher and better prepared.

mvNx5dTlCwfFfSWrp-Xrjw.text: I had a really pleasant time today for my first time here. The food was really good too.  When you come in you order at the register and they bring you your food.  The cashier told me about the rewards program and was really nice and approached us right away. The lady also that brought us our food was very nice and helpful, she brought us are silverware and condiments we needed. Normally you can get it yourself. I love that they have Chalula hot sauces. I had the two egg combo. The eggs were cooked perfectly. The hash browns were so tasty and the turkey  bacon was fresh and perfect. I really loved it and can't wait to go back.

6BEOERI2MVnqqGuecXg2LA.text: Scramble has good food, smiling talent, and a willingness to allow their entrees to be customized to suit any pallete or dietary preference. I love having the ability to tailor their plates to fit my nutritional needs of the day.

1cj-AVrHzLhHYQvRSvI4Qw.text: I called Scramble two days in advance because I was trying to put a group together for breakfast. The first time it rolled to a recording and I chose not to leave a message but the second time, I listened to their message more closely. It clearly states to leave a message and they will call you back.  I left a cheerful request to have a reservation for 5 on Saturday morning but also said that if, by chance, they do not take reservations, please call me back.  On Saturday morning, two members of my group became unavailable so I called Scramble to let them know that I was changing the reservation from 5 to 3. "We don't take reservations". Ugh.  I politely let them know that I'd left a message saying that if they didn't take reservations, please call. "We didn't get the message." Ugh  Once I did get there, the line moved swiftly and my order was delivered as anticipated. It's a bit difficult there to meet friends because if you are not there at the same time, then you either wait to get in line or receive your food at different times.   The food and the service were both good. Servers were friendly and helpful. I would go back but they need to fix their telephone communications in order to get a better rating from me.

_byGhcZ5PAwknI8NaJN7DA.text: I love the vegan French toast. It's amazing and quick service. Great environment and great staff

8vTWKPGrrf1_j8NQOfn7ZQ.text: I can always appreciate a restaurant that supports healthy eating and caters to vegans and vegetarians, as well as those who are gluten free. No doubt, this joint has a lot of great options for everyone, even if you feel like splurging.  Unfortunately, it was difficult finding a clean table to sit down at. It was just before noon on a Monday when we stopped in to eat, so I was a little surprised that it was already that messy. The floors definitely needed sweeping and the bathroom sink wasn't draining when I used it.   The customer service was a little odd. My boyfriend told me that the person who brought the food over to the table while I was in the restroom was condescending about the fact that we didn't get our own silverware. Honestly, we just had no idea we were supposed to pick up our own by the soda fountain. It was our first time eating here! On the contrary, the person working the register was very helpful and polite.   The food was alright. My boyfriend and I both ordered the Traditional Eggs Benedict, served with hash browns. The hollandaise sauce kind of reminded me of the packet version that you add butter and water to. I'm not saying that it didn't taste good, but almost seemed like something I could have made myself plus they used a little too much of it on the dish. The hash browns were served cold and under cooked so I barely touched them. Additionally, it took a while for the food to come out and there weren't too many customers at the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional Eggs Benedict (served with hash browns)

Ai4gUZnhTdwmjNKI9K0-qA.text: My fiancee and I stopped by this place on Sunday July 5th.  Overall I thought this place was OK.  Nothing special, but wasn't bad either.  I'm a huge fan of breakfast places and some places I usually go to are Matt's big breakfast, Perk Eatery, The Original breakfast house, 40th street cafe, and Oink, but wanted to venture out and give another place a shot.  I read the good reviews and decided to give this place a try.  Its a little different from breakfast spots, where you wait in line and order then sit down and they bring you the food.  Kind of like Jason's Deli.  We wanted in line for about 20 minutes and finally ordered.  We ordered strawberry French toast with a side of bacon, and biscuits and gravy.  We asked if the orange juice was fresh and they said it was...Clearly by tasting it, it clearly wasn't.  I should of been more specific, like was it freshly squeezed today?  Overall the food was ok, I thought the portions were a little small, but wasn't too bad.  I would come by this place again, but this place didn't stand out in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Biscuits and gravy

bl5CRdRpNGYlBKaejbzrZA.text: First time here but I definitely will be back! Only in town for a week but they will get more of my money. Had the delicious gringo burrito with a side of sweet potato hash browns. Sweet potato hash browns?! Are you serious? Awesome. 5 stars.   Oh yeah free WiFi! Great service! Super clean and modern environment!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gringo breakfast burrito and sweet potato hash browns! Yes!

My2kE4NGJfYWzyDhsWhOmQ.text: Great place! Came here on a random Wednesday morning around 11. Management is top notch. We ordered our breakfast which included a free coffee from Yelp. Upon getting our coffee, we noticed it wasn't very hot. The manager/supervisor on duty said she'd much rather us have a fresh one so she brewed an entire new pot of coffee and even got us new cups. We also noticed her go out of her way to get another guest jelly, even though the jelly is self serve across the restaurant. Overall great experience and the food was good too!

EzvXxIGO75iPBBIrPFnWwA.text: Love love love we had breakfast here every morning while visiting family in the area. I really wish we had one near our home in California. The food was amazing and the place was clean. The staff was super great and friendly.

VyRVcGcK8dvyaNz9nhEzJQ.text: We got French Toast, Taluca Brizza (chorizo, eggs, green peppers,  jalapeno cream cheese, breakfast pizza,) and green chili cornbread! All very yummy! To drink we got the White Macadamia nut iced coffee and the Carmel Iced coffee! Both we very good but very sweet. The White Macadamia nut was too sweet for my taste but my husband was pleased! Patio is small but cute! There was a line out the door but only took about 10-15 mins to get up to order our food. Food came in about 15 mins. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White Macadamia Nut iced coffee (very sweet) and the Carmel Iced coffee (a little less sweet)
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Toast, Taluca Brizza (chorizo breakfast pizza,) and green chili cornbread! All very yummy!

nw-R2Vg3pWV-CElvsAIU2A.text: great customer service, Don't be scared by the line out the door and to the side of the building. They do a great job of moving it along and you'll be seated and enjoying your meal in no time. Game winner for me and my family. Vegan friendly menu. Me being vegan and my family enjoy their meaty meal this place is perfect. Completely in love with their menu options for everyone. I will continue to attend every chance i get. My son request this place by name. Plus he loves the toys they give him and his meal. Overall great establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MNcAJQlHP6U4D8m9ygskHQ.text: Great breakfast and lunch spot! Visiting from Seattle area (in December when there's snow at home) so it was the perfect temperature for sitting outside under the umbrella with a coffee and pancakes.   Really love the apple cinnamon energy cakes. Great start to the day and a bigger portion that I expected which meant leftovers!  If you go on a weekend expect a line but it's quick enough and a pleasant environment to sit and wait for your food.

0FT6j322cYdVVy_HmiXgkQ.text: Twenty minutes to order, twenty minutes to get food. Don't go unless you have an hour to waste!

tpZi5O0i-C7fkoGBgf7tNg.text: Gave Scramble another chance last week after posting a bad review. My husband and I had a very nice experience this time. In fact, I was pouring my coffee out of cup to get some fresh coffee and one of the service people saw me and asked if there was something wrong with the coffee. I told her that it wasn't very hot. She said she would bring a fresh pot out and give me a new cup with the hot coffee. Very observant worker! Was pleased with our experience and am glad we went back. Plan to be back to Scramble again. They are one of the few vegan friendly breakfast restaurants in the Valley. The tofu options are great! I had the Soyrizo burrito with sweet potato American fries. Yum!!!!

6k4Oqed0p4mcNRZKIY9pqg.text: Very happy with this place. Great service even right before closing on a sunday! Nice waiting time on the food, and decent prices.    The meals are very clean, healthy, and most of them seem to be gluten free.  I added salt and pepper to my "Brizza" and it was all it needed. Like my husband said "I can actually taste the eggs and all the other ingredients"!!!!! He had a Cuban Panini and soup, free coffee upon checking in with Yelp! He wasn't too happy with their coffee but he's picky. I had the "Chicago Brizza"... Which is like a pizza, with hash browns, sausage, eggs, monterey jack & cheddar as toppings! It was very very filling:) Also, I had an iced green tea. Which was flavored, no idea what flavor but I wasn't told it came that way... Not my favorite but I drank it:)   Anyways, will definately come back! They have a patio but it's facing 7th St so it's a bit noisy. Inside sitting is very comfy if you grab a booth!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I believe this was the &#34;Cuban Panini&#34;, my husband ordered;)
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;The Chicago Brizza&#34; with sausage, hash browns, eggs, monterey jack &amp; cheddar! 2 can eat it!

uBX_b34nY7vqFPCU2wFBvQ.text: I did not know this place was a local chain. But the food was great, the service was great, and they had great hot sauce!   I ordered the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict.  That chipotle hollandaise sauce was delicious! Smoky, eggy, something I would pour on a lot of my breakfast.   Service was great.  Enthusiastic and happy staff, everyone was happy to chat, ask questions, and even get me more coffee (even when it was self service).  They also have 5 different Cholua flavors! I died and went to hot sauce heaven.

wQVuPorKJiSoskGV3kj3hw.text: I loved my Portobello mushroom wrap it was so good! Service was great and outdoor patio was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Portobello Wrap!! So good!

Y53bKZKitjsTLOudbBNPcw.text: Based on the Toluca Brizza (The chorizo with jalepeno cream cheese scrambled egg breakfast pizza), one can be sure I will be SCRAMBLING back to return for more! Corny pun intended, indeed! I ordered this round slice of scrumptiousness with a side of sweet potato hash and the Scramble Latte to wash it down and prevent me from a food coma, so I could have a productive day (...watching football).   At around 9am, a line already formed all the way outside the restaurant and a bit into one of the front parking spaces. We probably waited about more than 15 mins but less than 21 mins to get up to the order counter. We watched helplessly as we saw other groups of people find tables and save them before ordering against the restaurant's official courtesy sign on a pedestal that tells them not to. Fortunately, by the time we ordered, there were still tables available because people had left, and by 9:35, there was no more line. Funny thing is... right at 10am again, it gets crowded and there's a line. That's because people tell each other to meet at exact rounded times, 8am, 9am, 10am.... If you pick an odd time, it throws people off and it's less crowded.   Also, thanks to its great location, it's a hot spot for hikers to meet up after doing the trails nearby. There were tons of people after the Race for the Cure today here too. It's definitely a trendy place to be! But, it can be whatever it wants to be, because it is super good and fairly quick once you order!

Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Toluca Brizza (breakfast pizza with scrambled eggs , chorizo, jalepeno cream cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, and peppers)

1aeTZ-ihxHBtVJxkaLadpw.text: One of our favorite places for vegan breakfast.   Quick service, and a points rewards program,  we come here almost every weekend!  Their vegan French toast is the bomb!

BObH92WxxtFnqqJWuMbfcw.text: This place was mediocre at best. When you walk in you are greeted with a long line because their is only one register operator, you order then seat yourself. I sat outside on some cheap furniture with my family.  My silverware was dirty. They brought out the food for my family and said yours will be a few more minutes we dropped it, no apology just we dropped it. The food was ok very small portions, you could get the same quality at a Denny's for half the price. Won't be returning to this place.

3NL7_Y8MaTyhydxjxqrKMQ.text: We love Scramble!! We are Vegan and they have great vegan options, affordable.  Great service and lots of locations. You can eat inside or out. Drink refills.  What is really nice about Scramble is there are options for all kinds of eaters. Vegetarian, Vegan,Meat eaters, Gluten free.  Great atmosphere and great employees!!  When we come back we will probably bring our Blue and Gold Macaw Sunshine and enjoy our breakfast outside.  Update- We went back to Scrabble today and we had the best time.   We brought our Blue and Gold Macaw " Sunshine" to brunch at Scramble.  We enjoyed the Pet friendly patio and the food and service were awesome as Always!!  We will definitely be back. Check out our new photos with Sunshine.    Thank you Scramble for being Awesome!!

Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoying the Pet friendly patio at Scramble on 7th street

ETtaTfjaA_MfSSK2A4b2eA.text: Have been occasional patrons of the Scramble in Scottsdale and have always had good food and good service. We had a meeting near this Scramble so decided to give it a try.   Both of us being vegan we ordered a vegan wrap and vegetable scramble. They asked if I wanted the sweet potatoes and I said yes. We paid and they gave us our number and we sat down.   About 10 minutes later a staff member came with a bag and said here is your Southwest Scramble to go. We said we had vegan food ordered and we were staying here. About 10 minutes later they came with our order. But, they did not have the sweet potatoes ready and I'd have to wait a few minutes.   The vegan veggie scramble was not vegan! Made with eggs! My wrap was totally bland. Only the salsa and hot sauce made it edible! Once I finished eating and we were about to leave they came with the sweet potatoes. I tasted them and they were not fully cooked and tasted terrible. I asked my wife to try them and she spit them out in her napkin.   When a staff member asked how everything tasted we told her the sweet potatoes were terrible. She said nothing and walked away.   There were other tables getting incorrect orders brought to their table as well. We saw at least 2 occasions.   Nit what we expect for a $30 breakfast from Scramble!!! We will not be back to this one and sad to say we should have spoke with the manager but, did not.   Gotta be better options!!!

n7m08nIdML5IcaMjoutlQA.text: I've been to their Scottsdale location before so I knew what to do when I arrived.   Check in on Yelp before ordering to get free hot coffee! I don't normally check in until I left the restaurant except I know I get Yelp perks by checking in. This is one of the places.  Order before you get a table and they bring food to your table.  I always like their eggs benedict here and it was consistently good. They are also famous for breakfast pizza, they call it Brizza. Huge portion size, either share or bring big appetite.  Chairs they have here is not that comfortable unless you sit at the booth. Same as Scottsdale location. If you wear shorts, you will feel the cold and uncomfortable metal against your skin. Other than that, price is reasonable and good place for breakfast

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chicago Brizza
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional Eggs Benedict Breakfast

aTijWnd2i8np67zA1bGGDw.text: I am soooooo sad I can't give them a 5. The first time we went was THE BEST breakfast I have ever had in my life. However the second time was alright, but you can tell when they are in their last hour or so from closing, they get sloppy.   The Space  I was in love with the building because although it isn't large, because of all the windows and bright colors, it feels so open. Of course it's a solid pro that there's also patio seating that allows dogs!  The Service You walk in the door and walk straight past the menus to a couple registers where they then give you a number and you wait at a table of your choice for them to bring your food. Simple enough!   The Food  I got the Vegan French Toast. Every other breakfast food to me was irrelevant after that. It is crisped to perfection, and they even give you little vegan butters to go with! I soaked every bit of it in their fantastic syrup. To go with the French toast, I also got their orange juice and a side of turkey sausage. The orange juice is a little tangy but still really sweet, and the turkey sausage was sooo spicy good. My boyfriend ordered the eggs Benedict and he was in love.  The Docked Star They were a soaring 5 star until the service took a little dip. We came back two days later because I was just hooked, I ordered the same thing and while the server was setting down my plate, he knocked over my orange juice. An accident of course, but given it had spilled all over my lap and the French toast, I expected more than just an OJ replacement. I wanted non orange juice French toast. I was surprised that he didn't even offer. This time my boyfriend ordered a sausage breakfast burrito, it was small and almost all eggs, so that was a letdown as well. If I was going just off of the second experience I would have given them a 3.  Overall I definitely recommend trying this place, I would just either order what we did the first round or order their highly rated dishes. But seriously, as long as there's no orange juice on it, that French toast is to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pJlTTGvE4zSMFaWs0qgR6A.text: Great food, friendly staff, and understanding when I switched my order after being cooked.. first time visiting from California it was really good!!!

jDlHiqPJtnPslY3h_GhpxQ.text: What were they thinking? $1.49 for one stinking piece of toast! Forced to buy because egg breakfasts have only one slice now. This had been one of our favorite breakfast places especially because we can bring our dog! Friendly staff, good service, good food but the new menu and pricing begs us to go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $1.49 order of toast!

QgrzFtKZq9tJlePmzBzt2A.text: Went in for a little birthday breakfast and what I ordered was so good! The Phoenix omelette taste just like the omelette that I make at home, and I highly recommend it! The service was great and though it was busy everything came fast! Coming back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Phoenix omelette

YsS0DBNZRk6y_qLIAZFAHA.text: Scramble is a great breakfast option for vegans!!  It's one of the solid vegan breakfast options in the Phoenix area.  The atmosphere is great and the service is always good here.  I've tried all of their vegan breakfasts and they're all good!  Nice outdoor patio as well as nice indoor seating.

8ql1q3TmZHATxAd9efW7sQ.text: I am contemplating going vegan. So far I am a week and a half in and this was my first eating out experience. Thankfully my friend was considerate and found a place that was vegan friendly.    I ordered the Soyrizo burrito, but because I was not doing white flour either, I ordered it with out the tortilla. I'd say I was pleasantly surprised. It was still a bit bland, but the hot sauce kicked it up a level. And when mixed with the sweet potato hash, well let's say there wasn't too much left on the plate afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UxEhpuma4vbpI2c9uw0JEA.text: Our breakfast was OK and there were plenty of options for the vegan in our party of three. But the inefficiencies of their system detracted from the otherwise tasty breakfast.  First the food. I ordered the Tex Mex eggs Benedict on a biscuit with pulled pork, avocado, pico-de-guillo and traditional Hollandaise sauce. I rather enjoyed the fusion of the traditional (poached eggs and Hollandaise) with the untraditional (spicy southwest/Mexican flavors and ingredients). It might not be eggs Benedict as originally created, but I'm all for expanding the concept and embracing local and regional flavors and ingredients. Two thumbs up for the concept! Execution however was average at best.   My son ordered the vegan burrito and it satisfied him in terms of flavor and substance. My wife ordered a breakfast pizza which she also enjoyed.   The thing that really bothered me was s-l-o-w process for placing your order. Though there were lots of open tables (at least half of the tables, maybe two thirds, were unoccupied), when we arrived the line stretched out the door. After 20-30 minutes you finally reach the counter, you place your order, get a placard with a number, grab a beverage, find a seat and wait until the food is delivered to your table (at least it was delivered promptly).   In theory this is not a bad system. One of the most popular semi-fast food places where I live uses a similar system. The difference is our local restaurant can handle six to eight customers at the order counter instead of just one at a time as at the Scramble we visited.  Call me old fashioned, but I'd rather come in, SIT down, place an order and sip my coffee while waiting at the table instead of STANDING in line for a half-hour. And the more I think about it, I'm not sure the food was actually worth the wait.

Fc0TRl0IUQgDHS-dd3xwcw.text: First time in and gave it a shot because of the Yelp reviews. Reminds me of a breakfast version of Pei Wei only after your food comes no one ever checks on you. Main area of resturant was dirty and temperature of resturant was hotter than the outside patio at 1 pm. Not family friendly. Food was good this is why 1 star.

wboK8EN7rVh9TUP_7k0uCQ.text: Ok since writing my original review we've been back several times and I love this place. The last few times we came in a weekend morning and it was busy but the line moved quickly.  I modified the veggie scramble with soy chorizo and avocado and omg it's SO GOOD. Also, there's so much food!! I would split it next time.   We also tried chocolate chip pancakes which are just the right level of fluffy and sweet. The blueberry French toast is also so good but good to split if you don't want a ton of sweet food.  The coffee always gives me life and the staff is seriously so nice and always helpful. It seems you can modify food very easily and they don't make you feel bad about it.  Any time friends are in town or we want to go out for breakfast we end up here.

18cJtOcruzq4KxsgkXEBLw.text: Pretty solid breakfast/brunch options, particularly if you have vegetarians or vegans in your group!   I dropped by with a friend on a Fri morning and it wasn't too crowded so yay! You walk up to the front, order, then sit down with a number and wait for your food to be delivered.   I went with the vegan veggie scramble and my friend just grabbed the Monterey scramble. My vegan scramble was pretty good, but a little lacking in flavor. I was able to spruce it up pretty well with some hot sauce/salt/pepper and it did end up tasting yummy. The vegan scramble comes with a sweet potato hash, but I dislike sweet potato and opted to switch that for the hashbrowns. It also came with a side of toast! Aka there was a ton of food and I ended up with leftover toast because I just could not finish the whole meal. My friend enjoyed her scramble and was left with toast at the end as well.   Overall, this is pretty good breakfast place with plenty of seating, good parking, and friendly service. Drop by if you are in the area and want yummy breakfast foods!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qRi3yYNw9wPQMmQOCbUDBg.text: Scramble was a place that I decided to try spontaneously. I was looking for a decently rated breakfast place near where my parent live. All the reviews/photos that I saw looked great, so I decided to give this place a shot. I have to admit that I came here two days during a week that I was in the valley.  FOOD: The first time that I came here, I decided to try some traditional eggs benedict. That's become one of my favorite breakfast dishes lately that it easy to mess up if not prepared correctly. To my surprise, the food arrive at the table after only a short 10 minute wait. The presentation made the food look great, so I was eager to taste it. I will say that overall the food was great my first visit. The sauce and eggs tasted great. The portion was a great size, and I was impressed. During my second visit, the food suddenly took a turn downhill. I ordered a basic breakfast burrito. The food came out at around the same time, but honestly was sad. The breakfast burrito was much more or an egg burrito. There was hardly any flavor at all, and the meat inside was bare to minimal. Maybe I just got lucky with the meal on my first visit, but the second go around made me much less willing to return.   SERVICE: Mind you that this is a pay at the counter, take a number, and sit at a table while you wait for your food to be bought to you. The first visit that I had was pleasant service. The second visit accounts for a majority of my less than great rating. When our food was brought out to us, the runner set my plate down at an angle and spilled an entire cup of orange juice that we bought alllllll over our table, shirts, and shoes. Now let me say that I understand accidents happen. But we were soaked in this sticky juice. The kid just said "i'll clean that up and get you another cup". In the meantime, we were left to clean up our clothes and shoes in the bathrooms. I guess i'm just disappointed in the service because no manager was notified to come and apologize, or even ask to see if we needed anything else. The runner came back and wiped up the ground and never said another word. A bad representation of service if you ask me. That alone makes me also not want to return as a customer.   OVERALL: Scramble seems to be a hit or miss type of business. Between two separate visits, I encountered great quality, and the other was the complete opposite. I'm not sure if I will honestly come back after the last little disappointment in food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A mediocre burrito with hardly anything but egg.
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Traditional Eggs Benedict Breakfast

Nf_nNg2wHeldU6Zh6e6hcA.text: I spent 20 dollars on myself for breakfast the other day. I ordered an OJ, western scramble and a side of pancakes. 20 dollars for breakfast is extremely high but I could careless about the price if the food was up to par. All I'm going to say , is that the food was not good. It was dry and bland. Definitely not worth 20 dollars. Unfortunately it's not just this location. I've been to two different scrambles in the valley and they were both terrible. I tried , but I will not be re visiting any scramble locations again. They may want to adjust their pricing as wells. You can't charge high end prices for McDonald's level quality food.

RVvUQsOZ5aN7D__p-h8Sxw.text: Great, fast service. The vegan French toast is delicious. The sweet potato hash isn't my favorite vegan side. This time I had the garden grinder but instead of mushrooms I opted for soy chorizo & it was so good. Great atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garden Grinder Lunch

XASgjpnmmmuFoqMS-CCfkA.text: Located in a nice part of northern Phoenix, Scramble serves breakfast and lunch items. The menu is diverse and they even have a vegan menu. The setup is fast casual. You stand in line to place your order at the counter, pay, get your own drink, utensils and condiments. Then choose your own table. A waiter than will bring out your food.   Wife ordered chocolate chip pancakes. I had a few bites and they were truly delicious. Melt in your mouth. I had the steak and eggs with wheat toast and has browns. All tasted great and fresh. Steak and hash browns were well done and eggs over easy were done just right. Steak was tender and seasoned well.   Customer service was great, our order came out exactly correctly and ambience was great. For those who have to wait for a table, they have complimentary iced tea and water outside and plenty of seating outside. Outside seating is pet friendly.

TslnEsQcDMinETrBlOHvng.text: Well I tried this place with mixed results. Wierd concept, you order at counter & they deliver to table. That's the last time you'll see waitress. I understand that all help gets tip from initial order. Stupid!!!, as there is no one to see if you need or want anything else.  I ordered biscuits and gravy,  came on small plate & while not terrible there was very little gravy. Had hot tea which was very good as it brews in container in cup. My over all view was a little expensive for the food delivered. Sorry to say but won't be back. I thought would be better as had good reviews. Must have different views of what's good than me

gsfzyEuP0zuIFVV0YAcWww.text: It's decent i guess, but way overpriced for what it is. This was my greasy, boring breakfast sandwich with gluten free bread (i have no choice in the matter, but come on, there are better options than Udi's). That and a regular old coffee cost me over $16. I just get the vibe this place is way more interested in saving money than providing quality. Not impressed. Coffee wasn't anything to write home about either. Service is just ok and as far as i can tell everyone who works there is barely out of highschool... another indicator of corporate tactics focused on maximizing income over offering actual quality... Whole experience was just Meh.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich

fQStvFRIGAqgzZ04zzIX8g.text: We went to Scramble based on Yelp reviews. First thing you should know is you order as you walk in. This threw us off a bit as we did not know the menu and felt like we were holding up the line. Everything is self-service, they will bring your food out but there is a drink station.  Overall the food was average to us and most disappointingly the coffee was not fresh and we got the bottom of the barrel. My son ordered the Chicago style pizza which was very bland which was the same complaint my daughter had about her breakfast pizza. The two little kids did enjoy their pancakes with French berries and a cinnamon roll. My wife had a mushroom skillet and toast which she said was fairly average. I had French toast which I thought was very good and it was a thicker sourdough bread which I enjoyed. Overall a mixed experience for us.

6abdAjZDEWNoXVvkWwvQ8Q.text: I have been going to Scramble for 2 years- I can't believe I have not reviewed it yet!   I love the casual atmosphere of this place and I love the outside patio when the weather is cooperating.   The service is great and the food is even better. They are open for breakfast and lunch. The menu is varied- breakfast pizza's, salads, sandwiches, benedicts etc...  My husband loves the gringo burrito. My son loves the eggs benedict and I usually create my meal from the al la carte menu.   Try the cinnamon roll....you won't regret it!

N029MAllne_X-VLBDlATOw.text: Great food!  Great iced tea but unfortunately the cups are too small.  It's hot in AZ!  Step it up with 32oz cups!!

GSk0RwN1D8u6Gd1qNeoleA.text: Time to recognize a good restaurant with excellent and courteous service. For a while I have been telling friends of scramble. The food is exceptional and considering our economy, so are the prices.  I have made Scramble to my favorite list.

GgT_z0_95HoIhiDPtiRaZA.text: We've moved away and I find myself craving a Scramble breakfast experience. I love the layout and the atmosphere. The food is amazing order anything and I am sure you will love it. My favorites are the breakfast pizza and the breakfast sandwich. The French toast is also very good.

xi7qKgiRjlHOJDrNpnrsrw.text: Hubby and I enjoyed a great breakfast here and will definitely return.  I had the breakfast sandwich, which I wish I would have taken a picture of it's morning perfection.  Ham, egg, cheese on grilled sourdough.  The egg was fried to perfection - solid white and beautiful bright yellow running yolk.  Hubby had the meat lover's scramble which was also tasty - but he was quite jealous of my glorious sandwich.  I have searched and searched for a decent breakfast sandwich in Phoenix and here I have finally found it!

7_Z0NK_zM8ztghkVHAytUw.text: A group of us eat here once a week, for the past 2 years, for a business meeting. Occasionally, the music is so loud that we cannot hear each other even when we are sitting next to the other person. We usually ask if they can turn the music down, with a smile, they agree and in no time the music is at a decent level and we are able to continue our meeting in a great environment. Today we were meeting at Scramble and the music was unusually loud and there were only about 3 tables that were full. I asked if they could lower the level of the music and again with a smile the staff agreed. Shortly after I returned to my table she came to inform us that her manager said she could not lower the volume on the request of the owner. We asked to speak to the manager and when she came over she again told us that the owners of the establishment has instructed her to keep the music at this particular volume during business hours. We told her that we are frequent customers who are meeting on business and it is difficult to hear one another. She again told us that the owner has requested that she leave the volume as is, they would like to create a certain vibe for their restaurant and she is unable to do anything for us. About an hour and a half into our meeting we noticed the level of noise dramatically increase due to the amount of people in the building trying to talk over not only each other but the loud music. I personally find it very hard to believe that an owner would rather lose customers than to lower the volume of the music. Every time we are at this establishment we notice that there are several tables of meetings taking place not just social eating. There will be a lot of business walking out their door if the owners truly stick with this new "vibe."

okNyJE17VBoyg4B-5VuRDg.text: I went back and tried the vegan scramble and it was delicious. The girls there are really sweet and attentive. And again and excellent latte!

9ihy9MdW5VkKhEZxuAYlxw.text: Great place with a great interior and great food.   The waiters are nice and polite.  The French toast is delicious; served on a very classy plate.

PIFeg2jk7pZN5NDj5Cmaaw.text: Love this place! Awesome food and great customer service.. I had the steak and eggs and it was pretty good. There is nothing bad to say about this place!

vh8fYsCqI4uCDMk1mfxd2Q.text: I know, I know I'm late to the party, but Hey, this place is Hell and gone from me.   We arrived about and hour before closing so the place was pretty empty, but I really loved the the vibe, it was hip and modern and also very clean.   I ordered the Vegan Mushroom & Spinach Scramble which was Tofu scramble with sauteed mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes and spinach. Served with sweet potato hash & toast.   I LOVE a good Tofu scramble, this was one was pretty good, my only complaint was it could have used more flavor the Tofu was pretty bland. The Hash was delicious and spiked with rosemary, mushrooms, zucchini and onions.   High marks for serving Vegan Stuff, but honestly don't see myself making the trek back anytime soon, not because I didn't like it, but simply because it's not practical to drive that far for breakfast.

XiJyUYgeyLLSRPbIW4s2Dg.text: Great vegan options! The food is always fresh and prepared well. It can be a little crowded but the atmosphere is fun. One of my favorite places!

OkRF3GFbvBtEN5JmPNY1Cw.text: This place is awesome, trendy and delicious. Coffee is on spot. Breakfast burritos are amazing. Everything else is well done.

R5PO256qNgVzakSqVoIR2Q.text: I really want to like this place. It is only a 10 minute walk from my house, and it is very convenient for me. I have eaten her several times, and have had a few things off of the menu. I highly recommend the brizzas, breakfast pizzas. They are delicious and they are always good. The other items that I have tried have been hit or miss.   The Gouda brizza is made with smoked gouda and apple smoked bacon. What can be wrong with that combo? Absolutely nothing! I have also had The Toluca. It has chorizo, peppers, cheese, and jalapeno cream cheese. This brizza is so good, but very rich.   I have also had the three cheese omelet. The first time I had it the omelet, it was brown, dry, and inedible. I sent it back and the replacement was excellent. The truth is the rosemary potatoes were the best thing about the meal.   This morning I work up with a craving for pancakes. So, I ordered the multigrain pancakes. When they arrived they looked great. However, when I took my first bite I was so disappointed. I went back and looked at the menu, and there was no mention that these were cinnamon pancakes. There was so much cinnamon in these pancakes that they were nearly inedible. Imagine chewing 2 sticks of Big Red chewning gum and taking a bite of pancake. That is what it tasted like. The cinnamon taste actually took my breath away. I couldn't finish them. They left a horrible after taste in my mouth. I love cinnamon, but just not in my pancakes. If I had known that these were cinnamon pancakes, I wouldn't have ordered them.   I am sure that I will go back to Scramble, but I am pretty sure I will not order the pancakes again. They should really revise the menu to mention that these are cinnamon pancakes.

rU93hbnUOEHsgDPA8O4tZQ.text: Just got into town and found this place on yelp.  Great omelettes, staff and views!  I highly recommend it!

cM7oJ4tEk6KL3Rfp7gSi5w.text: The food is very good here but the prices are a little steep for breakfast.  It is nice to have a good breakfast joint in Moon Valley.

C4BN7yUarZJB9Ce0WT4PpA.text: I really wanted to like this place. It has a very hip ambiance, no doubt. In the end, the quality of the food is just not that great. It fell below the expectations I had based on the vibe and decor. The quality of the food, the ingredients used, reminded me of what is normally served in cafeterias.  In the end, as much as Scramble is a cool place, I have to choose food over the look.

0UVXgzBmDcsa2ebo5fDC8Q.text: A few weeks ago, I probably would have hooked Scramble up with a 5-star update, but they did something to piss me off and the service has been a bit sour lately.  I really love and appreciate how accommodating for vegans they are. I love the soyrizo scramble with nutritional yeast and the garlic chili chaluhla sauce. I smother it and it tastes sooooo good that I crave it all week long. I know others enjoy the sauce too because the bottles are always being used, but for some ungodly known reason Scramble decided to stop providing the sauce. WTF man???   The cashiers don't seem to be especially knowledgeable about the products and it generally takes 2x as long to order a vegan meal than it does a normal meal.  They also recently started putting in bigger chunks of green bell pepper which I think really detracts from the taste. I have also been jipped on my avocado twice now, and my English Muffin barely toasted.   I have to admit, the french toast and the English Muffin (when cooked right) have a special place in my soul! And there is nothing better that vegan butter  being readily available.  More knowledgeable cashiers, quicker bus service on a busy day, and a re-introduction of the chili garlic sauce and you will have me back. As for now, I'm so mad about the discontinuation that I cannot even look at you!

EEBQUsjEzEPTB39dOcrlUw.text: Had high hopes for this place. Line out the door and has vegan options so figured it should be good.  Friendly staff and bright clean place.  Noise level on the higher side but tolerable. I ordered the veggie breakfast scramble with sweet potato hash browns. And hubby ordered the veggie scramble burrito. The food came out on large square plates and I was expecting a slightly larger amount of food. There was a small helping of sweet potato hash and a small amount of scramble and two slices of toast and a slice of orange.  The scramble tried to be flavorful and had a nice mix of veggies but fell below expectations. Hubby's veggie burrito on the other hand was delicious and flavor-able.  Neither one of us was too impressed with the sweet potato hash browns.  It was the first time either of us had them. I love sweet potato fries so maybe I was making a flavor connection that just isn't there. Maybe the way they tasted is the way they are supposed to taste. Looking around the room it looked like everyone was enjoying their food. Must admit the vegan French toast someone else was having looked simply amazing.  I would definitely give the place another try and choose a different dish and see how that review would compare to this one.  I am just thankful there are vegan options in Phoenix.

pPvA86YwvPrplHcS6RSxdA.text: A nice fast breakfast place that serves some fresh and natural food.  Like a breakfast Pei-Wei.  The bacon is epic.  The French Toast is legit.  Nice patio that is pet friendly and a lovely spot for coffee.

vkfOivS3XTx7Cy1R8ixpBw.text: After a long night of drinking, ScrAMble is a great little b'fast spot!  I like the style where you order on the way in and they bring it to you.  This is a MUST when i am very hung over.  I just cannot handle waiting 30 min for a table and then another 40 min for food with the sounds of silverware slamming against ceramic plates.... not when im this hungover.  :-/  The only drawback is that they dont have cocktails, and sometimes i really need a bloody mary.  Scramble's food is great and affordable.  Dog friendly patio and good coffee.    Do it up sunnyslope.

4rEQgTKzqlyjvrk9eaApJA.text: Scramble is a great breakfast and brunch joint, and I'm glad to see that it's doing well. I give it a 4.5 out of 5.  I've only tried a handful of dishes from this place but they've always been quite good. The star of the show, in my opinion, is the brizza - a biscuit-dough breakfast pizza that I've been in love with since my first visit.  My first dining experience I ordered the Toluca brizza and it was incredibly good, although I will warn that the jalapeno cream cheese and the chorizo have a definite bite to them, so gringos beware! I've also had the Gouda brizza, and it was smoky and yummy, but I much prefer the Chicago, with a side of their awesome, stick-to-your-ribs sausage gravy as a dipping side.  Buttermilk biscuits and gravy are a meal unto themselves. The mushroom and bacon omelette is just dead-on, with garlic-sauteed mushrooms and chunks of thick-cut bacon.  I'll admit that I haven't tried their lunch menu, but if that quality is as high as   I had been here once before, when the location was still a Le Pepe, and was surprised by the change in decor: It's very modern and trendy. If you've ever watched Restaurant: Impossible on Food Network, it's got a very up-to-date vibe like a lot of their remodels do. Seating is comfortable but I will admit that the steel-tube chairs can pinch a bit, and that's probably the only reason I don't mark this as a 5 because breakfast\lunch places are the kinds of place where you stuff yourself and then linger for 20 minutes afterward, drinking soda or coffee and chatting.  I hope Scramble keeps doing well, because they deserve it. It's an excellent breakfast\brunch joint, and we need more of it!

RfkEMYJHpBucFPTGPqL7lw.text: Per my Mom "An omelet you don't have to add seasoning to! It's so open and airy, they even have the food network on TV! Everything has so much flavor" We loved this place on Mother's Day. Although the line was out the door, it moved quickly. This place was very cool with big screen TV's everywhere, upbeat and fun music playing over the intercom, as well as a hip and fun environment. This place is definitely one of our new favorite breakfast places!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chicago!

hZSlA6bD1-7GK4vBnfbBdw.text: Had breakfast with a friend. Food was excellent.  Service was great. Enjoyed our time there. Had scrambled eggs with mushrooms and spinach.

X9yxd8kRh8uU4Hwb4Rj5YQ.text: I would rank this place as a 3.5 rounded down to a three. It's an adorable place- sleek and cute 60's mod, bright and cheery. My husband and I had brunch here on a Monday am, so it was quiet and comfortable. It's a Chipotle or Paradise style place, where you line up, order, and then take your seat while food is brought out to you. The middle ground between fast food and restaurant.  I remember the food being good, but not outstanding. His was better than mine, but I think part of the reason that was so was because he had a really rich chipotle sauce on his. I hadn't been up to something that rich that morning. And while they do have a full compliment of traditional breakfast drinks, I was extremely disappointed that they didn't have mimosas or bloody mary's. I think if they did it would've kicked this review up from 3.5 to 4 stars.   An enjoyable experience, but not something I'd drive from halfway across town for.

8FELf0hx183XebAMO7Kw6g.text: We have been to Scramble a few times for breakfast and it never disappoints. The food is fresh, the prices are decent and the place is very clean. We've had the French French toast (delightful)...chocolate chip pancakes (heavenly)...bacon (perfect balance of flavor and crispness)...and the best part of all...freshly squeezed orange juice. The juice seems to be a favorite, as most patrons grab one from the cooler on the way to ordering. If you want to mix up your breakfast routine and try something new, I suggest you try Scramble. Everything is simply delicious and a treat for your tastebuds.

DKrIHMRQTaU8Gp9OAdl1rQ.text: Great food, costa burrito was great, the wait to order was a little long but it was nice to sit down and eat and then not have to wait for a check! Coffee is also great with all different kinds of milk and sugars!!!

9qY2H4rV1_RDWrhjIwiEqw.text: Came for the BF Vegan options, they did not disappoint! The Soyrizo burrito was delicious, and the French toast.

3rk-WdDgSaSMjReNfaBC1Q.text: Love the food. Always seems crowded, and they need to have two registers open so the line moves faster. The staff is very friendly, but somewhat slow.  We will always go there:)

dKHQFA_5VW1GxdI-TcVLZA.text: Love Scramble! Fast, friendly service. Fresh, local ingredients used in delicious, unique dishes. Recommended: Sante Fe Bennie, The Chicago Brizza. Pet friendly patio and mountain views.

r_03xCRGfNPGGB76vhOXrQ.text: Not bad of a place. Unique.... I would come back. Good coffee and food, very fresh. But I wasn't full with the amount given. Medium to small portions.

j9Yibjylo766lq01Wy-mQQ.text: I want to give this place more stars for having great-tasting food, lots of choices, nice atmosphere, and a vegan menu, but my most recent visit there has given me some concerns.   I ordered the Vegan Veggie Scramble which according to the menu is served with sweet potato hash and toast.  The cashier asked me which type of toast/english muffin/bread I would like as the side.    Me:  "whichever one is vegan is fine." Cashier:  "I'll have to check"...comes back in a minute.... "none of them are vegan, but you can substitute fruit as a side if you'd like"   Not wanting to take up any more time at the register as there is a long line behind me, I said that fruit was fine.   When a server brought my food I asked him if it is in fact True that none of the bread or toast is vegan and he agreed that even the toast that is listed as a side on the vegan menu is not vegan.  I should have asked how they could serve "vegan" french toast if none of their bread products are vegan.   So either there is a lot of confusion among the staff about their food/menu or they are serving non-vegan food as vegan.

BWQIsvSNlbE-IMp99eKUlQ.text: Really good food! If you don't mind standing in line and ordering your food prior to sitting down you will not be disappointed by this breakfast heaven. Great friendly staff, excellent food and speedy service even when slammed. We will certainly be back to sample more tasty offerings from this restaurant.

FtbwFFyqyRYrxPKlNHGw8g.text: One of the best breakfast spots in the valley. 5 stars because they serve breakfast all day. Take that bitches!

2LH5xOOY9LxwqSBkVKSEBQ.text: Went on a saturday morning, the place was busy. the format was well suited for it though as it was like a fast food breakfast setup. order, pay, you get a number and your breakfast is brought to you. I'd be scared to bring a large group cause seating is tough to come by.   I had the Costa breakfast burrito which was phenomenal! Chorizo, bacon, and potato! Yum!

18Cg3AVp6NMzZ1BcmB8dZw.text: I like this place. Definitely cleaner and has better ambience than your typical breakfast joint.  I also like that it's an order at the counter type of place.  I've been a few time and always gotten the two egg breakfast with the potatoes and the toast. I've had the eggs prepared a few different ways and they've always done a good job. No overcooked poached eggs here. Their breakfast burritos look good but I've yet to try them.  A great breakfast stop if you're in the area.

6rItHANsdijZD4abq3GkKA.text: Open for the holidays! 365 days a year. So awesome. The best jalapeno eggs Benedict I've ever had! After our morning hike of Shaw Butte Mountain we stopped in for brunch. The staff is amazing. They were friendly and helpful. Coffee is great! Love the outside seating. A must try place!!

sCUsZFKRAXF12EPqqiFwdQ.text: First visit, friendly staff. Nice place, they buy their ingredients local, dog friendly if you sit outside. Nice concept get your own utensils and coffee. The Italian blend is very good. I had the garden scramble eggs with bacon added, pretty good. My wife had the French toast baguettes, nothing special. Even thou I probably won't return I would still recommend this place as somewhere to have breakfast.

AT3alikaO75dfoP6yF4Zgg.text: I love Scramble. The food is good and the price is reasonable. But what it really gets 5-stars for is the service. The service is always outstanding, especially from Mike.

NI8ROIvR4UYwbqxKf8aZCw.text: Scramble is absolutely delicious. I bring everyone here. I'd eat it every morning if I could. The Breakfast burritos YUM! The rosemary potatoes are to DIE for! Its a very bright warm welcoming atmosphere and the staff is always friendly! The presentation of the food is always on point!

qockxieTZCFOjwqENdwSbg.text: One of my favorite places for an easy, casual breakfast, brunch, or even lunch. The staff is consistently friendly and the food is tasty. Wonderful options for vegetarians (like me) and vegans (try their awesome vegan french toast!)

mXXDq0r-Yg3YUBuZFGcwbQ.text: Vegan Soyrizo Burrito is amazingly good & I'm not a Vegan. On a Sunday morning, it's worth the wait & the staff is always friendly. It's always clean too.

3fkUZHBAPl4jaeNB_YMpOw.text: OMG. What trippy breakfast experience. Someone has teleported Walt Disney's automated breakfast restaurant of the future right out of Epcot Center and on to North 7th Street in Phoenix.  Hop on the ride at the door where you pass the menu on the wall. Read fast because this ride doesn't stop. Don't lose your place in line! It's all about queuing here at Disney.  Give your order to the orange, expressionless, automaton robot-babe. Receive a number. Find a table and wait for Disney Magic to happen as dozens of orange robot-babes rush about delivering platters, busing plates and hauling coffee urns.  Tables full? Don't worry. Crowd management is covered here at Disney/Scramble. When tables are full, one or two order taking orange robot-babes shut down to reduce the flow into the restaurant. At Disney, everyone gets to the front of the line...and to their share of the breakfast magic...sooner or later.  The food? Utterly soulless, just like the robot-babes.  Rosemary potatoes? Yup. There's potato. There's rosemary. Can't argue with that.   Scramble browns? Perfectly formed circle. Browned dark on one side; light on the other. Don't like it too dark? Turn it over!  Multigrain pancakes? Multigrained? Yup. Pancake? Yup. Perfectly round? Yup. Consistently sized? Yup. Too much cinnamon to cover the bland basic mix? Yup. Lots of syrup? Yup!!! Robot-babe, bring more syrup! I say these pancakes are just as good as any frozen Eggo product you're going to find!  Poached egg? It was poached. Nice yellow yolk, just like the safe eggs from Safeway. Served in a nice little cup to keep them from running all over your plate.  Scramble Latte? Super sugary!  Coffee? Yes. Bold option? Bold! Regular option? Regular!  ALERT! ALERT! ALERT! Someone call Hyatt Place. The orange robot-babes have stolen all their square white plates. They are the perfect dishes for the automated restaurant of the future: unbreakable, stackable, space-saving, and easy to load and remove from an automated dish washing system!  Got a group? No problem! All the tables are sized for two and are portable so they can be moved all around the restaurant to provide seating for a couple, a family or even a whole book club! Be careful though. I would advise against creating any unique arrangements, say such as lining up tables on a 45-degree angle. I suspect the robot-babes could not compute. The entire restaurant could spin out of control and crash. Experiment with caution.  Folks, this food is every bit as good as the "free breakfast" you can get at La Quinta, Holiday Inn Express and Hyatt Place and better automated. Plus you get orange robot-babes! If you like your hotel breakfast, you're gonna LOVE this place.

8-vaBCS5wg9UwkylHC2U5w.text: The high marks prompted me to try this for a breakfast meeting.  Wasn't expecting to place order at counter and have self service drinks.  Not a bad thing just a surprise.  Found a table outside since the music and kitchen noise was a bit high inside.  Had to fix the outside table to keep it from wobbling. After a few minutes the traffic noise was too loud to carry on our meeting so we moved inside.    Food came in about 10 minutes. Quality was fine however my guest said pancakes were a bit tough.  Likely over cooked.    Meat lovers scramble was good with crisp hash browns.    Service was fine and appropriately attentive.

gzCIXFIocG636uYXLG98KA.text: I have visited Scramble many times since they introduced the vegan menu items, which is why I was surprised I had not reviewed them. Scramble is getting 4 stars instead of 3 because I truly appreciate the effort to offer vegan items and how they responded to vegan inquiries. Having said that, a few minor things continue to bother me:  1. I feel like the tofu in the vegan burrito isn't really seasoned anymore. It was never heavily seasoned but I feel like it's gotten a bit more bland and sometimes appears like its just plain tofu heated up.   2. I feel like the tortilla would be better if it was grilled a bit. It seems kind of chalky and cold when I am wanting it to be browned and slightly warm.  3. The soy chorizo is a nice addition but it's kind of close in texture and consistency to the tofu so it all just blends together. Something like some veggie sausage or tempeh bacon in with the tofu or as an option would be a great.   It might seem like I am complaining but lets face it, you don't have many vegan options in Phoenix for breakfast. Ironically that might be why I am not impressed as much now as was forced to figure out how to make a mean vegan scramble and vegan breakfast sandwich at home for all these years, so maybe I have just had more practice and now I know what works and what doesn't.  The sweet potato hash is still fantastic and was a knock out addition to the menu (for vegans and omnis!)  I still dig the decor, it's always clean, the service is good, the bathrooms are nice and the consistency issues seems to have gotten much better. Scramble would really be an easy 5 stars in my book with some more attention to improving the vegan selections. Maybe I am asking for too much but I am a vegan and we like to whine and complain a lot so there!

5ugOCoOnV-ugHgOemytp0A.text: Tried Scrambles after reading good reviews.  Unfortunately, food was cold, bacon was under cooked, biscuits and gravy was just 'slop' and it too was cold. Eggs were OK but it is hard to mess up eggs. Drip coffee had a very off taste like the carafe had not been cleaned in weeks.  Overall the place was clean but it seemed as if they were not ready to be open this morning.  Another thing to note that is not very clear is that it is a walk up service restaurant.   You order, then find a table and then they bring out your cold food.

Zzlgk16QHCthrm25o4Omrw.text: My husband and I are visiting from Hawaii and found this restaurant on Yelp.   It was just as good as the great reviews I read!  We were greeted with friendly service.  The food was excellent and service was fast and again friendly.  I would recommend this to anyone visiting Phoenix.

Z7kH-HEPuSwaIV2mQtZI5w.text: Friendly people but I'm shocked if anyone has been here more than once. Came with a friend because of good reviews but food was cold and way over priced. I could have made the same thing at home and it would have tasted better. I ordered a scramble and he got an omlette...we should have went to village inn...save your money

r7uWplNfO74GF9DF-LbpYw.text: This place could be awesome but when you walk in there is a super gross and dirty plant wall that needs to be removed. The counter service is pretty fast but the portions are small so order more than you think you need. We wanted to add a side of hash browns and a side of sausage after we saw the small portions but the line was out the door so that wasn't possible. They should add an iPad terminal for add on orders. The furnishings are clean and modern looking it reminds me of a cafe in Switzerland I visited once. The coffee is good and the little coffee bar is neat but you end up making multiple trips to grab all you need to eat a meal. The silverware should be in roll ups so you get everything with a napkin in one grab. Food was ok. I got the French French toast but the custard was barely there and not soaked I to the bread at all so it was like eating bread with syrup. Husband got the brizza. He liked it and thought it was tasty. The hash browns and bacon were excellent. Nice view out the window too.

TvKJfxBjEXzRgrWwnc8DnQ.text: Been wanting to try this place and had the mushroom and bacon omelette which was very good. The cinnamon roll was good along with the meat scramble. One of the better breakfast places we have been to on Phoenix, I liked the self serve drink bar and how you can get your items yourself. Overall I will come back to this place.

P_APieNTD0fmEY5PDBEY8w.text: I had been wanting to try this place for a long time and finally did. I had a simple bacon and eggs breakfast but what I really loved was the Rosemary Potatoes. I love well seasoned pototatoes and these hit the spot for me.   I like that you can get your own refills of coffee here as well and that it is in a to go cup so you can take some home.   After reading reviews I had to try the cinnamon roll and it was amazing. Pure sugar!  It is a little bit pricey at scramble, but definitely worth trying!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosemary potatoes

-xh1vhXA5d50iKlngYf6Cw.text: Scramble is a refreshing change to counter service.  They offer a smile, good/fresh food, and they are all about supporting the local economy.  This does come with a price so don't expect a Denny's special.  I prefer the breakfast burrito, enough to keep me full until dinner, and my wife usually eats the Santa Fee Benedict.  Everything we have eaten here is delicious.  I would definitely recommend a side of bacon, thick and tasty.  Wash it all down with some OJ or a Iced Mocha and you should leave happy.  Perfect way to end a hike from North Mountain or start a long day after a late night.  Thank you Scramble.

36HVh4L6P93FnuNt0HcNXQ.text: Decent breakfast joint.  Order at the front, then grab a seat and wait for someone to deliver to your table.  Aside from the seating arrangement, the thing they've got that's different from everyone else is the "brizza" - a breakfast pizza that has scrambled eggs, hash brown potatoes and a meat that differs based on your order.  I found it to be quite bland - the dough isn't that great and the scrambled eggs on it taste like the egg mix served up in cafeterias.  The standard breakfast fare was good though, so I'd recommend sticking to the basics and get an omelette or something like that...

izVJ9wKEHpcxb--21YkR9w.text: Wish I had known about this place years ago so I am really late to the party.  However, better late than never!  This place has something for everyone including many delicious Vegan options. The French Toast is probably the best French Toast I have ever had, vegan or otherwise.  The staff is friendly, fast and the atmosphere is welcoming with a contemporary twist.  The prices are very reasonable and everything is very healthy.  Love everything about this place and am telling as many people as I can about it.  Go as many times a week as you can people!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1DmVD8GLZZM-yDhsI_m_3A.text: Good food and a friendly staff makes this breakfast place a nice stop when you don't have a ton of time. Order at the counter and they'll bring the food to you while you enjoy a quiet ambience and the nearby mountains.

gZnbeJPMCLtlcDZSxlHmcg.text: We are now making this our weekly Friday destination for the B&B (breakfast/brunch) wonderfulness! Prices are great, the staff is fun to talk with and they love ourdogs as much as we do!

8y8xgBC0GuAggfycBacetw.text: Well to be fair, Im between 3 and 4 stars. I like the place, it has nice atmosphere and I will be back. I like that you order at the counter, wait is very reasonable, and patio area in nice and not crammed.   Food is alright, but nothing exceptional or way better than at any other place. Having said that, $23 for breakfast and coffee for 2 is a bit too much for me. I had eggs, they were ok and that's it. Next time I'll try something that got all the positive reviews and see if my a-ok feeling will get up.

4UXicmRVFTwNwwZd_i3x-w.text: Don't let the line scare you - you order first and then grab a table. Cinnamon role was light and delicious.

eifMCS2BYYHraXuk1cx4gA.text: I work in the restaurant industry, so when I go out to eat my expectations are a little different than the average diner. My husband had been seeing a acupuncturist next door, so I finally got to try out this place. When we walked in and I immediately saw you have to order at the counter then sit down I put my nose up in the air.....   Only to be brought back down to reality with an awesome breakfast. My husband got the burrito and kept exclaiming how great it was. I had the Santa Fe Benedict that had my mouth burning, yet I couldn't stop eating it. Our 15 month old had eggs, multigrain pancakes and sausage patties. The pancakes were so good, that we ended up stealing two from her. The kids portion was huge!  Oh and the coffee... I haven't had a bold Italian roast this smooth anywhere! I have to find out where they get their coffee from... And then limit myself because I definitely had a buzz when we left!

ItuW_l36zxISQ804WLlBvw.text: I'm so bummed this place was not as tasty as I would've liked it to be. The place is cute and cozy ...and that's it. Coffee is average. My husband had steak and eggs with bacon on the side. I had the vegan burrito. He was upset with his meal as it had "no taste." His potatoes were "cold and tasteless." Eggs had no seasoning and his steak was "just full of pepper." Bacon was "undercooked" with the plate drenched in oil. Doesn't the chef know you have to put the bacon on paper towel first? My burrito was ok. It barely had any soyrizo and had no kick to it. I was anticipating some spice as it indicated an icon of "spicy" next to the description. The sweet potato was overwhelmed with rosemary spice.   Would've given this place 2 stars but this place deserves a 3 for its cleanliness

GYsR0PXHSjHY0H0-mn2pkw.text: We were trying to find a place to take my mom for Mother's Day. We've been to several breakfast places here in the Valley, so we wanted to try some place new.   I had read some good reviews on Scramble here on Yelp, so I thought we should give this one a try.   It isn't in the nicest part of town, this complex this restaurant is in, is kind of dumpy. But as soon as you walk into Scramble, it doesn't matter. The place looks so cool inside! It's got a cafeteria-esque like feel.   The people are very nice and the food was good. I got the multi-gran pancakes, and it was "okay". I think it was a little mushy in the middle. I hadn't had pancakes in like four months, so I was a little disappointed. But, I still enjoyed the experience. I'd come back and try something new!

b_PVbtXu6IrwrcJFVWAp2g.text: Also forgot to mention they have an amazing Vegan menu which my sister loves! I've tried so many of their breakfast foods and loved them all but my absolute favorite is the southwest burrito with scramble browns or the stuffed strawberry french toast !

mXikCBo6JUlW74cJgUVFLQ.text: We came here for a late breakfast the other day. My boyfriend ordered the costa burrito which he enjoyed, but thought the chorizo was lacking a bit in the spice department. I ordered the Santa Fe eggs Benedict which was quite delicious. We each got a drink and our bill came to a little over $24. Seemed kind of steep for a place where you seat yourself.   We'll definitely give it another shot, because I really want to try one of their brizzas, but there are quite a few other breakfast joints I would want try first.

G4OX1S1UI9k34nmt32uxBQ.text: Always great service at the Phoenix location. I like when my name is remembered. My ex was always super picky because of her disorder...veganism...and they never had a problem accommodating her, even in the rush. Food was always on point. My favorite is the Santa Fe Benedict. Use the loyalty card for free stuff!

G-ie_w0mGu27f4TbTdNcNQ.text: The mushroom & bacon omelette was to die for! The hash browns were a little too done for my taste. The employees were extremely helpful. This was my second time at Scramble and it did not disappoint!

DgloZF8PlqCKXg6w03SLTA.text: I really enjoyed Scramble - their food was delicious, and service very friendly.  Their eggs are especially good (they live up to their name), and their smoothies were awesome (I had the banana peach.  There was a line, and the greeter said that it would be just a 10 minute wait to get to the counter, but he was being optimistic (it was closer to 15 - 20 minutes).  After we ordered at the counter, our food came out really quickly, which was great.  I was kind of looking forward to a mimosa, but then I remembered that the 7th Street location didn't service alcoholic drinks, but was just as well.  I hike North Mountain often, so this was a perfect location for me!

jlhRUsIyHOJIm5fbSVZNNw.text: I hesitate to give a good review, but only because I'm selfish and I don't want this amazing place to get overcrowded.  Located at the base of North Mountain, it is perfect for an after hike refueling.  The have a great,  pet friendly patio, the food is top notch (my favorites are the Costa breakfast burrito and the Chicago Brizza, breakfast-pizza).  It can get busy around 10-11, with a line out the door, but I have never waited more than 10 minutes to order.  Please just follow the rules and order before you get a table and everything works out.

lSAo-W8xROgkYWJkeQGSGw.text: I love places that open before 7AM.  I'm an early bird.
