Showed up at Scramble for the first time at 6:04 this morning to be greated by clean modern decor, and a friendly staff.  We tried the brizza (breafast pizza) with bacon and gouda, the gringo burrito, a cinnamon roll and coffee.    The portions are generous - not usually a selling point for me, but it more than justifies the price, which for the burrito is about double the price at a 'berto's (pick a 'berto, any 'berto).  The brizza was excellent.  I'm looking forward to the leftover half for lunch.  The gringo burrito was indeed gringo-y as advertised; fresh eggs, cripy bacon, lots of melted cheese.  Red salsa on the side (I wonder if they have green?) Not being a  melted cheddar fan, I'll have to ask them to hold that next time.  Cinnamon role was servicable - not crazy carbs-be-damned  good, but tasty.  I look forward to making use of the expanded patio.  Ergonomics report:  The benches are confortable!  How often does THAT happen??  Just the right height and depth to provide comfortable back support within reach of the table.  And the staff happily changed the TV channel from cartoons to CNN at our request.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brizza, burrito and cinnamon role
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scramble

v1CqsLy2C2OERGwaApHFsw.text: This restaurant is superb. The service is excellent, the eggs Benedict are made perfectly. The dog friendly patio is a bonus. And the atmosphere is very hospitable. The server even brought a banana for my baby. The prices are extremely reasonable. I recommend eating here as often as possible.

5_1w-BuwczY-H5cJazrexQ.text: Bright, cheery & welcoming atmosphere.  Loved the heatlthy options on the menu but today was a cheat day so we opted for the omeletes.  I had the bacon mushroom and the better half tried the California.  Both were fantastic!  Also tried the jalapeno cornbread it was good.  The GM, Lauren, took our order...her cheerful demeanor set the tone for our whole morning experience and Stacy our server capped the morning with fantastic and informative service.  Would definitely recommend Scramble for great service and great food.

spWdr4Ur_ngmGe8bwHgR-g.text: The Toluca and the Costa, probably the best breakfast concoctions I can think of.  The food here is awesome and the staff is always friendly.

uJev8mhNbCHwA44wnHAcsw.text: This was an excellent place to eat breakfast at. Amazing jalapeno eggs Benedict, new flavors I would have never expected.

4Fu4H8YrEm7duEl-I3q4Rg.text: Good food. Took a star off because of the table issue. When you have a line out the door and you don't seat guests (it's grab your own table style) have extra people to bus tables. Multiple dirty tables and no one cleaning them is frustrating. I will say this is usually a problem on weekends. Today Saturday they have certainly been making more of a effort.

R_7nmvus2H0EMYPc3TRrfg.text: Rating: 4.25 Stars. This place is legit. Tasty food in a casual, low-key atmosphere.  What I Liked: The Brizza (BReakfast pIZZA) was DELICIOUS! I'd go back just for one of those. Also tried the dollar pancakes (good! ...and a good value). Tasted the breakfast burrito (also good!). The inside was clean, and the staff was friendly.  Room For Improvement: I've only been here once, so I can't think of anything now....  Overall: I'm a fan. I wish they had a location in the East Valley; I think I'd be a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brizza
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dollar Pancakes
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front

j_F9gx1MaStWRzjT-GFWpg.text: We had just finished a hike and decided to grab some breakfast when we came across Scramble. The restaurant is definitely fast food style. You order at the counter but the staff does deliver to the table and cleans up the dishes for you?  Our group kept changing orders and asking for menu alternatives - the epitome of the difficult customers - and yet our cashier was patient and accommodating.  I had the Vegan Mushroom Scramble with sweet potato hash and a side of fruit in lieu of the bread (no additional charge). My brother got a bacon and cheese omelet with jalapeno cornbread. They also offer sides of pancakes instead of toast, if you like. The meal was delicious with plenty of options for everyone in the group to be happy.  I like that there are several vegan options on the menu. We just made closing and were the last customers to leave but we're not made to feel rushed at all. I will definitely make it back here whenever I'm in Phoenix.

6CgwKmJ3FGqqcy0k_AHWVw.text: I've only been here once, but I was very pleased with the whole experience.  I LOVE that they have fresh squeezed orange juice!  Everything was very fresh and tasty.  Can't wait to go back!

Gn-4KG1d9Nv2ooDs0bfDjw.text: Good healthy option in Phoenix.  Lots of vegan, vegetarian and healthy options.  It's a self-service place - you wait in line to put in your order, find a table, bring the number to your table and someone brings out your food to your table.  I had the vegan scramble with the sweet potato hash.  The vegan scramble was scrambled tofu with tumeric - it was DELICIOUS.  The sweet potato hash was a bit strange at first but very tasty.  Rosemary potatoes were also delicious.  And the whole wheat toast is great - not the generic supermarket quality but a good hearty bread.  The capuchino that I got for free for checking in on Foursquare was delicious (very strong). However, the one negative on this place is that their drip coffee is atrocious - I mean, it tasted like water.  Literally. I tried the Italian and the decaf and both were watery - no taste at all.  I hope that today it was just an off day, because given how tasty everything else is and the fact that they are a brunch place that coffee quality would be so poor.

Q3_00SaH_4pH5ttpkfAqJg.text: Great breakfast and a wonderful staff. I usually see familiar faces but even when I don't the friendliness is always there.

_S-QFodq-FDYmiWQB6AFqQ.text: We eat at Scramble about once per month.  There are not that many great breakfast joints in Phoenix compared to other pasts of the USA.  Scramble has a wide selection of menu.  They allow free self service  refills of coffee and sodas which is unique for breakfast places.  A great place compared to other choices in North Phoenix!  The food is also pretty healthy.

2m7fmagWth1GFOdlZ-SMhA.text: Love this local business! Love that its family and DOG friendly!!!!! The menu is very well priced and everything is top quality! I used to go to us egg down the street until I tried this place! better food and better prices. Place is modern and comfortable. Can get overly crowded with limited seating if its busy..  I always get the eggs Benedict or breakfast burrito!  Only slight negative is I never know what to tip cause they do clean up after us, bring us our food and check on us. but we order in line, get own drinks, napkins, jelly, etc.  Dont know if the 20 percent gratuity still applies or if if you should tip less since they do less work. I will usually just throw down normal 20 percent one time and half the next and so forth.

IQyZgryiMJYsiPb-YGPN-g.text: This is my go to breakfast joint in the area. I give this place 3 stars only because there isn't a wow factor and parking sucks on Saturdays or maybe it's because I am from the south and we have a different standard for breakfast. They have a solid biscuit and gravy. Overall good.

E1iFjdxuiX_AGCACw8UrWg.text: I decided to give this place 5 stars not because it's the best breakfast I've ever had, but their style and food really make it an overall nice experience.  We arrived on a Saturday morning and there was a small line at the door.  The place is big with plenty of tables so we probably waited less than 10 minutes.  Lots of open space, plenty of tables, TVs, seems really modern for a breakfast joint.  I ordered the breakfast burrito which was excellent.  Very unique and didn't depend on a lot of grease for flavor.  My sister got the Eggs Benedict which she also enjoyed.  Had this been a lunch place I would have given it 4 stars, but it just stood out as a unique place to me for breakfast.  Very good menu choices, friendly staff, easy parking, reasonably priced.  If you're looking for something different from the typical breakfast place then give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LV6IDjlp35CevVIedNvjZA.text: I had the vegan French toast and it came with a side of hash browns. It was pretty good. They have a pretty good menu for vegans/vegetarians and said everything could be made without meat.

KRZq1MRBD_QRwismEkgAdA.text: My gluten free eggs Benedict were delicious and we really loved the dog friendly outdoor seating. I also had a latte with almond milk and it was made right! Appreciated that the gal at the front counter double checked that I don't have celiac disease because of an ingredient in another dish we ordered. Great place, busy, but efficient service!

_9qUvraiAiBDn5AqwwMK7Q.text: Breakfasts for he unique palate. I love the new take on many of the traditional breakfast. The patio is on a street that is a little busy however if you overlook it, there is a beautiful view. Great service with a smile.

bZT3ozmI9ljSam-JEuBwVg.text: I love their breakfast food. The atmosphere is fun. I appreciate that they have vegan food.

Kzm8AkwWmjO9W9wgc0oABw.text: I like this place order at counter pay no tip get your food 5min latter the food was really good eggs were cook not to hard come with your chose of bread and had brown those suck just your frozen hash wife had the beef sandwich they was pretty good as well would of gave five stars but the portions are small for what you pay but will be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garden scramble
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garden scrambel

lh7M0NTOUzsG1HOUI-MLEw.text: This fast paced Uber clean and delicious eatery is a favorite of ours. Never be alarmed by their long lines. The pace is fast and efficient. The tables are kept clean and the food is outstanding.  Scramble, like The Point,  is a plus in Sunnyslope. My favorite is the Oatmeal loaded and the Lox Platter. The staff is accommodating if you need tables schmoozed together for larger parties.  Choosing Scramble over Starbucks will be a choice well made and make your friends happy. The crowd is diverse and the pleasure of good food in a great clean place is apparent in their demeanor.  You'll love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. In line waiting for the rest of our friends after church at #dreamCITYchurch
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8VR_I9ExDkGG_PXQ5Tt1Hg.text: Friendly staff and great food. I've NEVER had a negative experience there. The menu is posted to the wall and is very easy to read. I so love the coffee station too.

8NkVfxca5GINThUmmnGvOA.text: Great spot for some fresh breakfast food. Awesome vegan options and really good burritos.

p6yvTnDMOQ6dWOeDqd9OPw.text: April 16th is National Eggs Benedict day so guess what I had today? No not a brizza, I ordered Eggs Benedict, with crispy hash browns , no Canadian bacon,  with a side of crispy bacon, and a crispy muffin. I told the staff,  I wanted my yolks soft, runny. I said, "they always make the eggs hard" Eggs Benedict are supposed to be runny. My muffin was bareky toasted, I cut into the first egg, it was okay, not great. I cut into the second egg, not a runny yolk in sight. I took it back, personally, with a piece of bacon and crispy hash browns on my plate. 10 minutes later I got an uncooked English muffin after asking for a crispy muffin again, with a perfect Eggs Benedict. My hash browns disappeared off the plate they were missing. I hardly ever take myself out to breakfast but Eggs Benedict are my favorite and National Eggs Benedict day is something I do not intend to miss. But next time I'll be going elsewhere

iB4sLU2AL0tjTda32qyS5A.text: Our favorite spot! Either breakfast, brunch or lunch you can't beat it. Always fresh, clean and great food with an amazing staff!!  If you haven't been, make it a point to get to scramble! The scrambled browns, jalapeno Benedict with that amazing cornbread! The quinoa and baby kale salad, oh and the scramble latte are all favorites!  Love the local support and the selection of hot sauces too!!

qmPHGsDpSaxBKz2ATNFvRw.text: Went to scramble after our morning work out.  The ordering process is made at the counter not table service so look at the menu first .  Ordered eggs and turkey bacon with side of hash browns and French toast. Tasty food fast service and well worth the money.   Will be back here again for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Morning breakfast over ordered but well worth the food coma

yIT3anTIR5kEVm3GLoQYwQ.text: This place has a nice Vibe and feel to it. Very modern and contemporary. Arrived about 10 minutes prior to closing at 2 p.m. the counter front register girl tried to sway me into getting a burrito when I asked for a chorizo plate. Paige another employee was excellent.  She was bright, professional and helpful. The food was presented nicely but the hash browns were slightly undercooked. If it wasn't for the cash register girl and hash browns I would have given it a four star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ht-w67CKG0FqLBomBFRDoQ.text: I would come back for the Alarm clock frozen coffee drink. Approximately $5.99 when I bought it (11/10/17). I also had Gringo Burrito. Very good and filling. Couldn't finish it all. Came with hash browns which was a bit spicey. Sat outside with the Arizona Mountain View and free WiFi. I would come again when in Arizona in this area. Also given free cups for water which you can add lemon. Only reason not a five star because had to wait online to order but not a deterrent to come.

n5LETKmKGgOqOz6cRdqqQA.text: Ok it's good don't get me wrong but my biggest complaint is that the tofu used in the tofu scramble isn't organic which basically deems it inedible. I would happily pay $1 more (because let's face it organic tofu isn't much) for organic and peace of mind. The hash browns are yummy. The prices are very reasonable. Truly enjoy the fresh OJ. The coffee is good and I really enjoy the coffee station with all of the accessories. The wikki sticks for the kids are really fun and great for keeping those little hands occupied while waiting for the food to come. But I will not/cannot return until the tofu is organic.

mvN4zwL9bZulVQaigfH8qQ.text: The order taker was disinterested and kept messing up our order. The waitress that brought the food was also not very friendly.  However the menu had a great selection and the food was tasty. Decor was fine for a fast casual cafe. Location is in a strip mall.

Pute00G-OBC7BcAU9Q80ig.text: A must stop after hiking North Mountain. The portions are decent for the price but the quality of the food is outstanding.  You order at the counter and the line is often really long, but don't let that deter you. Once your order is placed, it's faster than most any other breakfast place.  Their coffee is fresh and so so good! I always sick with the huevos rancheros because it's gluten free and basically amazing, but more than half their menu can be adjusted to be gluten free.   The patio is dog friendly and they will bring disposable water dishes out to you which is awesome.

6nZUY-sQtrJFpr0vkbxztg.text: Pretty good! Great vegan options. But GOD DAMN they use a ton of plastic!! I can't justify going back there after seeing how much plastic they went through in just the hour I was there, I just can't do it. Sooooooo wasteful. I really don't understand how people can justify that.

GDviBR7xyO_Rn9YBnByu-w.text: Since we moved to the area my husband and I past Scrambled a few times and finally made it in.  Service is a bit different in that you order before you are seated so walking in to a long line is not unusual, but don't worry it's nothing to be alarmed about . It's  modern and sleek look made a nice atmosphere for our late Sunday brunch. It wasn't loud or chaotic, an enjoyable experience.   I got the French French toast which was delicious but the shining star on the plate was the scrambled browns my husband got. A combination of potatoes, bacon, Monterey Jack and cheddar ahh delicious!  The portion seriously needs to be bigger for that and will defiantly be on my plate next time we go.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The French French toast

9xV9oPSHs7gZCm4Wg9WSaA.text: My family and I have been going to scramble for almost 3 years now and I have yet to have an experience I did not enjoy. The food is absolutely amazing and the portions are family style in my opinion, maybe not the brizzas but definitely the griddle cakes (pancakes) and the biscuits and gravy. They even have a lunch menu for those who aren't a big fan of breakfast like paninis, salads, wraps and soup.  I ALWAYS get an orange juice because it's fresh squeezed! If you're an early bird or a fan of brunch then you have to try Scramble.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brizzas, griddle, classics and sides. This is 1 of the 4 menu screens

LI_dMaiYrzqRsVJBjqqoWg.text: I met a friend here for an early lunch. Didn't know what to expect. You order at the counter, then grab your own drink and they bring your food to you.   I remember it being a tad pricey for what you get, but nothing ridiculous. I ordered the egg pizza and I really liked it. Also a good size where I had a couple slices left over to munch on later.   Overall I enjoyed it and will probably go back soon.

y7hRyxtimG-x-zp3rClQIQ.text: Fast service; delicious food; and a wonderful patio. Plus, I got a free cinnamon roll for checking in on Foursquare. Their southwestern breakfast burrito was solid--chock full of super fresh avocado. I will definitely be returning.

ePIASZM2kmLxiKxOLviT3g.text: It's just breakfast. Eggs, Potatoes and Pancake Flour cost pennies not $9.00. Take $2.00 off every meal and stop overcharging.

Z7g9O69qanokwEHjMChsxw.text: I finally returned to Scramble because my family loves this place. I was literally missing time with my peeps, so I thought I should try it again. I am actually glad I came back. I ordered the chop salad with balsamic vinaigrette and an iced tea. The tea has always been excellent and the salad was good. Nothing extra special, but not terrible. I will return without kicking and screaming this time.

QIs_6wYzOgI_Bjt8CV62qg.text: I love going to Scramble because of their delicious vegan options, especially the french toast! I went there this morning and TYLER, one of the wait staff, was extremely helpful and considerate when my order wasn't quite right. Thank you for such great customer service!

1M7dFUuL1TRUAbfiRRshwQ.text: This restaurant is so cute! Very clean atmosphere.   I ordered the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict. It was one of the best nontraditional eggs benedict I've ever had. The jalapeno corn bread was so yummy! I didn't find it spicy at all. They substituted avocado for ham. The avocado was a little black, but still fine.   Very inexpensive. I will suggest this restaurant to all of my friends instead of the typical IHOP!

qZ3J0zgPHNUuFmLLxnI-DQ.text: Based on many positive reviews I decided to go there this weekend.  The costa burrito was incredibly greasy and one of the worst things I've ever tried. The gringo was ok. As others have mentioned the rosemary potatoes that were actually cooked were quite good. The cinnamon roll was very tasty so it was not a complete loss.  The staff was also very friendly.   The combination of subpar food and high prices will keep me from going back.

BzKy2urSI-1IR9C9yV3gMw.text: Excellent breakfast!!  Great food, best customer service, nice and relaxed atmosphere!!  Definitely a favorite of ours!!

LOs0X0pdYdavbJ227Dulfw.text: Food was awesome. Santa fe eggs Benedict and the southwest burrito. Awesome awesome awesome!

CQKi2LWibVqhjEDEoXKboA.text: Just stopped in the other day to try this place.  It was lunch time so I ordered the BLT with avocado.  My husband (who had the leftovers) agreed it was delicious.  This is big because my husband and I rarely agree on food.  The sandwich is made with thick, cherrywood bacon on toasted french bread,  I had a bowl of the tomato florentine soup, which I didn't care for.  I will be back to try their breakfasts.  A friend of mine tried the pizza scramble and loved it.

LbwawYxnEjN0jRp93cNmvQ.text: So I came to Phoenix to visit my family for Mothers Day. My family originally wanted IHOP, but I told them I wanted to try something new. They suggested that we go to Black Bear Diner, but they were closed. So I went on Yelp and suggested Scramble. I'm glad I did.  I tried the French Toast(delicious!) and sampled some of the other fare off of peoples plates. The pancakes were a bit rubbery, but the service, ambiance and other good food made up for the shortcoming.  I definitely recommend it.  Everyone else in our 10+ party enjoyed their food and said they'd probably come back.  It's in a kinda weird area for me, since growing up here that particular area was referred to as the "ghetto". But it seems to have changed in the 10+ years I've been gone. The decor is Ikea-like, but comfortable. They have seating inside and out (if you can stand the heat!). They also have 'misters' outside.

ackrIL_MdK4OINAO8QjStQ.text: I lived in the apartments right next door to Scramble and went there every morning for coffee.  Not only is their coffee delicious, but their food is AWESOME.  The staff is young and hipster-ish, but very nice.  Never had any problems with service or food.  The coffee is a little pricey IMO ($2.61 for a cup) but other than that, this is one of the best breakfast places around!

1550vbDvmd5RdbvA3WOiXg.text: Does this count as an update?  Went four more times..still love it!

C-V22NxVCug9Cifq4zdW-g.text: The food is so yummy here. The decor is great and everyone is very friendly. Casual atmosphere, great place to go for breakfast or lunch. I highly recommend it after a good hike on North Mountain!

BwJVGXhIMrkZ99rjKQ9dvA.text: I love, love Scramble! I don't know what it is about the place! Is it the sleek and simple decor? Hmm, is it the friendly, attentive service? Is it the supa yum food? Perhaps all of the above make me a fan of this joint!   I so love Scramble ( Did I say that already?). On my first visit, I was with Mr. Hottie and we were Harley geared out . The staff didn't bat an eyelash at our rough appearances. They were warm and welcoming. I had the traditional eggs Benedict. I thought it was very good! I washed it down with a cup of coffee and was ready to tackle the rest of my day!   On my second visit I had the biscuits and gravy. WHAT a huge portion! I wasn't terribly impressed by the dish, however. I guess I expected a little more flavoring in the gravy, but overall, the dish was satisfying.   My third visit had me munching on the spicy and tasty chorizo and egg burro with extra avocado. Mmm... I couldn't eat the whole burro. I ate almost half of it and took the rest home.   Each time I visit Scramble I am impressed by the staff. There is a person on the floor at all times checking on people and making sure their food is ok. Considering this is a walk up and order type of place, it's a nice change to not be forgotten after you receive your food.   I know that Scramble will be a regular breakfast stop for me. It's nice to see such a great place take a chance on Sunnyslope. I think they'll come out winners!

lz22BNqGz1PWLYUnGIidlA.text: I  know I will be going back to Scramble.. I can definitely see this becoming one of my go to places to meet friends, or get breakfast on way across town or just to treat the family on the weekend..   After the recent UYE here for Foster Kids ( A group I hold especially dear)  I really can't wait to take others here..  Scramble could be  a great place in my list of restaurants because of a few reasons ..  1. Located on 7th street  near many of my friends  who live in Central Phoenix or Moon Valley  -great for the girls to eat before going on a day outing   2.Food is served with a walk up line and  served fast ..that means not fussing with waiter, or  waiting for service and you eat good but quick  3. The food is tasty  , while maybe not rich  or decadent or over the top the food is great tasting  but without leaving you feeling like you need a nap. Food quality is good , it taste like they just made it in Grandmas kitchen without adding a lot of grease.   4. It's got that modern coolness thing  going on ...Atmosphere does say something specially when you are meeting friends...   Thanks Scramble for your unique niche in my mental list of places to eat breakfast....  now if you only served Brinner every night!

DAVylzHJDMiRliB_gWqQEA.text: sorry...just cannot gush over a breakfast, something I can easily make at home.  Place is nice, waits were not interminable but it seemed longer than average breakfast wait for food.  Eggs, we're talking about eggs...either you make them right or you don't. Heck, I've done just as well at Waffle House for much less.  Anyone who gives this (or any) breakfast place 5 stars must be seriously cooking challenged.

52n6J_9wJSGoID7D0hYzFg.text: Scramble is wonderful!   It is set up much like Pei Wei in the sense that you walk in order your food get your drinks and a number and go sit down until your food is delivered.  There is a lot of light that get's in through all of the windows; that along with the coffee help to wake you up.  It is one of those places that you feel like going up and asking for one of everything because you can't decide, but when I made up my mind I had the Southwest Breakfast Burrito that has chorizo, avocado, eggs and jalapeno cream cheese "YUM"      I really enjoyed this place and wish there were more around town, although I would still go to this location because it would be closest to the house.  :)

Hm8Sjuffln1M3M0j8RlR6g.text: This isn't a chain, is it? It feels like a chain... it tastes like a chain... the food is just too prefab. Prefab is OK for cheap housing and fast food, but not for a place that charges about $10- $12 per person for breakfast.   Food is OK... nothing special. They have a well rounded menu with lots of options, but none are so special or so delicious that I would write home about it.   For me, it's close, convenient and fast... other than that, I would choose someplace else.

ffpl77XGLaqlravUTJZvEg.text: A-OK...but nothing that jumps out and says "man-o-man do you have ot get your ass back here" (except maybe the badass Rosie the Riveter tattoo one of the servers had).  I had hte veggie omelette with biscuits and bacon hashbrowns. I don't want to sound as though I didn't enjoy it...I did...but I felt like something was missing, some amazing piece of the puzzle.  Scramble is one of those places that could probably be my go-to spot if they just had one menu item (preferrably a side) that stood out and that you couldn't get anywhere else. If this item exists and I missed it please someone fill me in...  You order at the front counter and pay then they bring it out to you. This is kindof a saving grace if you are in a hurry. For instance if you were out too late bowling and drinking and crashed on Amber W's couch and probably should be at work already but there is no way you are going without breakfast and since you managed to leave your debit card at the bowling alley Amber W offers to buy you breakfast....because this happens sometimes.

SOldF4H5JhWbRvElOlHT1Q.text: Amazing breakfast. I' not from the area but man if I were I would be here every weekend! Had to add a side of the sausage gravy to my plate...wow I'm glad I did. They had great options and were very accommodating for our 2 year old as well! Love you scramble!

3WhNssRT47ZOWg-4imU0OA.text: First time to go here. I recommend the vegan scramble (even though I'm not vegan) and the side of pancakes. Everything tasted great, definitely hit the spot. The scramble needed just a  little salt, but of course that's just a personal preference. Atmosphere was inviting and, there's a little patio to sit outside on if you so desire.

EDDt91usFENhwZaQ-qESZA.text: Great place for breakfast!  The food is consistently great and the service is FANTASTIC!!!

uPa2iS8uKPCB7Uj2hH_qfQ.text: This place has amazing food-  friendly employees-clean restaurant- and reasonably priced. What more could u ask for?! Oh and parking is not an issue  : )

LJb8SXxZ0RQmj-j_leG2aA.text: Can't decide which Brizza is my favorite! Love this place. There is always a line out the door but its just a testament to how fun and great this place is and it generally moves pretty quickly. Love Scramble!

Oe3GeWgo-3ho4pBQG59LTw.text: Usually when the cashier informs you the menu is out of date it means what you wanted to order is no longer available or the price went up.  Not so this time, they are still in the mode of adjusting to initial customer comments and the $9 omelet now includes one side AND a bread.  That brings the price point in line with what I consider a regular breakfast choice instead of a special occasion breakfast.  None of that would matter if the food wasn't good.  I had the western omelet with english muffin and bacon.  The bacon is cherry wood smoked and a perfect firm but not crispy.  The omelet had ham, peppers and grilled onions.  And the muffin came with real butter.  I almost forgot to take a picture before I dug in.  All of the food and coffee was good.  I got there at 6:01 and was greeted with a smile.  She did admit she has to work at being a morning person.  I had the entire place to myself until just before I left.  My food was out very quickly.  Thanks to Donny T's review I remembered to grab my table service before the food arrived.  I even found the place headed south without becoming a traffic hazard.  Scramble shares the building with Il Posto.  At the time of the morning I am about it isn't hard to get there and get to work.  Even though it is a ways away I am sure I will find my way back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LoxJg69_tl2qe1jAUVa25w.text: Scramble was delicious! We had the Santa Fe Benedict and the Costa Burrito. The eggs on the Benedict came out hard boiled so I took the plate back up to the counter. They had a fresh one out to me a short while later and it was excellent. The Costa burrito was a bit on the greasy side, but such is the nature of chorizo. The flavor was great and the potatoes it was served with were also decent. I would highly recommend also getting a side of the scramble browns. You won't be disappointed.   The patio has an excellent view of the mountains, so if you're ever in the Sunnyslope area and are in need of breakfast/brunch, Scramble is worth checking out.

Yh-p9sJxouVPoup5Yc3mTA.text: Great food and service and all for a reasonable price. I love the eggs Benedict one of my favorite. Need I say more?

fOe_R95P3QrFADs-r4Kovg.text: Found this place today thanks to Yelp. We were looking for a good breakfast place with variety and quality. This is the place! Large menu with all sorts of items from breakfast burritos to eggs benedict, to pancakes and French toast.  Their food is high-quality and they source their breads, vegetables and meats locally.  The only disappointment was the biscuits and gravy and cinnamon roll. Both were dry and cold. The cinnamon roll had frosting on top but it did not even melt as there was no heat from the roll to melt it. And the biscuits and gravy was dense, cold, and not as flavorful as I had hoped. . Definitely looking forward to coming back again though!  UPDATE: Gave this place another chance today. The cinnamon roll that I had today was perfect! Lots of flavor and nice and warm. However, I am still not a big fan of the biscuits and gravy. There is nothing wrong with them. It is just my personal taste. The gravy is quite thick and he biscuit is dense. Again, just a personal opinion. I did try the flatbread breakfast pizza today though. That was fantastic! A new breakfast favorite!

XdyJO-7pQbcYzzzhjhr4VA.text: Always enjoy going here for a Saturday or Sunday breakfast.  Relaxed atmosphere and delicious food.  Quick service and friendly employees.  Will be going back again!  Brizzas are great!

PgvtyXMcrSRtCk7OPz_Upg.text: Since my last review, I have been back to Scramble a couple times. I must say, the Brizza just hasn't been as good as the first time. It has been dry and kind of bland...just not that good. The Husband got the vegan french toast and seemed to like that since he is allergic to eggs and this was the only french toast he could eat. We have been with friends and they also thought it was just ok. I am hoping it gets back to where it was, but, as of this post, I can't see myself coming here again soon.

x8BA-sq5yxlkbNDNLPdBvQ.text: The line moved fast and the food was well worth the wait. This restaurant earns its line out the door! Destiny is a great asset, she recommended  the Costa burrito with gouda cheese and it was by far the best breakfast burrito I have ever had. The prices were right...whole staff was friendly. Take my word for it...if you haven't tried it yet, please do...you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The look of two content (and stuffed) people after Sunday breakfast

uGOrYCAhRYZaHG_1BCmWuA.text: Scramble holds a special place in my heart as it is the first restaurant I visited on my first trip to Phoenix. Three years later I live hear and very happy to be so close to such a great breakfast joint!

tIQ0mUxG7XND-aqohYeFIQ.text: Took my big bro here when he came for a visit and he loved it as much as I did. As an added bonus, the owner gave me a $10 gift card! How awesome is that?! I am definitely hooked on this place for breakfast AND lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken BLT panini. Yummy!

8soeEziSLpNi44HafC2zAw.text: Good service and consistently good food. We try to stop by every time we are on that side of town. We miss eating here. Wish there was one in Avondale!

_JgrZpnvyWg2SbGwL0cazg.text: I really enjoyed breakfast.  Just moved into the neighborhood and glad I tried it.  Great selection, clean, great service and best of all Vegetarian/vegan selection!

MC3grWaHEulNhOwVwvNW4A.text: Scramble has a really cute layout and color scheme like all the other breakfast joints:  Very clean and hip I had the impression that it was a sit down restaurant but it's an order and seat yourself sort of deal... It got a little bit packed and was kinda hard to find a seat but we managed to find one...  I got a coffee, the breakfast blend... And the Costa breakfast burrito which came with potatoes The burrito itself was really good and flavorful I didn't like the potatoes, so I just let them sit there  The service was a little slow but not a big deal at all, I'm very patient and I saw how busy it was All of the girls working were very friendly and cute It was a good first experience and maybe next time I will try the breakfast pizza

dkuWU_35O5kHRdjVcUzcVQ.text: This place is great! My husband, toddler and I went twice when we were on vacation in the area. The food is fresh and there are lots of substitution options (try the sweet potato hash instead of hash browns - delicious!). You order at the counter, but there is plenty of seating, so it ends up being a great combination of fast food and sit-down service. Plus the patio is dog-friendly! Highly recommend.

-No_5_2mOkVB9G2SP6Xm3w.text: Eggs Benny...yummmmy!  I had never been there before and it was much needed after a night of excessive drinking!  I love the set up...you stand in line to order and then find your seat.  We found a few seats and the bar against the window and bellied up.  Loved the homestyle potatoes as well.   Looking forward to going back and trying the brizza...breakfast pizza!

3b_M-gj0Ff7SSgCX5KmUbQ.text: great little spot, dog friendly patio which is cool, but if you come alone with your pup, make sure they are calm enough to sit out there by themselves while you go inside to order.... I wasn't a fan on the sweet potato hash, but I'm picky and it had too much veggies going on for my liking, but my eggs were cooked how I like, and everything came out perfect. Will be back for pre dog park breakfasts :)

0pXtijSkizSSwIY75jfJfA.text: I ended up going to this restaurant after finding that Timo's was closed.  The food is great for what it is.  It is set up like a cross between a cafeteria and a diner.....not my usual choice for eating.  When you walk in your hearded down a narrow walk where you are lead to a register.  You order your food and get your utensils, drinks, condements, napkins,....pretty much everything yourself.  I"m a restaurant snob so they lost points for that but it may not be a concern for you.  The food was good, nothing to write home about.  Service was friendly and polite.  If you are going to be meeting people, don't pick this restaurant.  There is NO WHERE TO WAIT for people, not even a bench out side and you can't sit until you order.

WZtxWReWDCLVcrEBE_yOtQ.text: Really good breakfast place. I had the western scramble. It was really good and filling. The restaurant was very modern looking and the staff was awesome and friendly.

wpMoNGbS5wrZzYoFCkLNQg.text: Stayed at nearby hilton and wanted a decent breakfast and found scramble close by. The line was out the door but the cafe relatively empty as you order then sit down. very nice fellow outside offering cups of oj and coffee.  The staff was uber friendly but points docked for atmosphere.  Super industrial cafeteria style. Ordered a cappuccino and they only come in 16 ounce cups? They don't have any other size or anything but disposable cups.. Bit wasteful. Eggs Benedict came with  under cooked cooked sad hash browns and pancakes ok.. Syrup not the real maple deal which seems weird for a place claiming to be local and farm fresh. I see that claim so often these days and not sure everyone is sincere about that.  We like to seek out restaurants serving local ingredients and There was nothing really convincing us they were doing so despite the claims on the menu.  Folks who worked there though were really great though and prices really reasonable.

Eu4XoQU-NU5o_H7KUCgYyg.text: Best hash browns I have had!  What a fun breakfast "joint"  Hip clean interior friendly staff, and food that is just tasty.  Prices aren't bad and the environment is great, highly recommended.

duu1q32LJ5VGV3LjbiXvuw.text: I ate at Scramble last Friday and I have to say that it was a horrible experience.  What attracted me to this place was the separate vegan menu in addition to their regular menu - this makes things easier when dining with vegan and non-vegan friends.  So I happily ordered a tofu wrap and added fried potatoes as a side and awaited my food.  We started eating and my friend found a hair in his food...not good!  He threw it on the floor and tried to drop it.  Well moments later I found a hair in my food...  I couldn't believe there was hair on both of our plates!  I was so disgusted I could no longer eat my food (and I was ravenous).  I told the girl working the register about the whole ordeal, she walked back to the kitchen then back to the register and completely ignored me (she said she'd come back to my table).  Before we left I spoke with someone else and showed them the hair, clearly not one of mine.  All I got was "Oh, I'll check the guys in the back."  Check the guys in the back???  What?  How about, sorry may I refund you your money?  Additionally, the few bites I had of my burrito were pretty bland, it needed seasoning or hot sauce.  Overall, I wouldn't go back...unless I somehow develop a taste for hair, although I'm sure that won't happen.  I did take a picture of my food before I attempted eating it and if you zoom in enough you can see part of the hair sticking out of my food - I'll be posting them.

SVJ3a0GWWeJKffpCxCYXWA.text: This was good food.  This is fast good food, You wait in line place your order. go find a table get your own coffee and your food arrives in about 5 minutes.  There is outside seating and you can bring your fuzzy butt  along.   I prefer a more cozy place. I like the personal service and refills on coffee.  For this type of place there is not problem.  Just not my cup of coffee.  By the way they have three types.

tdf6gzZS-SkgV9FNgzYORw.text: Craving french toast?  Look no further!  Tasty french toast with butter and maple syrup..what else do you really need!   We had the french toast, roasted potatoes, and the sausage and gravy  with biscuits..all was tasty.  Sweet vanilla dipped french toast..I gobbled it up and could have had another plate.  The gravy was very thick and full of sausage..and kind of spicy.  The biscuits didn't really look like biscuits more like rolls.  Scramble seems to get really busy on the weekends!  Long lines to wait to order and then you have to find a place to eat. We would've sat outside however, the tables were wet.   The staff was really friendly and definitely were helpful in clearing tables to get the next group seated.  However, we had a family who just kept coming and asking us to move over, very annoying.  One of the daughters almost sat on my friend's purse and was not even apologetic for doing so, and then another person came and asked us to move again.  We just ended up leaving because they were annoying for sure and I was just thinking they would have another 3 family members wanting to sit next to them and it doesnt make the best experience for other guests.  So I think somehow, Scramble needs to figure out how to manage large groups, because it was very annoying.  We would've left a tip for the girls but was just annoyed that we left since it felt like we were getting kicked out.  So , go over the week, to avoid these family groups.     Scramble , I will be back but just not the weekends, I don't want to keep moving around while I'm trying to enjoy your  tasty french toast!

pFG7qt9eWOxZxVCL9q509g.text: Great place for breakfast, however, I have not tried their lunches.  They offer gluten-free and healthy choices.  My only comment is the chorizo was not very warm but other than that the meal was awesome.  The decor is light and fun.

sISVEuvdxAKfTce97YbWcA.text: I brought my mother-in-law for the first time today, and Stacy was absolutely fantastic. Everything was delicious and the service was amazing. We will be going here a lot more often.

852swRKcVyTn8mmIwSbZYw.text: Was disappointed with our meal at Scramble this time. We have eaten here before and it was fine. Not great but acceptable. My over medium eggs were really over easy (don't like runny egg whites). I asked for fruit instead of toast and got a fruit cup of cantaloupe and two grapes. Eh. They do have good vegan selections, so next time we have vegan guests I may give them another shot...but not too soon.

66zIqQ1KUTca4apk8J-vEw.text: Concept, food, service, ambiance: all terrific! As a born and raised Southerner, I particularly admired the biscuits (and the manager Lorraine kindly offered me a tip for my own!) I'll be back at every opportunity.

MRiLDJw72-wIl4GBnMf-oQ.text: We arrive very late to meet some very important friends.  I'm looking forward to sitting down, being greeted by fresh-faced wait-staff, and given a chance to peruse the breakfast offering while sipping my piping hot cup of joe.  Smell the joe...deep breaths...choices...ah...I love the smell of choices in the morning.  Dreams...dashed...  I walk in and suddenly there's a line, nay, a chute, toward a counter.  Where is the menu?  Oh, it's on the wall.  Are we at Pei Wei?  At least I already know what I want when I'm at Pei Wei.  This Scramble is new and it's breakfast!  I have to slowly consider how each offering might be experienced across my palate.  But there's no time--no time!  The line is getting shorter!  Closer to the counter!  Aah!  Um, okay...I'll go with the...uh, oh God, what if I make the wrong decision?  Aah!  It doesn't matter.  More hungry patrons breathe down my neck as the end of the line looms closer.  Breakfast Sandwich!  Or sammy, or something like that.  Juice?  Yes, sure (there's so much pressure!) Coffee?  No.  Wait, what?  Did I just say no to coffee?  Aah!  She's giving me a number--what's this for?  No time!  Keep moving!  Go sit down!  What's that over there?  Where is the silverware?  So much stress!  And now I have no coffee.  Should I go re-enter the chute to ask for coffee?  No, I can't put myself through that again.  God, I wish I had coffee.  This is taking a while.  Oh, look, they've brought our food.  Potatoes!  Wait...these are...wet?  I thought it said something about rosemary?  Haven't these people ever eaten at Matt's?  Now that's a good rosemary country potato.    I wish we had gone to Matt's.  Wait...didn't this used to be Le Peep?

EZlNhfCEtPkCxZc9SfOaVw.text: If you live more on the west side, this breakfast nook off 7th street is pretty good. I've been here a few times and everything is always good. The prices are a teensy bit too high for me, but not by much. The pancakes/french toast are delish (ask for the blueberry sauce) and the omelets and sausages are excellent too. Scramble is great place to try once and awhile but I wouldn't make it my everyday spot.

YakQcHU38q3xeiE2PGk4-g.text: This place was a great find for breakfast! The food was so delicious.  I had a southwest burrito and my boyfriend had the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict, we shared a brizza (breakfast pizza) - The Toluca.  Everything, including the coffee, was fantastic.  The staff was super friendly.  The restaurant is cool, clean, and roomy.  The egg-inspired artwork was super cute! I was in Phoenix for a business trip and this was a recommendation by the hotel staff - 100% spot on! I can't wait to get back to Phoenix.

w8htgRDjnjGH3whSccldmA.text: Scramble = awesome in my book. Met a friend for brunch one day and ordered the Santa Fe Eggs Benedict. I am a huge Benedict fan and am always in search of the newest most original best eggs Benedict and for right now, Scramble serves it. The Santa Fe eggs Benedict features jalapeno cornbread, ham, poached eggs and chipotle hollendaise. Whoever thought to use jalapeno cornbread (they are more like sweet corn cakes) is a fricken genius! The sweetness of the cornbread/ cake cuts through the saltiness of the ham and then there is a slight spiciness from the hollendaise. So many flavors going around in your mouth!!! Absolutely spectacular. It came with country potatoes which were decent but I liked eating them with the Benedict, together, as one   :)    Scramble is now one of my breakfast spots due to this one eggs Benedict which is the only thing I have tried there. I like the walk up order concept and the modern simple atmosphere works perfectly fine for me. They also allow dogs on the patio which gets me kinda excited to bring one of my little ones (dogs) here! The one bummer is that it is pretty far away from me. The drive from Maricopa out to Squaw Peak which is kinda the general area is about an hour. However, that wont stop me from coming back!

KVJZpjr2KUtjnMMHHt9njw.text: I love that I can get a Tofu Scramble here! I don't eat eggs and it's a great protein substitute for those trying to make healthy choices!

lGfTH1DB2cB6ukqjKBnGXg.text: We came to Phoenix for 5 days and came to Scramble 2 times. I didn't love my food, but that was because I ordered wrong. My kids got the chicken panini, that came with applewood smoked bacon, creamy boursin cheese,

aSqYzcJfXSHz9hgD0tAVWw.text: I decided to go out on a limb and give scramble another chance. after my bland experience with them the first time, but my akin likeness for modernized breakfast joints drew me back.   I brought a book and some paper to read and take notes for homework and arrived backpack in hand, and hungry for a hearty breakfast. southwestern breakfast burrito sounds delicious, chorizo, eggs, and jalepeno cream cheese?! I'll take it.  disappointed with the meaty-cheesy hashbrowns from last time, I went with the rosemary potatoes as suggested to me by the owner regarding my last yelp review. counter girl informs me sorry, we're out of rosemary potatoes. shock, gasp, awe. went for their signature hashbrowns again, reluctantly. regular coffee. $14.50. my jaw nearly hit the floor. scramble could stand to reduce their prices a little.   my order arrived about ten minutes later, almost too hot to dig in at first. i sat at the window on a stool, which was quite comfortable, and enjoyed the rainy morning. dug into the hashbrowns first, drizzled with some cholula. they were a lot better than last time, and i enjoyed every last bite of them. as for the burrito, i tried it at first without the jalepeno cream cheese, salsa, or sour cream, because they all came on the side. what was, for one bite, a seemingly bland breakfast burrito, became a spicy breakfast sensation with all of the aforementioned sides spread across it.   it began to get loud in there, and people everywhere i go seem to have this habit of sitting next to me with their talkative and annoying children when they can see I'm clearly engaged in an intellectually stimulating activity that stands to be disrupted abruptly by your obnoxious toddler. the place is huge, and there are plenty of open seats and cartoons tuned on their abundant flat screen tvs. i left after about 10 minutes of attempting to tolerate messy loud children, and enjoyed a smoke out on their large patio.  overall, a better dining experience, but a little expensive for my college student budget. the wait staff was friendly, and the place is filled with cute girls to make you blush. i would love to see more combination plates, like how with the omelette comes with a choice of two sides. it would be awesome to get pancakes, bacon, and eggs altogether for a set [lower] price than ordering everything a-la-carte. at least, that's how I prefer my breakfast: hearty.

yt72dtWUuVHsJRreoChgxw.text: I invented that awesome Brizza with the gravy and potato!  I love Scramble and their food is top notch.  I used to be a manager here and I can tell you that they use amazingly fresh food and they truly care about freshness and quality.  The food will be consistent and tasty every visit you have.

fUAjZYVtTda8FwiqTze-Hw.text: I had just finished a workout and I wanted something healthy.  I passed by Starbucks and all of the other "breakfast" places and nothing really seemed to interest me until I saw Scramble.  I had eaten there once before a couple of years ago, but I had forgotten all about it.  This time, it seemed like going to a whole new place.  The price was very reasonable and the service was fantastic! All of the servers did an excellent job making sure that I had everything I needed.  I ordered the southwest breakfast burrito (I think that was the name) and I substituted the chorizo with bacon, and had them add mushrooms instead of the jalepeno cream cheese.  It was excellent and more than enough food.  I took home half of it in a to-go box.  I would recommend to anyone who wants a good breakfast menu with very tasty healthy items.  I can't wait to go back!

nBKIvEimHBI6tXWBIVP5aw.text: I have eaten at Scramble several times, and each time was a great experience. The atmosphere is bright and cheery, the servers are warm and friendly, and the food is tasty and interesting. I have found the perfect spot to sit so I can watch 6 televisions at once.

nCDT7Ghf0MrJ4x8IV3i1lQ.text: First time here - and let me tell you, a whole debacle started over just that.   Upon walk-up, there was a greeter at the door who, as we reached for the door handle and pulled it ajar, asked us if we were "new here" in which we told her we were. Then she proceeded into a lengthy, very rehearsed explanation at how the inside set up was going to work, all the while other guests were approaching the entrance too - including one a-hole who just squeezed in passed us as if I was holding the door open for him and after I called him out he said "Well?! Im not new here!". I barely could pay attention to her monologue while all of these other people passed us at the door, and finally we just thanked her barely comprehending what she had just said and went in to line up. This whole set up already gave us anxiety.   Now we get to the cramped line at the door where you look at menu panels as you walk further in. To me, this isn't exactly the ideal set up as one can't see the entire menu to decide, you have to read them as you walk further in and people move out of your way. So far I am not getting the concept here. Like, I do get it, but I don't get it. It's a breakfast house, not a factory line. I don't like feeling I am being processed through a system when I go to eat.   We ordered the Meat Lovers Scramble and the gringo Burrito. We thought the prices seemed a little much for it being a quick-order-and-eat breakfast place, but it has great reviews, so...  Yeah, the Meat Lovers, not so meaty. It was scrambled eggs and bacon and ham. Now that I look back at the menu, I realize it says here sausage too, ours had no sausage. It wasn't a very large portion, and having some limp, soggy hash browns aside and then wheat toast - we were recounting trips to IHOP being more satisfied with a similar order. And for $8.29? It's not to be mean, it's just True. My boyfriend was still hungry after this so I shared some of mine.   The Gringo Burrito was really good. I would eat that again. I didn't expect much from scrambled eggs and bacon in a tortilla, but it was tasty. I feel like it needed the salsa and sour cream it came with sides of, but it was good. Realistically though, I could just make it at home. Hash browns, again, I've had a lot better (even at Denny's). That's a shame because good hash browns can save a boring breakfast dish.   We saw someone going around and asking the tables how they were doing and if and what they liked, but no one came to our table or we would have shared. Oh well, looks like a lot of people love it here so to each their own, eh?!

A5lHQhEHnrHbdb9MuQcDEg.text: This was my first time eating here... Was wanting breakfast and I found this little gem... I love the outdoor patio... The traffic does get alittle loud.. But I love the view of the mountains. The two eggs anyway was cooked just like how I love it! The hash drown was crisp and fresh! The bacons... OMG to die for! I'll definitely be coming back with the boyfriend!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love this place!!

kcKhKNmOJMWXWK1B1cG8_Q.text: Ingenious setup! Delicious quality breakfast, friendly and attentive service, and impeccable turn around time without feeling rushed.   My husband and I split the following and recommend them both. Everything was high quality,  so delicious, we finished every last bite!   Toluca brizza: Chorizo, bell peppers, Monterey jack, topped w/jalapeno cream cheese.   2 eggs any way: Eggs cooked to perfection, potatoes were scrumptious, and the toast was delicious

J__HdoERpgb3M3F-rjAk3A.text: Really liked this place. First of all, neat and clean! I could stop right there and you'd win most of the time, but there is so much more to this place than the concept and upkeep.  It's a unique concept, that actually makes your breakfast experience quick if you want it to be...or you relax and enjoy the free wifi. You enter to the order counter, then are waited on by the staff. Sometimes I hate HATE this method, but they have actually made it work really well - a big part of that is the sharp staff.  I ordered the berry pancakes, and turkey sausage...must say excellent food, and excellent turkey sausage patties. I might recommend syrup/jelly caddies on the tables, I'm just not a huge fan of predetermined portion cups as I'm definitely more liberal with my syrup.  Overall, great place. Very solid menu, with great food quality - and "ready to serve" staff.  Thank You!

fn6xc6RaUMJnETx6kLQkgQ.text: I have been going to this Scramble since they opened. I have always loved the food and the people. For the last three years I have been eating a bit more healthy so I usually get an omelette with some cottage cheese. The price is a bit higher than most of the breakfast places around town but the portion size was good and so was the taste. Sadly, Scramble has committed the biggest sin a restaurant can commit. THEY SHRUNK THE FOOD!! Now, the price is still a bit higher but the omelette is about HALF the size it used to be. This to me is completely unforgivable. Black Bear diner did the same thing several months ago and I have not been back since.       This will be my last time eating at Scramble. It's sad, my mother and I used to eat here almost every weekend. Now that she has passed I don't get here as much. In fact, I haven't been in for about a year. But it's still nice to be able to come in and have a nice breakfast. To bad they ruined that for me. Stop being greedy people. A good value for a good price. That's what keeps people coming back. Which is something I will no longer do.

XMUx-Ti-F4eexn2JEtbTjQ.text: This one of our all time favorite brunch spots! There are plenty of choices for vegans and lacto-ovo veggies! It is not quiet, so don't come expecting to work, read, or write unless you bring noise reduction headphones. The food is fabulous. The staff is super perky and friendly.

d_uywoTzGXianw09nwfPeA.text: This place has gone down hill. My friend and I used to love coming to this place and sad thing is we probably won't return. The food and service has gone away. The food is leftovers and cold. Last couple times my hash browns were either over cooked or under cooked but cold you can tell they were sitting there since early that morning. The prices remain the same but the portions get smaller and smaller every time we go. The oj cups are 3/4 filled for $3. Sad to say but I'll stick to other breakfast joints from here on out.

gh6ybujA3Mil7bjo6cxTrA.text: I like the concept and I would choose this place  over I-Hop, but I'm not sure if it's worth the trip.  I've been wanting to try this place and woke up late this morning, so I hopped in my car and drove all the way to North Phoenix. Scramble is a  quick-serve breakfast place  where you order at the counter, find a table and wait for a server to bring your food (similar to SAUCE).   The decor is modern, spacious and funky and the place  seems very clean. I noticed that the employees were constantly wiping down counters and tables which is good.  On the food, I ordered the vegetarian omelette with sourdough toast and roasted potatoes.  Although it was good, I think I should have stayed at home and made my own breakfast.   Just seems odd for a vegetarian omelette to have so few vegetables. It looked more like scrambled eggs sprinkled with chopped herbs.   Other than that, it was good. I give them extra star for supporting local businesses, cleanliness and hosting charity events.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Herb Omelette

ho3H9huG-Beh6Hb7bSPtBg.text: Came back to scramble today, was greeted with a friendly hello and a warm cup of coffee to start off.i ordered the Santa fe poached perfectly with some good cornbread style stuff instead of a English muffin.great locally owned place that offers local produce, I will be back very soon

6Ao1YqGP5td1-2p3A77Yhw.text: Very interesting place along with an interesting menu breakfast pizza WOW , was greeted by a very friendly and happy cashier/server , give me a quick rundown  enjoyed the ambience also my breakfast burrito was on point, other then the location, being as it's a few blocks away from one of the worst neighborhoods in Arizona "Sunnyslope" I give the place five stars and will be returning to try the breakfastpizza..

baDvfpSFf_J3r8xo3cdfsg.text: Has a great patio that is pet friendly! Bonus points! You do have to order inside and they bring your food to you, but it is breakfast done right. Had a craving for eggs Benedict and it delivers on flavor. Hubby went with his standard omelet. Loved the hash browns they were perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. Winner all around!

0d2QUQHpU3vVQyKl1rKr1A.text: Found this place after playing golf.. What a gold mind. I was a little thrown off by then line, but it goes fast. I think I changed my mind about 3 times before settling with the meat lovers scramble. So good !!!! The location is clean and cool. The patio out side is dog friendly (great) and non smoking (even better) they offer wifi for all the tech nerds like myself. Check in got me a free cup of coffee.  Once we the gentleman took our order in the front he repeated it to make sure it was right. I hate getting the wrong food, especially when I'm starving. It was busy for a Sunday so I excepted to wait a while for the food. No even, food came out quick and hot !! And oh man was it good. Constant check ins with the sounding staff to ensure everything was great. I can definitely say I was impressed with this place.  Bathrooms were modern, needed to be checked on. TV's are positioned in the middle of the restaurant which allows for a good view with any seat in the house. The entire restaurant has a modern look that I wouldn't expect from AZ. I would expect a place like this in OC, but I'm glad I stumbled into it.

BkCL-9l6zBKTc9r5U1875w.text: Scramble has quickly become a favorite weekend breakfast place for me. My breakfast of choice (as of right now, anyway) is their bacon and mushroom omelet with the roasted potatoes, wheat toast with a dab of butter, and a large iced chai tea. Love! They have lunch options as well, not just breakfast -- come hungry!   If you arrive and the line is out the door, don't worry -- it moves quickly. Place your order, grab your number and find a seat. They bring your meal to you after it's been made.    Seating is available inside or outside on a cute patio. Inside, one end has a couple TVs. For singles, there's great counter seating at the window overlooking the patio. The patio is dog-friendly.

BoL-xNvq-JtPCu7HjtU4Jg.text: Pretty good food!  I had the tofu scramble and the sweet potato hash browns. Those hash browns are amazing!!  Also the mango smoothie is really good.  My friend had the steak and eggs which he said was really good.  I would recommend to the cooks to add more veggies into the scramble but everything else was great!   There's an outside area which is dog friendly; always a plus in my book.  Just be careful because the misters soak the ground and make it super slippery.

wjjgUwS163XHyH7d9XZj-Q.text: Great atmosphere, very clean, great food (generous), I would come back. Only issue I have is you have to order and pay when you walk immediately (and tip) before you get any type of service, which was friendly ok at best. Then you have to bring your own drinks to your table? Really!? I couldn't carry my coffee, orange juice, my water, utensils, napkins, jam for toast, hot sauce for my eggs all at once, had to make several trips (not good). What's the point in tipping if I'm not getting any service? Oh yeah, I tipped for them to bring me my food lol :)

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and eggs

ynukRX25tYI8PTE49OKHrA.text: This was my second trip there.  The food was as good as the first time and the environment was different then the tricks too a restaurant ( in a good way).

kOGWN3izxWJ4_GufCmWFWg.text: Never had a bad meal here. Happy to take all visitors to Phoenix for there first breakfast in town. Thanks guys you rock.

HBymNPvaPjEtm_YQxNZ4LQ.text: A "shop small" locally owned breakfast restaurant. My absolute favorite meal is the Eggs Benedict Santa Fe style.  Unique and yummy! The have a check in offer so don't forget to use it. There is a line on Saturday & Sundays keep,that in mind. They serve  Souvia  Tea there.. Bonus!

jga8QFYuLHinBKIucIalmQ.text: This was The Breakfast Club - UYE 2nd meet up, and this time Scramble was picked for the place, it was at 10am on a Sunday, one thing I can say is that people must love Scramble because it was busy from the time we got their to the time we left.  As sometimes I do, I did a little research on the menu and I knew exactly what I wanted to try. The Santa Fe Eggs Benedict, eggs poached lying on top of cured ham with jalapeno corn bread below it and a yellow chipotle hollandaise sauce covering the dish, I also switched out the rosemary potatoes for the sweet potato hash, visually this dish looked freaking fantastic, however everything was lacking in flavor and my poached eggs I think came from a mini hen, barely any egg whites and small yokes,  the ham was good, had great flavor, I had high hopes for the jalapeno corn bread, taste buds were expecting to be hit with bits of jalapenos sadly that didn't happen, just seemed like dry corn bread, oh and the hollandaise sauce, have I told yall how much I love hollandaise sauce, oh high hopes for the sauce too, because cilantro, it has its own unique taste and smell and I just love the stuff, I love how it can go from a spicy dish to a sweet dish and add great flavor to what was already perfect! But the hollandaise sauce didn't have the hint of cilantro, and the sauce itself was lacking flavor, so I will continue my search for the great hollandaise sauce in the valley.  The sweet potato hash, ok I had no idea what to expect on this, it was bland like it needed some salt and pepper, but it was fresh, it had mushrooms, zucchini? and onions sauteed  mixed in with  slices of sweet potatoes, never thought of doing a sweet potato like that, now I know, going to have to try it at home!   I ordered the cinnamon roll too, just to try it, again visually great, but the roll was dry and hard and inedible but the icing was perfect.   Service seemed to be ok, for some tables they were on it and others it was eh, maybe they could work on that too.  I don't think I will go out of my way to come back, I came, I saw, wasn't thrilled, back to the east valley I went.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santa fe eggs benedicts with sweet potato hash
Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll

lXW_r3cfIVB96DjPA4cnvA.text: My experience here. I came in was greeted quick, and the staff was smiling which is always a plus.  Paige and Sarah were the ladies who helped me decide what to eat.   After friendly and helpful input from each gal, I ordered the Santa Fe Benedict. It was perfect. Eggs poached easy/med. Corn bread was moist and  a little sweet. Ham was mildly candied. The hollandaise sauce had a little spice with its perfect tang and consistency was like a warm creamy stew! Yum! It was served with hash browns that were seasoned and cooked just right. Although, they were slightly below a fresh hot temp. No problem though.  The rest of the staff was friendly with following up on me. Paige and Sarah both came to check on me as well! They were perfect employees by any fine dining standards.   If I am in Phoenix again I will have to return to try the paninis or the breakfast pizzas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santa Fe Benny! $ 9.5 cooked perfectly! Delicious

grn5OFvhPkiXVVgwioSJGw.text: Great place to have a burrito!  First time here.  Came with my husband and son and they also enjoyed their food.  Will for sure come back.

XXO089xTHUBPfpr5-MIbfQ.text: We came on a Saturday morning when it was extremely busy. After standing in line with my mom who uses a walker, we were next in line finally to order. A lady walks up to the other register and says "Can I help who's next?" So I walk up to the register with my mom and the lady didn't even acknowledge us. Receipts came up at the register and she sat there staring at them and then grabbed a muffin or something. Then she walked away with it without saying a word. I waited for her to come back and about 10 seconds later another worker asked me if I'd been helped. I told her what happened and all she did was apologize and ask if we wanted coffee with our order. She gave the cup for my mom and told us to order after the people at the other register were done and let her know we got coffee because they aren't supposed to open that register. The people who were BEHIND US in line. What's funny is that now as I sit here in the restaurant they have that second register open that they "weren't allowed to open." I am never coming back here again due to dealing with not only horrible customer service but just plain rudeness from this employee!

fumTkplaeZKOHjTLe9FdHA.text: The food's probably fine, but I wouldn't know because my husband found a band aid in his breakfast burrito. They refunded our money and apologized, but...band aid.

1xsiv5vnRr-6oURxTzj2GQ.text: A great place to visit evertime we head up to Phoenix. Usually a little busy and with the aluminum chairs, it tends to get a little noisy. My wife had the steak and eggs, I tried to tackle the blueberry stuffed French toast. Both were enjoyable and with fresh coffee, it was memorable. Try as I might, I could not finish. As always, we'll be back

bmfoAlaksebubWNsA1kFAA.text: Check out the breakfast pizza!  This place was so good and I look forward to checking out even more items. My bf and I are new to Phoenix and the cashier this morning gave us some really great recommendations of other places to try in the area. Will definitely be back!

i_Jto1asJN9SVtX5_WrAzA.text: I have driven by this place for quite some time and this morning we finally had the opportunity to stop. It was still pretty early so it wasn't that crowded. The restaurant is clean and bright and the service was wonderful. Everyone there had a smile on their face and was so nice and helpful.  You order, pay, get your number and then find a table. You are on your own for gathering napkins, silverware, straws, etc. but it was super easy to manage and not an issue for me. There are plenty of tvs to give you something to do while you are waiting or you can sit outside and enjoy the beautiful AZ fall weather.  We ordered the meat lovers scramble and the chocolate chip pancakes. We also both had an orange juice which was fantastic. I could have had 2 more glasses but we restrained ourselves. My scramble came wth an English muffin and hash browns. I wasn't a fan of the seasoning on the hash browns and they were only luke warm but my scramble was delicious as was my English muffin. My son had 2 huge chocolate chip pancakes with 2 pieces of bacon. He said the bacon was the best he has ever had. Breakfast was $25.00 not including tip.  We will definitely be returning to try some of the other menu items.

bRHLhP5V1nJPvcJFP2yAkQ.text: We ate here for the first time the other morning. The place was clean but it was very cold in there - the air was blowing the whole time. The metal chairs felt like we were sitting on ice cubes. Food came out quick. The bacon was under-cooked and had to go back. My hashbrowns had quite the spicy kick to them - almost tasted like they had chili powder or cayenne pepper in them which I didn't care for.  The eggs, pancakes and toast were good.

lgLEQxU0kbcY3BecomwBVg.text: Thoroughly unimpressed. None of us really liked our food and the chairs were uncomfortable. You order at the front with really no service whatsoever besides them bringing you your food which is an immediate minus in my mind. The hashbrowns tasted like black pepper. Not like potatoes with black pepper on them, they tasted just like black pepper straight out of a shaker. None of us will be going back. The prices were a little high also.

wCnNu1EVnJb4tKPx5OuYxg.text: The chocolate chip pancakes were delicious! The edges were crispy and they were full of mini chocolate chips. The alarm clock frozen coffee was very good and I was glad they had almond milk as a dairy free option, as I am lactose intolerant. My boyfriend had the mango strawberry smoothie and loved it too!

a8iK6aWUtkXi8Nkm63AZdA.text: This little breakfast place is delicious! I had passed it on my way to work everyday, and finally decided to go on a day off. I took the mister with me, and we were not disappointed! Everyone was friendly and helpful from the time we ordered to the time we left. My husband got the Chile Verde breakfast burrito, and I got the bacon & mushroom omelette. My side of fruit was fresh, and my Americano was a lifesaver. We will definitely come here for brunch again! The food was so good that I almost forgot to take a picture before we ate it all!

nRrw03w2eu-2lq-4KjQ-pA.text: Don't go here. It's expensive for what you get. It's not a sit down restaurant where you get served. Plastic plates and the food is strange. Weird eggs and cold toast. You've been warned.

TTrOFwocjwOkFg9wO7rL_g.text: Tasty food. Wonderful that it is so gluten-free friendly. Bf has allergies which makes it difficult to find good places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zh7kXLeUgkNocjIIAvRqqw.text: Good food. Excellent service and price. Went with friends in Phoenix on our way back to CA.  Very friendly accommodating staff.

tfw0MBFVycb4_ZTML1A7-Q.text: Yummy yummy !  Got the French toast , my brother got a western omelet. Both were fantastic . They have fresh OJ , organic ketchup! Clean place , great service . Will be back when in Phoenix!

dPWOijnZFuwYHZKq2c6I4g.text: So a last minute breakfast with a friend dictated the location, and Scramble was the logical choice. A line to the door (which soon spilled outside) gave a bit of hesitation but it moved quickly, and is a good sign.  Recommend that management open the second register on weekend mornings!  Had the meat lovers scramble... they easily accommodated an addition of Jalapenos, and I was in heaven.  Toast and hash-browns were just right was well.  Nothing fancy, but solid. I hear the French Toast call my name for a next visit, which I hope is soon!

CclqQ-k8Rh951KK-Wq2XMA.text: My family went to eat breakfast here two days in a row and we loved it! Everyone enjoyed their meal and everyone is so friendly and kind! I will definitely come here again when I'm in AZ again.

yVz22xdMfEJwQ_DJ4_s6MQ.text: Yummy breakfast pizza! Great friendly service in a fun and clean environment. Coffee was mediocre but the breakfast was very delicious. We appreciated the ordering style and the attentiveness of the waitstaff throughout our dining experience. Overall great time.

photos.caption: Photo of Scramble, a breakfast & lunch joint - Phoenix - Phoenix, AZ, United States

upnl9TzxuzNdWhPBJSywQA.text: Ordered the Chile Verde burrito and was not disappointed! Be warned: there is no spice to it whatsoever, but I came in with no expectations. Nice, light meal to start the day. They have a self serve coffee station that I don't really care for, but the dog friendly patio totally makes up for it!

ae9RIIi91c-c1koYg_4YBg.text: Stopped into Scramble on a Sunday morning. It was very busy so there was a line out the door. The line moved slowly but I guess that gave us time to decide what to order. I decided on the apple energy pancakes and bacon and my husband got the breakfast burrito with an orange juice.  We took a table inside. Since the place was packed, it was pretty noisy. And it took a while to get our food. My pancakes were good, just not what I was expecting. From the description I thought they might be a little crunchier, like have some granola in them, but they were more like a whole grain pancake I guess. And I don't think the syrup was real maple syrup - it was pretty thin. The bacon was decent and the pancakes weren't bad, just not like granolas pancakes I've had other places. My husband said the burrito was good, but again, nothing out of this world. His orange juice said Friday on the bottom of the cup. It was Sunday. Not too old I guess, but certainly not freshly squeezed.  Overall, I doubt we will be back. There was nothing that stood out enough to want it again when there are so many choices here in Phoenix.

V0pRGah6nqSG_ORhF37w7w.text: This place is awesome. Best breakfast burritos we have ever had. I had the southwest burrito and my husband had the chili verde burrito. We were visiting from Chicago so happy we stopped. I will be dreaming about it for awhile.

FkwdDrqnmT0qksBIgaunSw.text: I'd say that this is my favorite breakfast place ever! I'm not the biggest fan of breakfast, but Scramble makes me think so. I always order the eggs Benedict, specifically, the Florentine Benedict. I always substitute the English muffin for a biscuit because it makes it more buttery and tasty! This particular Benedict comes with spinach, tomato, poached eggs, and Hollandaise. So refreshing! They also have the best hot chai latte that I've had yet. It's warm and sweet, but not to sweet. You can taste the different flavors that blend together well. It doesn't have an overpowering flavor but it's not just milk. I am sad that Scramble isn't open all day because I find myself craving their chai! Oh, and their hashbrowns, phenomenal! Crunchy, flavorful, and perfect. I'm glad they they put salt and pepper on it. Salt and pepper are basic spices, but many places lack the basics. How sad is that? Long story short, I love Scramble.

lNc_AjQHoNWAreVNeG9uoA.text: Scramble is on our list of go-to places for breakfast. We had our first breakfast here back in 2013 and it wasn't as busy. While I'm happy for Scramble, selfishly I wish it wasn't as busy at times.  They vegetarian and glute-free options for breakfast and lunch. My partner loves the Gouda Brizza and orders it almost every time. I've tried many things on the menu and have never been disappointed.   Add in employees who always seem to be chipper and a dog-friendly patio and you're all set.

BmdweOW23_NuJl3vH7Efjg.text: Different dinning experience. They brought the food out to our table of four one at a time which caused the rest of us to have cold food while waiting for everyone to get their plate. Food was okay not great

WLaTPC4ASv1n_FJ5EGOYnA.text: I used to come here every weekend with my mom in the past and I don't remember it being this bad. Only one person was working the cash register so the line took forever.
